original: gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin las tha dad pa'i rnam par shes pa dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin las tha dad pa'i rnam par shes pa dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because consciousness that is separate from the intrinsic nature of form, etc. is not perceived.

original: dpe 'di nyid kyis rjes su dpog go zhe na /
analyzed: dpe 'di nyid kyis rjes su dpog go zhe na /
translated: If you say that this example is inferred,

original: ma yin te rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: no, because there is no inference.

original: grangs can pa rnams sems pa skyes bu zhes gtso bo'i gzhi mthun pa khas len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grangs can pa rnams sems pa skyes bu zhes gtso bo'i gzhi mthun pa khas len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The SƒÅ·πÉkhyas accept that the mind and the puru·π£a are a common locus.

original: de'i phyir gang ji ltar rig pa de de lta bu nyid du khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang ji ltar rig pa de de lta bu nyid du khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, whatever is known should be accepted as it is known.

original: goms las de lta bur 'gyur ba'i //
analyzed: goms las de lta bur 'gyur ba'i //
translated: The mind becomes like that through habituation.

original: gzugs sogs la gnas rig pa ni //
analyzed: gzugs sogs la gnas rig pa ni //
translated: The mind that abides in form, etc.üîΩwould exist as a transmigrator

original: gzugs sogs gzhan dang gzhan dag tu //üîΩ'pho ba nyid du yod par 'gyur ;
analyzed: gzugs sogs gzhan dang gzhan dag tu // 'pho ba nyid du yod par 'gyur ;
translated: from one form, etc., to another.

original: / rnam par shes pa dmigs pa ma gtogs pa gzhan dang 'dre ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: / rnam par shes pa dmigs pa ma gtogs pa gzhan dang 'dre ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Consciousness is not mixed with anything other than its object.

original: des na bde ba dang 'dres par byas pa ni //
analyzed: des na bde ba dang 'dres par byas pa ni //
translated: Therefore, that which is mixed with pleasure

original: gzugs la sogs pa dang 'dres par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa dang 'dres par 'gyur ro //
translated: would be mixed with form, etc.

original: gzugs la sogs pa dang 'dres par 'gyur ba ni goms pa las rtags kyi rnam pa thams cad bzung bas de'i rnam pa mtha' dag rtogs na gzhan gyi bde ba la sogs pa dang 'dre bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa dang 'dres par 'gyur ba ni goms pa las rtags kyi rnam pa thams cad bzung bas de'i rnam pa mtha' dag rtogs na gzhan gyi bde ba la sogs pa dang 'dre bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: When one has cultivated the apprehension of all the aspects of the signs, then one realizes all the aspects of the object, and one mixes with the happiness of others, etc.

original: 'o na ji ltar gzugs la sogs pa dang gzhan gyi bde ba la sogs pa dag logs shig tu gnas pa dag tu dmigs sha na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar gzugs la sogs pa dang gzhan gyi bde ba la sogs pa dag logs shig tu gnas pa dag tu dmigs sha na /
translated: But if form, etc., and the happiness of others, etc., exist separately, why are they not perceived?

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: rang gi ngo bor rig pa la //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bor rig pa la //
translated: The cognition of the nature of form, etc.,

original: logs gnas mi gnas yod min te //
analyzed: logs gnas mi gnas yod min te //
translated: does not exist separately, nor does it not exist separately.

original: 'di ni rten la ltos pa'i tha snyad 'ba' zhig yin par zad /
analyzed: 'di ni rten la ltos pa'i tha snyad 'ba' zhig yin par zad /
translated: This is merely a conventional expression that depends on a basis.

original: rang gi ngo bo rig pa las ma gtogs pa bde ba la sogs pa dang gzugs la sogs pa'i rig pa rnam pa gzhan ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo rig pa las ma gtogs pa bde ba la sogs pa dang gzugs la sogs pa'i rig pa rnam pa gzhan ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Apart from the cognition of its own nature, there is no other form of cognition of happiness, etc., or form, etc.

original: des na 'dis ni logs shig na gnas pa 'am gzhan yin no zhes bya ba'i rnam par dbye ba 'di ga la yod de /
analyzed: des na 'dis ni logs shig na gnas pa 'am gzhan yin no zhes bya ba'i rnam par dbye ba 'di ga la yod de /
translated: Therefore, how can there be a distinction here that it exists separately or is different?

original: lus kyi rten la ltos nas 'di ni logs shig pa'am gzhan yin no zhes tha snyad pa'i rnam par dbye ba 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: lus kyi rten la ltos nas 'di ni logs shig pa'am gzhan yin no zhes tha snyad pa'i rnam par dbye ba 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
translated: In dependence on the physical basis, it is merely a conventional distinction that it is separate or different.

original: gal te ltos pa med par ni //
analyzed: gal te ltos pa med par ni //
translated: If it were not in dependence,

original: de yi rang bzhin rig min no //
analyzed: de yi rang bzhin rig min no //
translated: its nature would not be known.

original: de yi rang bzhin rig pa la //
analyzed: de yi rang bzhin rig pa la //
translated: If its nature were known,

original: ltos pa gzhan ni yod min na //
analyzed: ltos pa gzhan ni yod min na //
translated: there would be no other dependence.

original: de brten de phyir don dam du //
analyzed: de brten de phyir don dam du //
translated: Therefore, ultimately,

original: rnam par dbye ba yod ma yin //
analyzed: rnam par dbye ba yod ma yin //
translated: there is no distinction.

original: dbye ni kun rdzob 'ba' zhig ste //
analyzed: dbye ni kun rdzob 'ba' zhig ste //
translated: The distinction is only conventional,

original: kun rdzob dpyad bzod nyid ma yin //
analyzed: kun rdzob dpyad bzod nyid ma yin //
translated: and the conventional cannot withstand analysis.

original: 'di nyid ni kun rdzob ces brjod de //
analyzed: 'di nyid ni kun rdzob ces brjod de //
translated: This is called the conventional,

original: rnam par dpyad na mi gnas pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par dpyad na mi gnas pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: because it does not endure when analyzed.

original: de lta ma /
analyzed: de lta ma /
translated: If it were not so,üîΩit would be ultimate.

original: yin // 'di nyid ni kun rdzob ces brjod de //
analyzed: yin // 'di nyid ni kun rdzob ces brjod de //
translated: This is called the conventional,

original: rnam par dpyad na mi gnas pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par dpyad na mi gnas pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: because it does not endure when analyzed.

original: de lta ma yin na don dam pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na don dam pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not so, it would be ultimate.

original: de'i phyir ji ltar gzugs la sogs pa dang / gzhan gyi @85a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar gzugs la sogs pa dang / gzhan gyi @85a * //
translated: Therefore, just as form and so on are not ultimate,

original: nus pa la sogs pa rnam par shes pa de'i bdag nyid kyis 'pho ba de bzhin du gzhan gyi khu khrag gis lus la yang yin no //
analyzed: nus pa la sogs pa rnam par shes pa de'i bdag nyid kyis 'pho ba de bzhin du gzhan gyi khu khrag gis lus la yang yin no //
translated: Just as the potential, etc., are transferred by the nature of that consciousness, so too is the body by the nature of the consciousness of the other.

original: de'i phyir / gang la rnam par shes pa'i rten bya ba dang bcas par 'gyur ba zhes bya bar nus pa zhes bya ba rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin gzhan ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / gang la rnam par shes pa'i rten bya ba dang bcas par 'gyur ba zhes bya bar nus pa zhes bya ba rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin gzhan ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, there is no other nature of consciousness that is called potential, etc., which would serve as the basis of consciousness.

original: 'on kyang de lta bur gyur pa de nyid rang rig pa ni /
analyzed: 'on kyang de lta bur gyur pa de nyid rang rig pa ni /
translated: However, that very consciousness, which is of that nature, is reflexive awareness.

original: rnam par shes pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa yin no //
translated: It is consciousness.

original: 'o na ji ltar de'i bdag nyid kyis 'phongs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid yin na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar de'i bdag nyid kyis 'phongs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid yin na /
translated: If it is the nature of consciousness that is transferred by its own nature,

original: ka ba la sogs pa mi g-yo /
analyzed: ka ba la sogs pa mi g-yo /
translated: why is it that pillars, etc., do not move?

original: rang gi lus bzhin du de yang g-yo bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: rang gi lus bzhin du de yang g-yo bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Like one‚Äôs own body, it would move.

original: de yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.üîΩIt is not that it moves

original: de bdag skyes pa tsam gyis ni //üîΩg-yo bar 'gyur ba ma yin te //
analyzed: de bdag skyes pa tsam gyis ni // g-yo bar 'gyur ba ma yin te //
translated: merely by the birth of its nature.

original: reg pa'i rnam shes khyad par can //
analyzed: reg pa'i rnam shes khyad par can //
translated: If the special contact consciousness

original: rang bzhin skyes na de 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin skyes na de 'gyur ro //
translated: arises by nature, it moves.

original: gang gi tshe reg pa'i rnam par shes pa rtsol ba'i rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin skyes na de'i tshe lus la sogs pa g-yo bar 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe reg pa'i rnam par shes pa rtsol ba'i rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin skyes na de'i tshe lus la sogs pa g-yo bar 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: When a consciousness that is the nature of a consciousness that is the activity of contact arises, then the body, etc. move, but not otherwise.

original: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa ni bzhugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa ni bzhugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid do //
translated: Therefore, consciousness is the nature of abiding, etc.

original: des na rdul phra rab so sor rig par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na rdul phra rab so sor rig par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it follows that each atom would be cognized.

original: khyed la yang ci'i phyir de ltar mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: khyed la yang ci'i phyir de ltar mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Why wouldn‚Äôt that be so for you?

original: de'i rnam pa can gyi rnam par shes pa gzhan skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rnam pa can gyi rnam par shes pa gzhan skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because another consciousness having its aspect arises.

original: kho bo cag gi yan lag can rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin yin gyi /
analyzed: kho bo cag gi yan lag can rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin yin gyi /
translated: For us, the whole is the nature of consciousness,

original: rdul phra rab dag ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rdul phra rab dag ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: but not of atoms.

original: de yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang ma yin te /
translated: That is not so,

original: rdul phra rab dag kyang de'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdul phra rab dag kyang de'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the atoms would also be its nature.

original: rdul phra rab dag ni tha dad par 'gyur ba nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: rdul phra rab dag ni tha dad par 'gyur ba nyid do zhe na /
translated: The atoms would be different.

original: 'o na ni med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na ni med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Well then, they would be nonexistent.

original: 'di ltar / phra rab rdul rnams lus kyi ni //üîΩngo bo nyid du rnam par gnas //üîΩlus ni phra rab rdul rnams kyi //
analyzed: 'di ltar / phra rab rdul rnams lus kyi ni // ngo bo nyid du rnam par gnas // lus ni phra rab rdul rnams kyi //
translated: Thus:üîΩThe subtle particles are the intrinsic reality of the body.

original: ngo bo nyid du rnam par gnas //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid du rnam par gnas //
translated: The body is the intrinsic reality of the subtle particles.

original: 'on te lus kyi rdul phra rab dag rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te lus kyi rdul phra rab dag rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin ma yin te /
translated: But the subtle particles of the body are not the intrinsic reality of consciousness.

original: de lta yin na /
analyzed: de lta yin na /
translated: If that were so,

original: rdul phra rab dag ni lus kyi ngo bo nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdul phra rab dag ni lus kyi ngo bo nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: the subtle particles would not be the intrinsic reality of the body.

original: rig par bya ba nyid ma yin pas yul gyi ngo bo yang ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rig par bya ba nyid ma yin pas yul gyi ngo bo yang ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they are not the intrinsic reality of the object, they are not the object of cognition.

original: rdul phra rab dag ni med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdul phra rab dag ni med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the subtle particles would not exist.

original: de'i phyir yan lag can 'ba' zhig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir yan lag can 'ba' zhig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the body would be a mere collection of parts.

original: de yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang ma yin te /
translated: But that is not so.üîΩBecause all the left limbs and so on would move,

original: lag sogs g-yon thams cad dag / g-yo bar 'gyur phyir 'ga' ba can //
analyzed: lag sogs g-yon thams cad dag / g-yo bar 'gyur phyir 'ga' ba can //
translated: it would have many agents.

original: las ni gcig la mi rung phyir //
analyzed: las ni gcig la mi rung phyir //
translated: Because one action is not possible,

original: gzhan du tha dad grub par 'gyur //
analyzed: gzhan du tha dad grub par 'gyur //
translated: it would be established as different.

original: @85b gcig bsgribs na ni thams cad dag / bsgribs par 'gyur ba'am ma bsgribs na //
analyzed: @85b gcig bsgribs na ni thams cad dag / bsgribs par 'gyur ba'am ma bsgribs na //
translated: If one is obstructed, all would be obstructed, or if one is not obstructed, all would be unobstructed.

original: mthong 'gyur gcig tshon gyis bsgyur na //
analyzed: mthong 'gyur gcig tshon gyis bsgyur na //
translated: If one part is colored, is the object colored or not?

original: bsgyur ba 'am ma bsgyur rtogs par 'gyur //
analyzed: bsgyur ba 'am ma bsgyur rtogs par 'gyur //
translated: If it is colored, then it is not one; if it is not colored, then one part is not colored.

original: yan lag can gyi rang bzhin gyi rdzas zhes bya ba ni bya ba can yon tan can ldan pa la sogs pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: yan lag can gyi rang bzhin gyi rdzas zhes bya ba ni bya ba can yon tan can ldan pa la sogs pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: The substance which is the nature of the whole is the cause of the qualities, actions, inherence, etc.

original: de la gal te bya ba yod na de'i tshe de'i du ba can gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir thams cad g-yo ba can nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la gal te bya ba yod na de'i tshe de'i du ba can gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir thams cad g-yo ba can nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If there is action, then, because it is the cause of that which has action, everything would be in motion.

original: yan lag can ni g-yo ba dang / mi g-yo ba sna tshogs pa'i rang bzhin yin no zhe na /
analyzed: yan lag can ni g-yo ba dang / mi g-yo ba sna tshogs pa'i rang bzhin yin no zhe na /
translated: If the whole has the nature of various motions and non-motions,

original: lha sbyin dang mchod sbyin la sogs pa'i gzugs g-yo ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yan lag can gcig yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lha sbyin dang mchod sbyin la sogs pa'i gzugs g-yo ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yan lag can gcig yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: then the form of Devadatta and Yaj√±adatta, etc., would be one whole which is the nature of motion, etc.

original: 'on te gcig nyid dang g-yo ba dang mi g-yo ba nyid du mthong ba'i phyir 'gal ba ci yod ce na /
analyzed: 'on te gcig nyid dang g-yo ba dang mi g-yo ba nyid du mthong ba'i phyir 'gal ba ci yod ce na /
translated: But if one sees that it is both one and in motion and not in motion, what is the contradiction?

original: gcig ces bya ba 'di ci yin /
analyzed: gcig ces bya ba 'di ci yin /
translated: What is this one?

original: gal te snang ba tha dad pa ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te snang ba tha dad pa ma yin na /
translated: If the appearances are not different,

original: de ni med do //
analyzed: de ni med do //
translated: it does not exist.

original: 'on te 'phras bu gcig pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: 'on te 'phras bu gcig pa nyid yin na /
translated: But if they are the same effect,

original: gal te 'bras bu gcig nyid yin mod /
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu gcig nyid yin mod /
translated: then, granted that they are the same effect,

original: rgyu yang gcig yin no zhes bya ba ga las /
analyzed: rgyu yang gcig yin no zhes bya ba ga las /
translated: how can they be the same cause?

original: yan lag can bsgribs na thams cad bsgribs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yan lag can bsgribs na thams cad bsgribs par 'gyur te /
translated: If the whole is obscured, the entire object is obscured,

original: ldan pa khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ldan pa khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the parts are not distinct from it.

original: yan lag bsgribs pa yin na yan lag can bsgribs pa ma yin pas thams cad mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yan lag bsgribs pa yin na yan lag can bsgribs pa ma yin pas thams cad mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the parts are obscured, the whole is not obscured, and so the whole would be seen.

original: yan lag gi sgo nas bsgribs na /
analyzed: yan lag gi sgo nas bsgribs na /
translated: If the parts are obscured in part,

original: cung zad mi mtho 'ba' ma ril bar mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: cung zad mi mtho 'ba' ma ril bar mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then only a part of the object would be seen.

original: gcig yin yang ril ba lta bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: gcig yin yang ril ba lta bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: But it is not possible to see a part of a pot.

original: mthong ba dang ma mthong ba dag ci ltar gcig nyid yin /
analyzed: mthong ba dang ma mthong ba dag ci ltar gcig nyid yin /
translated: How can the seen and the unseen be the same?

original: tshon gyis bsgyur ba la yang thal ba 'di nyid yin no //
analyzed: tshon gyis bsgyur ba la yang thal ba 'di nyid yin no //
translated: The same consequence would apply to the case of dyeing.

original: de'i phyir tshogs pa gcig yod min //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshogs pa gcig yod min //
translated: Therefore, the collection does not exist.

original: du ma nyid na snga ma bzhin //üîΩkhyad med phyir dang phra rab phyir /
analyzed: du ma nyid na snga ma bzhin // khyad med phyir dang phra rab phyir /
translated: If it is many, the same difficulty arises as before.

original: rtogs min zhe na khyad med par //
analyzed: rtogs min zhe na khyad med par //
translated: If you say that the atoms are not perceived because they are not distinct and because they are subtle,üîΩwe reply: No, because they are not distinct.

original: ma grub khyad par can rnams ni //
analyzed: ma grub khyad par can rnams ni //
translated: The special non-established ones

original: dbang yul de phyir phra rab min //
analyzed: dbang yul de phyir phra rab min //
translated: are not atoms, because of the sense-object.

original: gal te lus du ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te lus du ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If the body is not one,

original: du ma nyid yin na yang snga ma bzhin du skyon yod de /
analyzed: du ma nyid yin na yang snga ma bzhin du skyon yod de /
translated: then even if it is many, the error is the same as before.

original: rdul phra rab so sor rang rig par thal lo //
analyzed: rdul phra rab so sor rang rig par thal lo //
translated: It follows that the atoms are individually cognized.

original: khyad par med pa'i phyir mi rtogs so zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i phyir mi rtogs so zhe na /
translated: If you say that they are not cognized because there is no difference,

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: khyad par med pa nyid du ma grub bo //
analyzed: khyad par med pa nyid du ma grub bo //
translated: Because the difference is not established.

original: rig pa ni gnas skabs na dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rig pa ni gnas skabs na dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Cognition is the object of the present moment.

original: des na khyad par med pa mi dmigs pa nyid ma yin no //üîΩde nyid kyi phyir rang nyid rig pa'i @86a * //
analyzed: des na khyad par med pa mi dmigs pa nyid ma yin no // de nyid kyi phyir rang nyid rig pa'i @86a * //
translated: Therefore, the non-apprehension of difference is not non-apprehension itself.

original: gnas skabs na phra rab nyid kyang gegs byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir yod kyang med pa dang khyad par med pas rdul phran ma yin no //
analyzed: gnas skabs na phra rab nyid kyang gegs byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir yod kyang med pa dang khyad par med pas rdul phran ma yin no //
translated: For that very reason, even in the state of self-cognition, atomicity is not an obstruction, so it is not an atom because it is not different from non-existence.

original: khyed cag gi yang ji ltar yul dmigs she na /
analyzed: khyed cag gi yang ji ltar yul dmigs she na /
translated: How is the object apprehended in your case?

original: rang rig pa'i rang bzhin gyis yul dmigs pa ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang de rnam pa can gyi rnam par shes pa dmigs pa nyid yul dmigs pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: rang rig pa'i rang bzhin gyis yul dmigs pa ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang de rnam pa can gyi rnam par shes pa dmigs pa nyid yul dmigs pa nyid yin no //
translated: The nature of self-awareness does not perceive objects, but rather the consciousness that has aspects as its nature perceives objects.

original: ji ltar rdul phra rab kyi rnam pa med ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar rdul phra rab kyi rnam pa med ce na /
translated: How is it that there are no aspects of subtle particles?

original: 'di ni 'og nas bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'og nas bstan par bya'o //
translated: This will be explained later.

original: gal te rdul phra rab tsam yin na ji ltar bsgribs pa dang thogs pa la sogs pa yin zhe na /üîΩ'dis ni sgrib byed la sogs pa //
analyzed: gal te rdul phra rab tsam yin na ji ltar bsgribs pa dang thogs pa la sogs pa yin zhe na / 'dis ni sgrib byed la sogs pa //
translated: If it is the mere subtle particle, how can it be obstructed, impeded, and so on?üîΩThis also refutes

original: med pa dag kyang bsal ba yin //üîΩdngul chu gser sogs dang 'dres pa'am //
analyzed: med pa dag kyang bsal ba yin // dngul chu gser sogs dang 'dres pa'am //
translated: the nonexistence of obscuration and so on.üîΩHow can mercury mixed with gold

original: rdo tshan la sogs ji ltar snang //üîΩdbang sogs so sor nus med kyi //
analyzed: rdo tshan la sogs ji ltar snang // dbang sogs so sor nus med kyi //
translated: and so on appear?üîΩHow can the individual potencies of the sense faculties and so on

original: rtogs pa dag ni ji ltar yin //
analyzed: rtogs pa dag ni ji ltar yin //
translated: be cognized?

original: ldan las she na 'dir thal mtshungs //üîΩgal te gser dang dngul chu yi //
analyzed: ldan las she na 'dir thal mtshungs // gal te gser dang dngul chu yi //
translated: If you say it is due to possession, then this is a similar consequence.üîΩIf you say that the appearance

original: ldan pa snang ba yin zhe na //
analyzed: ldan pa snang ba yin zhe na //
translated: is the possession of gold and mercury,

original: rten mthong med par ga la rtogs //
analyzed: rten mthong med par ga la rtogs //
translated: how can it be cognized without seeing the basis?

original: ro gzugs la sogs ldan par 'gal //
analyzed: ro gzugs la sogs ldan par 'gal //
translated: It is contradictory for form and so on to be possessed.

original: gal te nye bar brtags pa las //
analyzed: gal te nye bar brtags pa las //
translated: If you examine this,

original: 'dod na blo tha dad par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'dod na blo tha dad par 'gyur //
translated: then in your opinion, the cognition would be different.

original: ji ltar phreng ring zhes byar 'gyur //üîΩde ldan rang gi ngo bo dang // brjod pa dag las tha dad pa //
analyzed: ji ltar phreng ring zhes byar 'gyur // de ldan rang gi ngo bo dang // brjod pa dag las tha dad pa //
translated: How could it be called a long garland?

original: grangs ldan las la sogs pa yi //
analyzed: grangs ldan las la sogs pa yi //
translated: The cognition of number, etc.

original: ngo bo'ang blo la mi snang ngo //
analyzed: ngo bo'ang blo la mi snang ngo //
translated: does not appear in the cognition,üîΩbecause it is not the nature of the cognition, nor is it separate from the nature of the cognition and the expression.

original: rdul phra rab rnams 'byar ba med pa'i phyir ji ltar sgrib par byed pa yin zhes bya ba ni 'thad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams 'byar ba med pa'i phyir ji ltar sgrib par byed pa yin zhes bya ba ni 'thad pa ma yin te /
translated: How can the atoms obstruct, since they do not touch?

original: gang gis de med pas rdul phra rab rnams la de mi 'gyur ba yan lag can dang 'brel ba'i sgrib pa ni gar yang dmigs pa med do //
analyzed: gang gis de med pas rdul phra rab rnams la de mi 'gyur ba yan lag can dang 'brel ba'i sgrib pa ni gar yang dmigs pa med do //
translated: Since there is no obstruction in the atoms, there is no obstruction in the aggregates, because they are not different from the atoms.

original: de bzhin du thogs pa la sogs pa yang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du thogs pa la sogs pa yang ngo //
translated: The same is true of resistance, etc.

original: 'on te 'di skad brjod de /üîΩgser dang bcas phyir rdul phran ni //
analyzed: 'on te 'di skad brjod de / gser dang bcas phyir rdul phran ni //
translated: But if you say:üîΩThe atoms are not obstructed,

original: tshogs pa snam bu la sogs pa'am //üîΩchu dang nyi ma la sogs pa'i //
analyzed: tshogs pa snam bu la sogs pa'am // chu dang nyi ma la sogs pa'i //
translated: because they are not combined,üîΩthen how can the atoms be combined

original: skabs su de ni ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: skabs su de ni ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: in a cloth, etc., or in water, the sun, etc.?

original: phan tshun nang du 'jug pa la gegs med pa'i rdul phra rab rnams nyid 'ba' zhig yan lag ldan pa med par ji ltar sgrib par byed pa la brten zhe na /
analyzed: phan tshun nang du 'jug pa la gegs med pa'i rdul phra rab rnams nyid 'ba' zhig yan lag ldan pa med par ji ltar sgrib par byed pa la brten zhe na /
translated: But how can the subtle particles, which are devoid of internal interstice and which are devoid of parts, obstruct one another?

original: 'dir bshad pa reg pa med par ji ltar yan lag can skyed par byed /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa reg pa med par ji ltar yan lag can skyed par byed /
translated: Here we say: How can that which is devoid of contact generate that which has parts?

original: reg pa yang phyogs gcig gi ni ma yin te /
analyzed: reg pa yang phyogs gcig gi ni ma yin te /
translated: And contact is not by one part,

original: de med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that does not exist.

original: bdag nyid thams cad kyis kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag nyid thams cad kyis kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it by the whole,

original: gong du rdul phra rab tsam du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gong du rdul phra rab tsam du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because then the subtle particles would be whole.

original: ldan pa'i @86b don gzhan skyed pas so zhe na /
analyzed: ldan pa'i @86b don gzhan skyed pas so zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is by generating another object of possession,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: This is not so.üîΩüîΩ

original: ldan pa de nyid bar dang bcas pa dag gis ci ltar skyed par byed ces thal ba mtshungs so //
analyzed: ldan pa de nyid bar dang bcas pa dag gis ci ltar skyed par byed ces thal ba mtshungs so //
translated: How can that which is possessed of interstice generate that which is not possessed of interstice?üîΩThe consequence is the same.

original: reg na gong bu rdul phra rab tsam du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: reg na gong bu rdul phra rab tsam du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If there is contact, the mass would be just the size of a subtle particle.

original: gal te reg pa yin na ldan pa gzhan nam de bzhin du yan lag can gyis ci zhig bya /
analyzed: gal te reg pa yin na ldan pa gzhan nam de bzhin du yan lag can gyis ci zhig bya /
translated: If there is contact, what is the use of another object of possession or of that which has parts?

original: 'on te bar dang bcas pa nyid ldan pa dang / yan lag can skyed par byed na /
analyzed: 'on te bar dang bcas pa nyid ldan pa dang / yan lag can skyed par byed na /
translated: But if it is endowed with an interval, and if it produces the whole,

original: de lta yin na sgrib pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu yang ci ste skyed par mi byed /
analyzed: de lta yin na sgrib pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu yang ci ste skyed par mi byed /
translated: then why does it not produce the effect of obstruction, etc.?

original: gang la brdegs kyang so sor ni //
analyzed: gang la brdegs kyang so sor ni //
translated: That which, when struck,

original: 'gyes par mi 'gyur ba de ni //üîΩreg pa med kyang phra rab kyi //
analyzed: 'gyes par mi 'gyur ba de ni // reg pa med kyang phra rab kyi //
translated: does not break up into parts,üîΩis not a tangible object,

original: rdul rnams tshogs pa 'ba' zhig yin//
analyzed: rdul rnams tshogs pa 'ba' zhig yin//
translated: but is only an aggregation of atoms.

original: skra dang sbrang ma sha la sogs pa yul bar dang bcas par gnas pa yin yang lings po gcig gi rnam pa can gyi shes pa skyed par byed pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: skra dang sbrang ma sha la sogs pa yul bar dang bcas par gnas pa yin yang lings po gcig gi rnam pa can gyi shes pa skyed par byed pa de bzhin du /
translated: Even though the object, such as hair, a bee, meat, etc., is situated with intervals, it produces a cognition that has the aspect of a single mass.

original: 'bras bu gzhan yang ci ste skyed par mi byed /
analyzed: 'bras bu gzhan yang ci ste skyed par mi byed /
translated: In the same way, why does it not produce another effect?

original: der gnod par byed pa mthong ba'i phyir de lta ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: der gnod par byed pa mthong ba'i phyir de lta ma yin no zhe na /
translated: It is not so, because we see that it is obstructed.

original: 'di yang gal te rnal 'byor pa yod na dbang po las 'das pa'i don mthong ba rnal 'byor pa'i shes pa gnod par byed pa yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di yang gal te rnal 'byor pa yod na dbang po las 'das pa'i don mthong ba rnal 'byor pa'i shes pa gnod par byed pa yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is also the case if the yogin exists, because the yogin‚Äôs cognition that sees the object beyond the range of the senses is obstructed.

original: dper na bu ga dang bcas pa'i snod steng bkag na chu mi 'dzag pa bzhin du rdul phra rab 'dus pa yang yin no //
analyzed: dper na bu ga dang bcas pa'i snod steng bkag na chu mi 'dzag pa bzhin du rdul phra rab 'dus pa yang yin no //
translated: For example, water does not leak out of a vessel with a hole in it when it is turned upside down; in the same way, the atoms that are combined do not leak out.

original: yang na / dngul chu gser dang ldan pa 'am //üîΩrdo tshan la sogs pa dag / yan lag can med par sgrib pa dang thogs pa la sogs pa 'am /üîΩso sor gyes pa la sogs pa 'bras bu gzhan byed par ji ltar nus /üîΩde ni khyad par can gyi 'dus pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rgyu khyad par can las skyes pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na / dngul chu gser dang ldan pa 'am // rdo tshan la sogs pa dag / yan lag can med par sgrib pa dang thogs pa la sogs pa 'am / so sor gyes pa la sogs pa 'bras bu gzhan byed par ji ltar nus / de ni khyad par can gyi 'dus pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rgyu khyad par can las skyes pa yin te /
translated: Or else, mercury mixed with gold,

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ni bsam gyis mi khyab bo //üîΩ'di ltar gzugs la sogs pa so sor rnam par shes pa skyed par mi nus pa de lta na yang /üîΩtshogs pa'i gnas skabs na skyed par byed do //üîΩldan pa las yin no zhe na /üîΩldan pa yang 'bras bu nyid ma yin nam /üîΩde nyid ji ltar skyed par byed /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ni bsam gyis mi khyab bo //üîΩ'di ltar gzugs la sogs pa so sor rnam par shes pa skyed par mi nus pa de lta na yang /üîΩtshogs pa'i gnas skabs na skyed par byed do //üîΩldan pa las yin no zhe na /üîΩldan pa yang 'bras bu nyid ma yin nam /üîΩde nyid ji ltar skyed par byed /
translated: or salt dissolved in water, or the heat of fire mixed with the heat of water, or the heat of water mixed with the heat of a clod of earth, or the heat of a clod of earth mixed with the heat of the sun, or the heat of the sun mixed with the heat of the moon, or the heat of the moon mixed with the heat of the wind, or the heat of the wind mixed with the heat of the stars, or the heat of the stars mixed with the heat of the clouds, or the heat of the clouds mixed with the heat of rain, or the heat of rain mixed with the heat of lightning, or the heat of lightning mixed with the heat of thunder, or the heat of thunder mixed with the heat of the sky, or the heat of the sky mixed with the heat of the earth, or the heat of the earth mixed with the heat of the water, or the heat of the water mixed with the heat of the fire, or the heat of the fire mixed with the heat of the wind, or the heat of the wind mixed with the heat of the stars, or the heat of the stars mixed with the heat of the moon, or the heat of the moon mixed with the heat of the sun, or the heat of the sun mixed with the heat of the clouds, or the heat of the clouds mixed with the heat of the rain, or the heat of the rain mixed with the heat of the lightning, or the heat of the lightning mixed with the heat of the thunder, or the heat of the thunder mixed with the heat of the sky, or the heat of the sky mixed with the heat of the earth, or the heat of the earth mixed with the heat of the water, or the heat of the water mixed with the heat of the fire, or the heat of the fire mixed with the heat of the wind, or the heat of the wind mixed with the heat of the stars, or the heat of the stars mixed with the heat of the moon, or the heat of the moon mixed with the heat of the sun, or the heat of the sun mixed with the heat of the clouds, or the heat of the clouds mixed with the heat of the rain, or the heat of the rain mixed with the heat of the lightning

original: ldan pa ni snang ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: ldan pa ni snang ba yang ma yin te /
translated: and it is not the case that the object is perceived when the sense faculty is perceived,

original: rten ma mthong bar rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten ma mthong bar rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the object is not perceived when the sense faculty is not perceived.

original: rten mthong ba med par yang rtogs na ni /
analyzed: rten mthong ba med par yang rtogs na ni /
translated: If the object were perceived when the sense faculty is not perceived,

original: dbang po dang don phrad pa las mngon sum du skye'o zhes bya ba ni gzhung lugs yin no //
analyzed: dbang po dang don phrad pa las mngon sum du skye'o zhes bya ba ni gzhung lugs yin no //
translated: then the theory that perception arises from the contact of the sense faculty and the object would be untenable.

original: phrad pa yang ldan pa nyid do //
analyzed: phrad pa yang ldan pa nyid do //
translated: Contact is the same as possession.

original: de'i tshe ldan pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i tshe ldan pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
translated: At that time, the object would be the cause of the sense faculty,

original: ldan pa dang rnam par dbye ba'i rgyu ma yin pa ni yon tan yin no zhes bya ba @87a * //
analyzed: ldan pa dang rnam par dbye ba'i rgyu ma yin pa ni yon tan yin no zhes bya ba @87a * //
translated: and the sense faculty would not be the cause of the possession and the separation of the object.

original: yon tan gyi mtshan nyid nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yon tan gyi mtshan nyid nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, the definition of a quality would be impaired.

original: 'on te 'byor ba dang 'phrod pas 'dus pa'i phyir rtogs par bya ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te 'byor ba dang 'phrod pas 'dus pa'i phyir rtogs par bya ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the object is perceived because of the combination of the sense faculty and the object,

original: de lta na ni 'o na rdul phra rab la ldan pa yod par rdul phra rab rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na rdul phra rab la ldan pa yod par rdul phra rab rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: then the subtle atom would be perceived because it has possession.

original: yan lag can brtags pa don med do //
analyzed: yan lag can brtags pa don med do //
translated: Therefore, the postulation of the whole is meaningless.

original: ldan pa thams cad kyang mthong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ldan pa thams cad kyang mthong bar 'gyur te /
translated: And all possession would be perceived.

original: des na rgyang ring po nas mi 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na rgyang ring po nas mi 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that it does not apprehend objects at a distance.

original: der ni dbang po'i ldan pa nyid med do zhe na /
analyzed: der ni dbang po'i ldan pa nyid med do zhe na /
translated: But it is not the case that the sense faculty is present there.

original: rags pa rnams kyang mi rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rags pa rnams kyang mi rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then gross objects would not be apprehended.üîΩBut if you accept that the sense faculty is present there,

original: 'on te ldan pa las skyes pa'i ldan pa yang 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on te ldan pa las skyes pa'i ldan pa yang 'dod pa yin no //
translated: then you are accepting that the sense faculty is produced from the sense faculty.

original: ldan pa dang rnam par dbye ba'i rgyu ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni 'du ba can gyi rgyu bkag pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ldan pa dang rnam par dbye ba'i rgyu ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni 'du ba can gyi rgyu bkag pa yin no zhe na /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúnot a cause of the separation of the sense faculty‚Äù means that it is not a cause of the collection of the sense faculty.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: 'du ba ni 'di la'o snyam pa'i blo'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'du ba ni 'di la'o snyam pa'i blo'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the collection is the cause of the cognition ‚Äúthis is here.‚Äù

original: ldan pa yang gal te brtags na gor ma chag par 'di la'o snyam pa'i blo skyed par byed do //
analyzed: ldan pa yang gal te brtags na gor ma chag par 'di la'o snyam pa'i blo skyed par byed do //
translated: If the sense faculty is imagined to be present there, then the cognition ‚Äúthis is here‚Äù is certainly produced.

original: des na phrad pa 'du ba can gyi rgyu yang 'thob bo //
analyzed: des na phrad pa 'du ba can gyi rgyu yang 'thob bo //
translated: Therefore, the collection is also the cause of contact.üîΩMoreover,

original: gzhan yang / gal te 'byor pa dang 'du ba //üîΩ'dzin pa'i rgyu ni yin 'gyur na //
analyzed: gzhan yang / gal te 'byor pa dang 'du ba // 'dzin pa'i rgyu ni yin 'gyur na //
translated: if the sense faculty and the objectüîΩwere the cause of the apprehension,

original: rdul phran rnams la ldan yod pas //
analyzed: rdul phran rnams la ldan yod pas //
translated: then the atoms would have the sense faculty,

original: rdzas ni 'dzin par 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: rdzas ni 'dzin par 'gyur ba yin //
translated: and the substance would be apprehended.

original: gal te 'byor pa dang 'du ba yang 'dzin pa'i rgyu yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'byor pa dang 'du ba yang 'dzin pa'i rgyu yin na /
translated: If the possession of wealth and the possession of a group are causes of grasping,

original: de'i tshe 'bras bu'i rdzas kyi ldan pa don med do //
analyzed: de'i tshe 'bras bu'i rdzas kyi ldan pa don med do //
translated: then the possession of the substance of the effect is useless.

original: rdul phra rab kyi ldan pa nyid kyis 'bras bu'i rdzas mthong ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: rdul phra rab kyi ldan pa nyid kyis 'bras bu'i rdzas mthong ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because the substance of the effect is seen through the possession of the atoms.

original: 'on te 'bras bu'i rdzas srid pas /
analyzed: 'on te 'bras bu'i rdzas srid pas /
translated: But if the substance of the effect exists,

original: rdul phra rab kyi ldan pa brtag par bya ba ma yin na /
analyzed: rdul phra rab kyi ldan pa brtag par bya ba ma yin na /
translated: then the possession of the atoms is not to be imagined.

original: rdul phra rab kyi ldan pa nyid las bum pa la sogs pa mthong bas yan lag can rtog pa don med pa'i phyir nyes pa de nyid yin no //
analyzed: rdul phra rab kyi ldan pa nyid las bum pa la sogs pa mthong bas yan lag can rtog pa don med pa'i phyir nyes pa de nyid yin no //
translated: Because the whole is seen from the possession of the atoms, the pot, etc., the imagination of the whole is useless. Therefore, the fault is just the same.

original: 'on te yan lag can yod na rdul phra rab kyi ldan pa rtog gi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te yan lag can yod na rdul phra rab kyi ldan pa rtog gi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But if the possession of the atoms is imagined when the whole exists, not otherwise,

original: 'di ni bzlog pa la yang mtshungs so //
analyzed: 'di ni bzlog pa la yang mtshungs so //
translated: this is the same in reverse.

original: yan lag can ldan na rdul phra rab ldan pa ma yin na ni ma yin te //
analyzed: yan lag can ldan na rdul phra rab ldan pa ma yin na ni ma yin te //
translated: If the possession of the atoms is not when the possession of the whole is,

original: yul dang dus mtshungs pa nyid kyis rnam par dbyer med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul dang dus mtshungs pa nyid kyis rnam par dbyer med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the identity of place and time, there is no distinction.

original: yang na rtogs pa'i yan lag can la yang ldan pa yin pas mthong ba'i ldan pa la yang ldan pa yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na rtogs pa'i yan lag can la yang ldan pa yin pas mthong ba'i ldan pa la yang ldan pa yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Or else, since the possessor of the parts is also the possessor of the whole, the possessor of the whole would also be the possessor of the possessor of the parts.

original: gzhan yang 'byor pa dang 'phrod pas 'du ba las mthong ba'i phyir /üîΩgzugs dang ro la sogs pa yang dag par ldan par /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'byor pa dang 'phrod pas 'du ba las mthong ba'i phyir / gzugs dang ro la sogs pa yang dag par ldan par /
translated: Moreover, since one sees the whole in the combination of the parts and the qualities,

original: btung ba la sogs pa mthong bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: btung ba la sogs pa mthong bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: one would not see the whole in the combination of form, taste, etc.

original: yon tan la yon tan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yon tan la yon tan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the quality does not exist in the quality.

original: de la gzugs sam @87b ro de yan lag rnams ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de la gzugs sam @87b ro de yan lag rnams ni ma yin no //
translated: But the form or taste of the parts is not the whole.

original: nye bar brtags pa las de ltar bsnyad pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: nye bar brtags pa las de ltar bsnyad pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is so designated because of the designation of the parts,

original: blo tha dad par thal lo //
analyzed: blo tha dad par thal lo //
translated: then there would be a difference in the cognition.

original: zho la sogs pa yan lag rnams kyi gzugs sam ro gang yin pa de nyid don gcig la 'du ba las nye bar brtags pa yin gyi gzugs dang ro gzhan dmigs par mi 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: zho la sogs pa yan lag rnams kyi gzugs sam ro gang yin pa de nyid don gcig la 'du ba las nye bar brtags pa yin gyi gzugs dang ro gzhan dmigs par mi 'gyur ro ;
translated: The form or taste of the parts, such as curds, etc., is designated as the whole in the combination of the parts, but the form and taste of the whole are not perceived as different.

original: / ldan pa can rnams kyi gzugs gang yin pa de nyid lta ba'i yang yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: / ldan pa can rnams kyi gzugs gang yin pa de nyid lta ba'i yang yin par 'gyur te /
translated: The form of the possessor of the parts would be the same as the form of the whole,

original: nye bar brtags pa las der gzugs dang ro gzhan du ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: nye bar brtags pa las der gzugs dang ro gzhan du ga la 'gyur /
translated: How could the form and taste be different there?

original: 'on te gzugs dang ro de dag nyid /
analyzed: 'on te gzugs dang ro de dag nyid /
translated: But if the form and taste are themselves perceived as such,

original: phrad pa las de ltar snang ba yin te /
analyzed: phrad pa las de ltar snang ba yin te /
translated: because of the contact,

original: de dag shin tu 'dres pa la ni gcig tu rtogs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag shin tu 'dres pa la ni gcig tu rtogs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then the cause of the cognition of one thing is the complete intermingling of the two.

original: ro dang gzugs gzhan du mngon pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ro dang gzugs gzhan du mngon pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if the form and taste are perceived as different,

original: de lta na ni 'o na yan lag can gzhan gyis ci yang byar med de /
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na yan lag can gzhan gyis ci yang byar med de /
translated: then the whole is useless,

original: rdul phra rab snang ba nyid la de ltar rags pa la sogs pa'i tha snyad dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: rdul phra rab snang ba nyid la de ltar rags pa la sogs pa'i tha snyad dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: because the atoms are perceived as coarse, etc.

original: gzhan yang gal te rdul phra rab nyid rags pa la sogs pa'i rtogs pa ma yin na /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te rdul phra rab nyid rags pa la sogs pa'i rtogs pa ma yin na /
translated: Moreover, if the atom itself is not perceived as coarse, etc.,

original: de'i phreng ring ngo zhes bya bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phreng ring ngo zhes bya bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then it would not be said that ‚Äúthe line is long.‚Äù

original: phreng zhes bya ba ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: phreng zhes bya ba ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /

original: de nyid phyir de rdzas ma yin //
analyzed: de nyid phyir de rdzas ma yin //

original: rigs sogs la ni ring nyid med //
analyzed: rigs sogs la ni ring nyid med //

original: de ni rigs sogs 'dod pa 'ang min //
analyzed: de ni rigs sogs 'dod pa 'ang min //

original: bkod pa yin ni khyad par gyis //
analyzed: bkod pa yin ni khyad par gyis //

original: ji ltar ring sogs blor 'gyur ba //üîΩdes na de bzhin blo des ni //
analyzed: ji ltar ring sogs blor 'gyur ba // des na de bzhin blo des ni //

original: rdul phran rnams la yin par rigs //
analyzed: rdul phran rnams la yin par rigs //
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable that the cognition is of the atoms.

original: dper na phreng ba la sogs pa'i ring po la sogs pa'i bkod pa nyid yin pa de bzhin du rtsod pa'i gnas yan lag can gyi yul du mngon par 'dod pa yang yin pa'i phyir yan lag can med do //üîΩgang yang dbang po la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: dper na phreng ba la sogs pa'i ring po la sogs pa'i bkod pa nyid yin pa de bzhin du rtsod pa'i gnas yan lag can gyi yul du mngon par 'dod pa yang yin pa'i phyir yan lag can med do // gang yang dbang po la sogs pa ni /
translated: Just as the arrangement of a garland, etc. is length, etc., in the same way, the cognition of the whole is also the object of dispute, because it is accepted as the object of the whole.üîΩAlso, the cognition of the whole arises from the possession of the sense faculties, etc.

original: ldan pa las yan lag can nam gzhan la blo skyed par byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod pa de la smras pa ni /
analyzed: ldan pa las yan lag can nam gzhan la blo skyed par byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod pa de la smras pa ni /

analyzed: ldan pa la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo ni dmigs pa med do //

original: gzugs la sogs pa dang ldan pa can 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa dang ldan pa can 'ba' zhig tu zad do //

analyzed: de la ldan pa gzhan dmigs pa'i spyod yul du 'gyur ba med do //

analyzed: 'byor pa yin no zhes blos bzung ba'i ji ltar de bzhin du ma yin no zhe na /

analyzed: 'byor pa zhes bya ba ni ldan pa can nyid kyi rtogs pa yin no // 'byor pa'i sgra la 'dir dmigs pa gzhan ni yod pa ma yin no //

original: der ni nye bar skyes gyur pa //
analyzed: der ni nye bar skyes gyur pa //

original: de la ldan pa @88a * //
analyzed: de la ldan pa @88a * //

original: can dag 'ba' zhig ni //
analyzed: can dag 'ba' zhig ni //

original: 'byor pa rtogs pa'i yul yin te //
analyzed: 'byor pa rtogs pa'i yul yin te //

original: de las 'byor gzhan yod ma yin //üîΩji ltar don de mdun gnas pa //
analyzed: de las 'byor gzhan yod ma yin // ji ltar don de mdun gnas pa //
translated: There is no other endowment apart from that.üîΩIs the possessor of the object

original: ldan pa de bzhin gnas sam ci //üîΩrjes 'gro ldog pa dag las ni //
analyzed: ldan pa de bzhin gnas sam ci // rjes 'gro ldog pa dag las ni //
translated: in the same place as the object?üîΩPossession is understood from

original: ldan pa la sogs rtogs pa yin //üîΩldan pa can las tha dad pa'i ldan pa gzhan ni snang ba med de /
analyzed: ldan pa la sogs rtogs pa yin // ldan pa can las tha dad pa'i ldan pa gzhan ni snang ba med de /

original: 'ba' zhig pa ma 'byor pa dag la ni gnas skabs de ma dmigs la /
analyzed: 'ba' zhig pa ma 'byor pa dag la ni gnas skabs de ma dmigs la /

analyzed: de la ni dmigs pa des na 'di ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las brtags pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do zhes bya bar yid ches so //

analyzed: mngon sum gyis de lta bur gyur pa 'di 'dra bar 'gyur ro zhes rtogs pa yin no //

analyzed: des na gnas skabs de nyid ldan pa zhes logs shig tu rnam par 'jog pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the state of being endowed with the object is posited as something separate.

analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir / sgra shes dngos po tha dad pa'i //

original: rjes 'brang rnam rtog btags don can //
analyzed: rjes 'brang rnam rtog btags don can //

analyzed: dper na yon tan la sogs pa'am // zhig dang ma skyes dag la bzhin // sgra'i shes pa mi mthun pa tsam gyis ni //
translated: just as the cognition of a quality and so onüîΩis not different from the cognition of a substance.üîΩThe cognition of sound is not a different object

original: don tha dad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: don tha dad pa ma yin te /

analyzed: 'on kyang mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid kyi shes pa tha dad pa yin no //

original: rnam par rtog pa tsam gyi blo ni thog ma med pa'i bag chags kyi stobs las skye ba na /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa tsam gyi blo ni thog ma med pa'i bag chags kyi stobs las skye ba na /

analyzed: de lta de ltar bslad par 'gyur ba yin pas de las don gyi de nyid gnas par 'gyur ba ma yin no //

original: de la ldan pa la sogs pa'i blo ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pas brtags pa'i tha dad pa la brten nas 'gyur ba yin te //
analyzed: de la ldan pa la sogs pa'i blo ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pas brtags pa'i tha dad pa la brten nas 'gyur ba yin te //
translated: The cognition of possession, etc. is based on the difference that is imagined through positive and negative concomitance.

original: des na brtags pa nyid tha dad pa yin gyi don gyi de kho na nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: des na brtags pa nyid tha dad pa yin gyi don gyi de kho na nyid ni ma yin no //

original: rnam par brtags pa'i don tha dad pa ni mu stegs byed gzhan gyi lta ba las kyang skye'o //
analyzed: rnam par brtags pa'i don tha dad pa ni mu stegs byed gzhan gyi lta ba las kyang skye'o //

original: de las kyang don gyi de nyid rnam par gnas na thug pa med do //
analyzed: de las kyang don gyi de nyid rnam par gnas na thug pa med do //
translated: And if the reality of the object is established from that, there is an infinite regress.

original: de ltar khas len na ni phan tshun rtsod par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar khas len na ni phan tshun rtsod par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If one accepts that, then there would be no mutual dispute.

original: de'i phyir sgra dang shes pa tha dad pa ni bag chags kyi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pas rnam par rtog pas brtags pa'i don la 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir sgra dang shes pa tha dad pa ni bag chags kyi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pas rnam par rtog pas brtags pa'i don la 'jug pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the difference between sound and cognition is the engagement in the object that is imagined by conceptual thought through positive and negative concomitance with latent impressions.

original: rnam par brtags pa de ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: rnam par brtags pa de ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /

analyzed: dngos po tha dad rjes 'brang ba can te dngos po rnams kyi tha dad pa ni de lta bum yin pa dag las ldog pa'o //

original: ldog pa yang ldog pa can las gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: ldog pa yang ldog pa can las gzhan ma yin te /

analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid rgyun la ltos te nang gi dbye ba tha dad par snang ba yin no //

analyzed: ci ste dngos @88b po tha dad pa med par rtogs pa tha dad pa ma mthong ngo zhe na //
translated: But if you think that the difference of the cognition is not seen without the difference of the thing,

original: 'jug pa kho na ste /
analyzed: 'jug pa kho na ste /
translated: then it is just the opposite.

original: 'di ni mthong ba yin no //üîΩdper na yon tan dag la yon tan gcig go //
analyzed: 'di ni mthong ba yin no // dper na yon tan dag la yon tan gcig go //

original: 'du ba gcig go yon tan nyi shu rtsa bzhi'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'du ba gcig go yon tan nyi shu rtsa bzhi'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, in regard to the qualities, one says, ‚ÄúOne quality,‚Äù ‚ÄúOne collection,‚Äù ‚ÄúTwenty-four qualities.‚Äù

original: de la grangs ni med de /
analyzed: de la grangs ni med de /

original: grangs ni rdzas la brten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grangs ni rdzas la brten pa'i phyir ro //

original: rten ni grangs nye bar brtags pa la ma yin te /
analyzed: rten ni grangs nye bar brtags pa la ma yin te /

analyzed: rten tha dad kyang spyi la sogs pa gcig nyid yin no //

analyzed: zhig pa dang ma skyes pa dag la yang ji ltar gcig la sogs pa yin /
translated: How could one and so on be applied to that which has disintegrated and that which has not yet arisen?

original: gal te 'di ltar brtags 'dod na //üîΩrgyu mtshan gang gis de 'dod pa //
analyzed: gal te 'di ltar brtags 'dod na // rgyu mtshan gang gis de 'dod pa //
translated: If you assert this after investigating in this way,üîΩwhy do you assert that

original: de nyid dngos po thams cad la de dag gi rgyur cis mi 'dod /
analyzed: de nyid dngos po thams cad la de dag gi rgyur cis mi 'dod /
translated: those are the reasons for all things?

original: gal te zhig pa dang ma skyes pa dag la gcig nyid la sogs pa nye bar brtags pa las de ltar brjod pa dang rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te zhig pa dang ma skyes pa dag la gcig nyid la sogs pa nye bar brtags pa las de ltar brjod pa dang rtogs pa yin no zhe na /

analyzed: nye bar brtags pa de nyid thams cad du 'di dag gi rgyu mtshan du ci ste mi 'dod /

original: thog ma med pa'i rtogs pas sgro btags pa nyid rgyu mtshan yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i rtogs pas sgro btags pa nyid rgyu mtshan yin par 'gyur te /

original: dngos po brtags pa'i skabs yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po brtags pa'i skabs yod pa ma yin no //

original: gal te kun la nyer brtags min //üîΩtha dad khyad par gtso bo zhes //
analyzed: gal te kun la nyer brtags min // tha dad khyad par gtso bo zhes //
translated: If you do not impute to all,üîΩwhy do you assert that

original: bya nyid ga las tha dad pa //
analyzed: bya nyid ga las tha dad pa //

original: med pa tha dad don med na //
analyzed: med pa tha dad don med na //

original: don gzhan rgyu mtshan tsam min yang //
analyzed: don gzhan rgyu mtshan tsam min yang //

original: dkar la sogs la grangs sogs dang // ldan pa'i sgra ni rnam grangs min //
analyzed: dkar la sogs la grangs sogs dang // ldan pa'i sgra ni rnam grangs min //
translated: The words ‚Äúone, two, etc.,‚Äù and ‚Äúpossessing‚Äù are not synonyms.

original: gal te der yang don gzhan na //
analyzed: gal te der yang don gzhan na //
translated: If they are different in meaning,

original: yon tan rdzas ni khyad med 'gyur //
analyzed: yon tan rdzas ni khyad med 'gyur //

original: don gzhan min yang ldog pa yi //
analyzed: don gzhan min yang ldog pa yi //

original: dbye bas tha dad pa yin te //
analyzed: dbye bas tha dad pa yin te //

original: las rdzas min pa'i sgra bzhin no //
analyzed: las rdzas min pa'i sgra bzhin no //

original: gal te nye bar brtags pa zhes bya bar gtso bo'i rgyu mtshan can ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te nye bar brtags pa zhes bya bar gtso bo'i rgyu mtshan can ma yin nam /

original: de ji ltar gtso bo med par 'gyur /
analyzed: de ji ltar gtso bo med par 'gyur /

original: gtso bo yang khyad par tha dad pa yin te /
analyzed: gtso bo yang khyad par tha dad pa yin te /

original: dbyug pa can la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dbyug pa can la sogs pa bzhin no //

analyzed: khyad par tha dad pa med pa na ni phal par grags pa yin no //

analyzed: khyed la ni snga ma snga ma'i rtogs pas byas pa'i khyad par dang ldan pas khyad par med par med pa'i phyir gang yang dngos med pas nye bar brtags pa mi srid do zhe na /
translated: For you, since it is endowed with the particulars produced by the prior cognition, it is not without difference. Therefore, since nothing is without substance, the imputed is impossible.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: tha dad pa'i khyad par gtso bo yin no zhes bya ba nyid ga las yin te /
analyzed: tha dad pa'i khyad par gtso bo yin no zhes bya ba nyid ga las yin te /

analyzed: khyad par tha dad pa med kyang rtogs pas byas pa'i khyad par tha dad pa shin tu goms pas bstan par chags par 'gyur ba ni gtso bo nyid do //
translated: Even without a difference in the difference, the difference that is created by the cognition is the principal thing, because it is well known that one becomes attached to it through repeated practice.

original: 'khrul pa med pa rtogs pa'i @89a * //
analyzed: 'khrul pa med pa rtogs pa'i @89a * //
translated: The object of nonerroneous

original: yul ni dngos yin la /
analyzed: yul ni dngos yin la /
translated: cognition is real.üîΩWhat is the point of calling something else, which is not that,

original: de las gzhan ni phal pa yin pas ma chog pa ci yod gzhan yang /üîΩgal te khyad par tha dad ba ni dngos yin la /
analyzed: de las gzhan ni phal pa yin pas ma chog pa ci yod gzhan yang / gal te khyad par tha dad ba ni dngos yin la /

analyzed: gzhan du brtags par 'gyur na rnam pa 'di lta bu mtha' dag dngos ma yin par 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, if the difference is real and the other is imagined, then all of these aspects would not be real,

original: tha dad pa'i khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa'i khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no difference in the difference.üîΩThat which is past and future is also imagined to be different.

analyzed: gang zhig pa dang ma skyes pa la ni khyad par can yang btags pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par yin no //

original: gal te khyad par gzhan med na 'o na ni thams cad du khyad par can nyid brjod par bya ba yin pas don tha dad pa med pa'i phyir rnam grangs pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te khyad par gzhan med na 'o na ni thams cad du khyad par can nyid brjod par bya ba yin pas don tha dad pa med pa'i phyir rnam grangs pa nyid du 'gyur ro //

original: gzhi mthun pa yang med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhi mthun pa yang med par 'gyur te /

original: 'di ltar / 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan tha dad na //
analyzed: 'di ltar / 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan tha dad na //
translated: If there is a difference in the reason for application,

original: de yi ngo bor snang bas na //üîΩci ltar don dang sgra dag ni //
analyzed: de yi ngo bor snang bas na // ci ltar don dang sgra dag ni //
translated: then it appears as its own nature.üîΩHow can there be a common locus

original: gzhi mthun par ni 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: gzhi mthun par ni 'gyur ba yin //

analyzed: gcig nyid dang ni 'brel bas na //

analyzed: sgra gnyis pa yi sbyor ba ni //
translated: The application of the second

analyzed: med pa'i phyir na de med do //

translated: meanings is also eliminated by this.

original: 'brel pa yod pa yin na yang //
analyzed: 'brel pa yod pa yin na yang //
translated: Even if there were a relation,

analyzed: gang las ji ltar 'jal ba yin // gal te 'du ba'i stobs kyi don //
translated: from what and how is it apprehended?üîΩIf the meaning is apprehended

original: gcig nyid kyis ni de rtogs phyir /

original: de nyid kyi phyir tshogs pa'i sgra 'di ni tshogs pa brjod par 'dod pa na yin la /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir tshogs pa'i sgra 'di ni tshogs pa brjod par 'dod pa na yin la /
translated: For this very reason, the word ‚Äúcollection‚Äù is used when one wishes to express a collection,

original: rigs kyi sgra ni so sor 'bras bu gcig pa nyid la yin te /
analyzed: rigs kyi sgra ni so sor 'bras bu gcig pa nyid la yin te /
translated: and the word ‚Äútype‚Äù is used when there is a single effect for each.

original: dper na nags zhes bya ba bzhin dang / dper na shing zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na nags zhes bya ba bzhin dang / dper na shing zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the word ‚Äúforest,‚Äù and it is like the word ‚Äútree.‚Äù

original: 'on ji ltar bum ba'i gzugs la sogs pa zhes tha snyad ce na /
analyzed: 'on ji ltar bum ba'i gzugs la sogs pa zhes tha snyad ce na /
translated: But how is it that the expression ‚Äúform, etc. of a vase‚Äù is used?

original: so sor gzugs la sogs pa'i shes pa skyed par nus pa dag ni chu 'dzin pa'i 'bras bu thun mong ba nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩ'on te ji ltar shing rnams kyi nags she 'am /
analyzed: so sor gzugs la sogs pa'i shes pa skyed par nus pa dag ni chu 'dzin pa'i 'bras bu thun mong ba nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to // 'on te ji ltar shing rnams kyi nags she 'am /
translated: The meaning is that they are the common effect of the apprehension of water.üîΩBut why not say that the tree is the forest,

original: nags rnams ni shing ngo zhes @91a * //
analyzed: nags rnams ni shing ngo zhes @91a * //
translated: or that the forest is the tree?

original: bya ba de bzhin du /üîΩgzugs la sogs pa'i bum pa zhe'am /
analyzed: bya ba de bzhin du / gzugs la sogs pa'i bum pa zhe'am /
translated: In the same way,üîΩwhy not say that the pot is form, etc.,

original: bum pa la sogs pa dag ni gzugs so zhes ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa dag ni gzugs so zhes ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: or that form, etc., is the pot?

original: gal te bstan bcos gzhan gyi 'du byed pa med na 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: gal te bstan bcos gzhan gyi 'du byed pa med na 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: If the pot were not made by another, it would be just that.

original: 'jig rten ni phal cher de'i 'du byed pa'i rjes su 'brangs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten ni phal cher de'i 'du byed pa'i rjes su 'brangs pa yin te /
translated: But the world generally follows its maker,

original: des na mi 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: des na mi 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: and so it is not that.

original: dngos po yang dag par rtogs pa dang ldan pa ni yid ches par 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: dngos po yang dag par rtogs pa dang ldan pa ni yid ches par 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: But when one has a correct understanding of things, one becomes convinced.

original: gzugs la sogs pa nyid 'ga' zhig bum pa'i 'bras bu'i khyad par nus pa yin la /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa nyid 'ga' zhig bum pa'i 'bras bu'i khyad par nus pa yin la /
translated: Form, etc., is the particular effect of the pot, which has the capacity to hold water,

original: 'bras bu'i khyad par yang chu 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i khyad par yang chu 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: and the particular effect is the apprehension of water.

original: yang na dbyibs kyi khyad par gyis rnam par gnas pa ste /
analyzed: yang na dbyibs kyi khyad par gyis rnam par gnas pa ste /
translated: Or else, it is the particular shape that is the basis.

original: dbyibs kyi khyad par gang las chu 'dzin pa'i khyad par gyi gzugs la gzugs kyi bum pa zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: dbyibs kyi khyad par gang las chu 'dzin pa'i khyad par gyi gzugs la gzugs kyi bum pa zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: The particular shape is the basis of the designation of the form that is the particular shape of the water-bearer as the form that is the vase.

original: des na yan lag dang yan lag can gyi khyad par la ni gzhi mthun par mi 'gyur ba nyid de /
analyzed: des na yan lag dang yan lag can gyi khyad par la ni gzhi mthun par mi 'gyur ba nyid de /
translated: Therefore, the difference between the parts and the whole is not a common locus,

original: phan tshun khyab pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan tshun khyab pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no mutual pervasion.

original: gal te shing dang sha pa dag la yang phan tshun khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i dngos po med pa'i phyir ji ltar gzhi mthun pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te shing dang sha pa dag la yang phan tshun khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i dngos po med pa'i phyir ji ltar gzhi mthun pa yin zhe na /
translated: If a tree and a juniper are not a common locus because there is no relationship of the pervader and the pervaded between them, how can they be a common locus?

original: de ni med de 'di ltar /üîΩshing blo bsal ba gcig la ni //
analyzed: de ni med de 'di ltar / shing blo bsal ba gcig la ni //
translated: That is not so, becauseüîΩthe cognition of a tree is eliminated

original: so sor rjes su 'jug pa yin //
analyzed: so sor rjes su 'jug pa yin //
translated: in each individual juniper.

original: bum pa'i blo ni gzugs sogs la //
analyzed: bum pa'i blo ni gzugs sogs la //
translated: The cognition of a vase is not

original: so sor rjes su 'jug pa yin//
analyzed: so sor rjes su 'jug pa yin//
translated: in each individual form and so on.

original: bum pa'i blo ni shing sha pa la sogs pa la shing blo ltar gzugs la sogs pa re re la rjes su 'jug pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bum pa'i blo ni shing sha pa la sogs pa la shing blo ltar gzugs la sogs pa re re la rjes su 'jug pa ma yin no //
translated: The cognition of a vase is not in each individual form and so on, as the cognition of a tree is in each individual juniper.

original: bum pa'i sgras nus pa'i khyad par 'phen pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: bum pa'i sgras nus pa'i khyad par 'phen pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor does the word pot imply a particular capacity,

original: sngon gyi tha snyad zhen pas nus pa nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon gyi tha snyad zhen pas nus pa nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the capacity is determined by the prior convention.

original: shing gi sgras ni khyad par can gyi nus pa dang ldan pa yang 'phen pa yin pa'i phyir skyon med do //
analyzed: shing gi sgras ni khyad par can gyi nus pa dang ldan pa yang 'phen pa yin pa'i phyir skyon med do //
translated: But the word tree does imply a capacity that is qualified, so there is no fault.

original: 'dir yang tha snyad zhen pa'am //
analyzed: 'dir yang tha snyad zhen pa'am //
translated: Here also, the capacity is either determined by the convention,

original: nus pa'i bye brag rgyu yin pas //
analyzed: nus pa'i bye brag rgyu yin pas //
translated: or it is the cause of the particular capacity.

original: thams cad legs par gnas so //
analyzed: thams cad legs par gnas so //
translated: Thus everything is well established.

original: gal te ba lang dag ni nyi shu'o zhes bya ba dang / nyi shu dag gi ba lang zhes bya ba 'di la nus pa'i khyad par 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te ba lang dag ni nyi shu'o zhes bya ba dang / nyi shu dag gi ba lang zhes bya ba 'di la nus pa'i khyad par 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: If it is said that in expressions like twenty cows and cows of twenty, there is no particular capacity at all,

original: 'dir nyi shu'i sgra nus pa gzhan brjod pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dir nyi shu'i sgra nus pa gzhan brjod pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: here the word twenty does not express another capacity,

original: 'on kyang 'dir bzho ba dang dgal ba la sogs pa'i nus pa nyid rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'dir bzho ba dang dgal ba la sogs pa'i nus pa nyid rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: but rather the very capacity for milking and plowing, etc. is understood.

original: der ni mang po nyid kyis ni //
analyzed: der ni mang po nyid kyis ni //
translated: There, by the word many,

original: bstan pa'i 'dus pa gsal bar yod //
analyzed: bstan pa'i 'dus pa gsal bar yod //
translated: the collection of cows is clearly indicated.

original: de brjod phyogs 'dir gzhan dag la'ang //
analyzed: de brjod phyogs 'dir gzhan dag la'ang //
translated: In expressing that, in this context, in other cases as well,

original: nye bar bstan par brjod @91b par bya //
analyzed: nye bar bstan par brjod @91b par bya //
translated: I will now explain this.

original: 'dir ni bcu po gnyis kyi rang bzhin 'dus pa brjod par 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir ni bcu po gnyis kyi rang bzhin 'dus pa brjod par 'dod pa yin no //
translated: Here, the author wishes to discuss the nature of the two sets of ten.

original: des ni bzho ba dang dgal ba'i nus pa 'phen pa ma yin la des kyang 'dus pa'i khyad par 'phen pa ma yin pa'i phyir thams cad legs par gnas so //
analyzed: des ni bzho ba dang dgal ba'i nus pa 'phen pa ma yin la des kyang 'dus pa'i khyad par 'phen pa ma yin pa'i phyir thams cad legs par gnas so //
translated: Since the act of milking does not imply the capacity of the calf to suckle, nor does the latter imply the former, everything is well-established.üîΩOr,

original: yang na / thog ma med pa'i tha snyad kyis //
analyzed: yang na / thog ma med pa'i tha snyad kyis //
translated: By the convention of beginninglessness,

original: 'dus byas bag chags bdag can gyi //
analyzed: 'dus byas bag chags bdag can gyi //
translated: The conditioned is the possessor of habitual tendencies.

original: sgra las byung ba'i rtogs pa 'di //
analyzed: sgra las byung ba'i rtogs pa 'di //
translated: This understanding arising from words

original: thog ma med pa'i tha snyad yin //
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i tha snyad yin //
translated: Is the convention of beginninglessness.

original: des na gang la'ang mi brtsad de //
analyzed: des na gang la'ang mi brtsad de //
translated: Therefore, it is not to be disputed by anyone,

original: gang gis kyang ni brtsad bya min //
analyzed: gang gis kyang ni brtsad bya min //
translated: Nor is it to be disputed by anyone else.

original: gal te sgra don de lta bu //
analyzed: gal te sgra don de lta bu //
translated: If the meaning of the word is like that,

original: yin yang chad pa 'ga' med na //
analyzed: yin yang chad pa 'ga' med na //
translated: Even so, there is no annihilation at all.

original: gang gis de la rtsod byed 'dir //
analyzed: gang gis de la rtsod byed 'dir //
translated: By whom is this dispute made here?

original: de ltar mi rigs ji zhig yod //
analyzed: de ltar mi rigs ji zhig yod //
translated: What is it that is so unreasonable?

original: tha mal sgra yi 'dus byas la //
analyzed: tha mal sgra yi 'dus byas la //
translated: In the conditioned of ordinary sounds,

original: ma 'chol ba ni mthong ba med //
analyzed: ma 'chol ba ni mthong ba med //
translated: Unrequested seeing does not occur.

original: der ni rtags dang tshig gi don //
analyzed: der ni rtags dang tshig gi don //
translated: There, the meaning of the sign and the word

original: tha dad pa ni gsal bar rtogs //
analyzed: tha dad pa ni gsal bar rtogs //
translated: And the difference is understood as the manifestation.

original: de la mi rigs yod ma yin //üîΩlegs par sbyar la de 'gyur na //
analyzed: de la mi rigs yod ma yin // legs par sbyar la de 'gyur na //
translated: There is no non-existence of that.üîΩIf that is the case for the well-formed,

original: mtshan nyid de ni legs bsgrubs pa //
analyzed: mtshan nyid de ni legs bsgrubs pa //
translated: then the definition is well-established.

original: tha mal legs par sbyar bar 'dod //
analyzed: tha mal legs par sbyar bar 'dod //
translated: The well-formed is asserted to be ordinary.

original: legs par sbyar dang legs sbyar min //
analyzed: legs par sbyar dang legs sbyar min //
translated: The well-formed and the not well-formed

original: tshad mas rtogs pa yod ma yin //üîΩ'dis ni byis rtsed don phyir na //
analyzed: tshad mas rtogs pa yod ma yin // 'dis ni byis rtsed don phyir na //
translated: are not realized by valid cognition.üîΩThis is merely a presentation

original: rnam par gzhag pa tsam du zad //
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa tsam du zad //
translated: for the sake of childish play.

original: ji ltar don yod ma yin yang //
analyzed: ji ltar don yod ma yin yang //
translated: Just as it is not existent,

original: byis pa tha snyad pa dag gis //
analyzed: byis pa tha snyad pa dag gis //
translated: the childish conventionalists

original: ci zhig ltar 'di bstan bcos su //
analyzed: ci zhig ltar 'di bstan bcos su //
translated: say, How is this treatise

original: byas pa de ltar byis gzhan nyid //üîΩrjes 'jug des na de dag 'dir //
analyzed: byas pa de ltar byis gzhan nyid // rjes 'jug des na de dag 'dir //
translated: made by other childish ones?üîΩFollowing that, they do not know

original: ci zhig brjod pa mi shes so //
analyzed: ci zhig brjod pa mi shes so //
translated: what is being said here.

original: ma mthong ba yi don brjod ni //
analyzed: ma mthong ba yi don brjod ni //
translated: The expression of an unseen meaning

original: gar gyi bstan bcos dag la'ang mthong //
analyzed: gar gyi bstan bcos dag la'ang mthong //
translated: is also seen in treatises on dance.

original: de la yid ches yod min te //
analyzed: de la yid ches yod min te //
translated: There is no confidence in that,

original: 'dis ni dmus long brgyud pa yin //
analyzed: 'dis ni dmus long brgyud pa yin //
translated: as this is a lineage of the blind.

original: gal te lus kyi 'byung ba chen po las skyes pa yin na ;
analyzed: gal te lus kyi 'byung ba chen po las skyes pa yin na ;
translated: If it arises from the great elements of the body,

original: de'i tshe cha shas mtha' dag rnam par shes pa skyed pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe cha shas mtha' dag rnam par shes pa skyed pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: At that time, all the parts are causes that generate consciousness.

original: dper na myu gu la sa sogs lta bu'am /
analyzed: dper na myu gu la sa sogs lta bu'am /
translated: For example, it is like the earth and so on for a sprout.

original: yang na so sor de dper na me la bsreg par bya ba rtsva la sogs pa lta bu zhig yin grang na /
analyzed: yang na so sor de dper na me la bsreg par bya ba rtsva la sogs pa lta bu zhig yin grang na /
translated: Or, alternatively, each one is individually the cause, like grass and so on for a fire.

original: de la ma lus rgyu nyid yin na ni //
analyzed: de la ma lus rgyu nyid yin na ni //
translated: If it is the case that all the parts are causes,

original: yan lag gcig dang bral na'ang min //
analyzed: yan lag gcig dang bral na'ang min //
translated: then it is not the case that when one part is absent,

original: re re nus ba nyid yin na'ang //
analyzed: re re nus ba nyid yin na'ang //
translated: if each one individually is the cause,

original: cig car mang po 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: cig car mang po 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: then many would arise simultaneously.

original: du ma nyid du mtshungs pa'i phyir //
analyzed: du ma nyid du mtshungs pa'i phyir //
translated: Because they are equivalent in being many,

original: 'byung rngub dag ni nges byed min //
analyzed: 'byung rngub dag ni nges byed min //
translated: exhalation and inhalation are not determinative.

original: 'bras bu gang la mang po dag phan tshun lhan cig byed pas /
analyzed: 'bras bu gang la mang po dag phan tshun lhan cig byed pas /
translated: For any effect that is produced by many mutually co-operating causes,üîΩif the effect is possible even when one of them is absent,

original: bya ba byed pa der ni gcig med kyang 'bras bu srid pa ma yin no //üîΩde med kyang 'bras bu yod pa @92a * //
analyzed: bya ba byed pa der ni gcig med kyang 'bras bu srid pa ma yin no // de med kyang 'bras bu yod pa @92a * //
translated: then that is not a cause.

original: yin na ni /
analyzed: yin na ni /
translated: If the effect exists even when it is absent,

original: de rgyu nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rgyu nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then it is not a cause.üîΩBut if the parts are only produced without mutual dependence,

original: 'on te yan lag rnams phan tshun ltos pa med pa kho nar skyed par byed pa yin pa des na /
analyzed: 'on te yan lag rnams phan tshun ltos pa med pa kho nar skyed par byed pa yin pa des na /
translated: then the effect would not be dependent on the parts.

original: rna ba dang sna chad kyang de dag nyid la yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'byung ba yin na /üîΩde lta na ni 'o na so sor nus pa zhes bya bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rna ba dang sna chad kyang de dag nyid la yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'byung ba yin na / de lta na ni 'o na so sor nus pa zhes bya bar 'gyur te /
translated: Even when the ear and nose are cut off, mental consciousness arises in regard to them.

original: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa mang po 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa mang po 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that is so, then there would be a plurality of consciousnesses, since each would have its own capacity.

original: so sor nus pa'i sa bon du ma yod na /
analyzed: so sor nus pa'i sa bon du ma yod na /
translated: If there are many seeds with their own capacity,

original: myu gu du ma mi skye ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: myu gu du ma mi skye ba ni ma yin no //
translated: then many sprouts would not be produced.

original: de skyed par byed pa ni dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa dag yin la /
analyzed: de skyed par byed pa ni dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa dag yin la /
translated: The cause of their production is the exhalation and inhalation of breath.

original: cha shas gcig 'ba' zhig gang yin pa de ni lhan cig byed pa yin no //
analyzed: cha shas gcig 'ba' zhig gang yin pa de ni lhan cig byed pa yin no //
translated: The single part that is the cause is the cooperating cause.

original: lhan cig byed pa tha dad pas ni 'bras bu tha dad par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa tha dad pas ni 'bras bu tha dad par mi 'gyur te /
