translated: like earth and so on.

original: 'on te yang /
analyzed: 'on te yang /
translated: But if you say,

original: 'dir ni rgyud gcig tu rtogs pa yin pa'i phyir shin tu tha dad pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir ni rgyud gcig tu rtogs pa yin pa'i phyir shin tu tha dad pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúHere, there is no great difference because there is the understanding of one continuum,‚Äù

original: de ni skye ba gzhan la yang mtshungs te skye ba gzhan yang gnyid log pa dang sad pa @97b bzhin du rgyud gcig gi khongs su gtogs pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: de ni skye ba gzhan la yang mtshungs te skye ba gzhan yang gnyid log pa dang sad pa @97b bzhin du rgyud gcig gi khongs su gtogs pa nyid yin te /
translated: This is similar for other lives as well, for other lives are included within a single continuum, like sleep and waking.

original: dran pa bar chod pas na de thag ring po bzhin du rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: dran pa bar chod pas na de thag ring po bzhin du rtogs pa yin no //
translated: Since memory is interrupted, it is understood to be like a distant place.

original: gal te dbang po rnams dbang po nyid las skye ba ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te dbang po rnams dbang po nyid las skye ba ni ma yin gyi /
translated: You may say, ‚ÄúThe faculties do not arise from the faculties themselves.

original: 'on kyang dang po ni lus nyid las skyed la phyis ni dbang po nyid las yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang dang po ni lus nyid las skyed la phyis ni dbang po nyid las yin te /
translated: However, first they arise from the body itself and later they arise from the faculties themselves,

original: nus pa nges pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: nus pa nges pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because their potency is ascertained.‚Äù

original: 'di la bshad pa /
analyzed: 'di la bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: gal te lus las de skye na //
analyzed: gal te lus las de skye na //
translated: If they arise from the body,

original: snga ma bzhin du thal bar 'gyur //üîΩsems las she na lus gzhan yang //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du thal bar 'gyur // sems las she na lus gzhan yang //
translated: the consequence would be as before.üîΩIf they arise from the mind,

original: de nyid las ni skye bar 'gyur //üîΩgal te dngos po lus las skye ba de'i tshe dbang po dang bcas pa las sam /
analyzed: de nyid las ni skye bar 'gyur // gal te dngos po lus las skye ba de'i tshe dbang po dang bcas pa las sam /
translated: another body would arise from that mind alone.

original: dbang po med pa las /üîΩdbang po dang bcas pa las skye na /
analyzed: dbang po med pa las / dbang po dang bcas pa las skye na /
translated: If they arise from the entity that is the body, then do they arise from the body that possesses faculties or from the body that lacks faculties?üîΩIf they arise from the body that possesses faculties,

original: dbang po nyid las skye ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dbang po nyid las skye ba'i phyir /
translated: then the consequence is that they arise from the faculties themselves.

original: dang po yang dbang po las skye bas 'jig rten gzhan rab tu 'grub po //
analyzed: dang po yang dbang po las skye bas 'jig rten gzhan rab tu 'grub po //
translated: First, if it arises from the sense faculties, then the other world would be well established.

original: dbang po med pa las skye na skra dang sen mo'i rtse mo dang / shi ba'i lus las kyang skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbang po med pa las skye na skra dang sen mo'i rtse mo dang / shi ba'i lus las kyang skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it arises from that which is without sense faculties, then it would arise from the tips of hair and nails and from the body of the dead.

original: du ma nyid yin na dbang po du ma 'byung bar yang thal lo //
analyzed: du ma nyid yin na dbang po du ma 'byung bar yang thal lo //
translated: If it is multiple, then it follows that the sense faculties would be multiple.

original: de lta yin dang / tshad med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin dang / tshad med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that is so, then it would be immeasurable.

original: de bzhin du lus kyi nus pa yang ci'i phyir na ldog par 'gyur ba yin /
analyzed: de bzhin du lus kyi nus pa yang ci'i phyir na ldog par 'gyur ba yin /
translated: In the same way, why would the power of the body be reversed?

original: 'on te dbang po dag lus kyi rnam par 'gyur ba'i khyad par nyid yin na /
analyzed: 'on te dbang po dag lus kyi rnam par 'gyur ba'i khyad par nyid yin na /
translated: But if the sense faculties are the special transformation of the body,

original: de'i tshe yang 'jig pa med par thal ba nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe yang 'jig pa med par thal ba nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: then it follows that there would be no destruction.

original: dbang rnams lus las 'byung yin na //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs par thal ba yin no //
analyzed: dbang rnams lus las 'byung yin na // zhes bya ba la sogs par thal ba yin no //
translated: If the sense faculties arise from the body,üîΩthen it follows that the sense faculties would arise from the body.

original: 'on te sems med pa'i phyir shi ba'i lus la dbang po mi 'byung na /
analyzed: 'on te sems med pa'i phyir shi ba'i lus la dbang po mi 'byung na /
translated: But if the sense faculties do not arise in the body of the dead because it is without mind,

original: gal te 'o na ni sems las skye ba yin pas /
analyzed: gal te 'o na ni sems las skye ba yin pas /
translated: then, since it arises from mind,

original: sems de nyid las lus gzhan dang / skye ba gzhan du 'byung ba'i sems skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems de nyid las lus gzhan dang / skye ba gzhan du 'byung ba'i sems skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: The mind itself arises as another body and another mind in another birth.

original: sngar gyi dbang po'i rgyu nyid du rtog pa'i zhen pas ci bya /
analyzed: sngar gyi dbang po'i rgyu nyid du rtog pa'i zhen pas ci bya /
translated: What is the use of conceiving the previous body as the cause of the sense faculties?

original: des na lus gzhan ni rnam par shes pa'i rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: des na lus gzhan ni rnam par shes pa'i rgyu ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, another body is not the cause of consciousness.

original: des na rgyu ma yin pa'i lus ma tshang bas skye ba gzhan med pa ma yin pa'i phyir mtshams sbyor ba med pa ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni /
analyzed: des na rgyu ma yin pa'i lus ma tshang bas skye ba gzhan med pa ma yin pa'i phyir mtshams sbyor ba med pa ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni /
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that there is no linking of birth because of the incompleteness of a body that is not a cause.

original: des na rgyu dang bral ba'i phyir //
analyzed: des na rgyu dang bral ba'i phyir //
translated: Therefore, because of the absence of a cause,

original: tha ma yi ni sems rnams kun //üîΩmtshams sbyor med min de yi phyir //
analyzed: tha ma yi ni sems rnams kun // mtshams sbyor med min de yi phyir //
translated: all the final mindsüîΩare not without a link.

original: 'di 'dra sgrub byed lhag ldan 'dod //
analyzed: 'di 'dra sgrub byed lhag ldan 'dod //
translated: Therefore, it is asserted that there is a remainder to be accomplished.

original: ces bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba'o //
translated: This is the conclusion.

original: skye ba gzhan dang 'brel ba'i rgyu ni sred pa dang bcas pa'i las kyis mngon par 'dus byas pa'i sems yin la /
analyzed: skye ba gzhan dang 'brel ba'i rgyu ni sred pa dang bcas pa'i las kyis mngon par 'dus byas pa'i sems yin la /
translated: The cause connected with another birth is the mind that is formed by karma together with craving.

original: de ni ma tshang ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni ma tshang ba ma yin no //
translated: That is not incomplete.

original: gal te lus @98a * //
analyzed: gal te lus @98a * //
translated: If the body were the cause of the mind,üîΩthen the mind would not arise from the body.

original: rgyu yin na ni des na de ma tshang na rgyu dang bral bas mtshams sbyor ba med par 'gyur na /
analyzed: rgyu yin na ni des na de ma tshang na rgyu dang bral bas mtshams sbyor ba med par 'gyur na /
translated: If it is a cause, then if it is incomplete, there would be no linking up because it would be devoid of a cause.

original: de ltar ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar ni ma yin no //
translated: But that is not the case.

original: des na bral ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des na bral ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because it is not devoid of a cause,

original: gtan tshigs ma grub bo //
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma grub bo //
translated: your reason is unestablished.

original: 'chi ba'i sems yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba nyid lus pa yin na /üîΩde yang lhag ma dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'chi ba'i sems yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba nyid lus pa yin na / de yang lhag ma dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: The reason ‚Äúbecause it is a mind at death‚Äù is left incomplete.

original: ma mthong ba tsam gyis ldog pa nye bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgang yang tshe 'di'i sems ni sems gzhan dang mtshams sbyor ba ma yin te /
analyzed: ma mthong ba tsam gyis ldog pa nye bar bstan pa'i phyir ro // gang yang tshe 'di'i sems ni sems gzhan dang mtshams sbyor ba ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, it is incomplete because it merely shows the cessation of the nonperception of the mind.

original: lus tha dad pa la gnas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lus tha dad pa la gnas pa'i phyir /
translated: Also, it is not tenable to say that the mind of this life does not link up with another mind because it is located in a different body,üîΩlike the mind of Devadatta.

original: lha sbyin gyi sems bzhin no zhes brjod pa de yang mi rung ste /üîΩrten bkag pa yis gnas pa yi //
analyzed: lha sbyin gyi sems bzhin no zhes brjod pa de yang mi rung ste / rten bkag pa yis gnas pa yi //
translated: The refutation of the support has already been explained,

original: dgag pa sngar ni bshad zin phyir //
analyzed: dgag pa sngar ni bshad zin phyir //
translated: because the refutation of the supported has already been explained.

original: rnam shes dmigs pa nyid yin pas //
analyzed: rnam shes dmigs pa nyid yin pas //
translated: Since consciousness is the object of perception,

original: skad cig gis ni gzhan dmigs 'gyur //
analyzed: skad cig gis ni gzhan dmigs 'gyur //
translated: it is perceived in a moment.

original: gal te de la gnas pa yin na gzhan la gnas pa'i rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba tshad ma'i don yin la rten dang brten pa'i dngos po de ni dgag pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te de la gnas pa yin na gzhan la gnas pa'i rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba tshad ma'i don yin la rten dang brten pa'i dngos po de ni dgag pa yin no //
translated: If it is the case that consciousness is located in one part of the body, then it does not produce consciousness located in another part of the body.

original: rnam par shes pa ni yul na gnas pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni yul na gnas pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Consciousness is not located in space.

original: dmigs par bya ba'i lus ni rnam par shes pa'i rten ma yin te /
analyzed: dmigs par bya ba'i lus ni rnam par shes pa'i rten ma yin te /
translated: The body that is the object of perception is not the basis of consciousness,üîΩbecause the body is the object of perception of the consciousness of pleasure, etc.,

original: nang gi reg pa'i khyad par gyis /üîΩbde ba la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa'i yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nang gi reg pa'i khyad par gyis / bde ba la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa'i yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: which is a special kind of internal contact.

original: dmigs pa ni rang gi lus la dmigs pas /
analyzed: dmigs pa ni rang gi lus la dmigs pas /
translated: The body is the object of perception of the consciousness that perceives one‚Äôs own body,

original: gzhan gyi lus la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa bskyed pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan gyi lus la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa bskyed pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: but not of the consciousness that perceives another‚Äôs body.

original: des na ma nges pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: des na ma nges pa nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, your reason is inconclusive.

original: lus gzhan pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: lus gzhan pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: The body is not a different substance from consciousness,

original: rgyud gcig tu rtogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyud gcig tu rtogs pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is understood to be part of the same continuum.üîΩIn reality, the body is not the basis of consciousness,

original: ro // don dam par ni byis pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par gyis /
analyzed: ro // don dam par ni byis pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par gyis /
translated: because it is perceived differently at different times, such as in childhood and old age.

original: skye ba gcig gi lus kyang tha dad pa nyid do //
analyzed: skye ba gcig gi lus kyang tha dad pa nyid do //
translated: The body of one birth is different from that of another.

original: de'i phyir yid kyi rgyun la lus phan 'dogs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir yid kyi rgyun la lus phan 'dogs pa yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the body is helpful to the mental continuum.

original: skye ba ni sems nyid ma yin ste /
analyzed: skye ba ni sems nyid ma yin ste /
translated: Birth is not the mind itself,

original: 'bras bu'i rgyu bzhin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i rgyu bzhin no //
translated: like the cause of an effect.

original: des na sems kyi rgyun thog ma med par 'gyur ba yin pas /
analyzed: des na sems kyi rgyun thog ma med par 'gyur ba yin pas /
translated: Thus, the mental continuum is beginningless,

original: skye ba dang 'chi ba'i rgyun rjes su 'brel pa grub pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgoms pa grub pas goms pa las byung ba'i yon tan mtha' dag gi skabs yod par byas pas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dam /
analyzed: skye ba dang 'chi ba'i rgyun rjes su 'brel pa grub pa'i phyir ro // goms pa grub pas goms pa las byung ba'i yon tan mtha' dag gi skabs yod par byas pas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dam /
translated: because the continuum of birth and death is established as being related.

original: gzhan ba'i yon tan srid pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ba'i yon tan srid pa yin no //
translated: Since the possibility of practice is established, the possibility of all virtues arising from practice is established. Thus, omniscience or other virtues are possible.

original: tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi rgyan las 'jig rten pha rol bsgrub pa rnam par 'grel @98b pa'o /
analyzed: tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi rgyan las 'jig rten pha rol bsgrub pa rnam par 'grel @98b pa'o /
translated: This concludes the chapter on the proof of past and future lives, the third chapter of the Ornament of the Middle Way.

original: // / gal te goms pa yod mod /
analyzed: // / gal te goms pa yod mod /
translated: If there is practice,

original: de rab kyi mthar phyin par go ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de rab kyi mthar phyin par go ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: how can it be understood that it has reached its culmination?

original: khyad par cung zad tsam dang ldan pa nyid du mthong ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: khyad par cung zad tsam dang ldan pa nyid du mthong ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is seen to possess just a slight distinction.

original: mchongs pa bzhin dang chu bskol ba bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: mchongs pa bzhin dang chu bskol ba bzhin no zhe na /
translated: Like jumping and like boiling water.

original: 'dir lan du /
analyzed: 'dir lan du /
translated: In response to this, we say:

original: goms pas khyad par 'gyur na yang //
analyzed: goms pas khyad par 'gyur na yang //
translated: Even if there is a difference due to habituation,

original: mchongs dang chu yi drod bzhin du //
analyzed: mchongs dang chu yi drod bzhin du //
translated: like jumping and the heat of water,

original: rang bzhin las 'da' min zhe na //
analyzed: rang bzhin las 'da' min zhe na //
translated: if you say that it does not transcend its nature,

original: byas te gal te slar yang ni //
analyzed: byas te gal te slar yang ni //
translated: then, having been made,

original: 'bad rtsol la ni ltos 'gyur ram //
analyzed: 'bad rtsol la ni ltos 'gyur ram //
translated: would it depend again on effort?

original: rten mi brten pa nyid 'gyur na //
analyzed: rten mi brten pa nyid 'gyur na //
translated: If it were dependent or not dependent,

original: khyad par dag ni mi 'phel zhing //
analyzed: khyad par dag ni mi 'phel zhing //
translated: there would be no increase in the difference.

original: rang bzhin de 'dra'ang ma yin te //
analyzed: rang bzhin de 'dra'ang ma yin te //
translated: And its nature would not be like that.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de la phan 'dogs nus pa rnams //
analyzed: de la phan 'dogs nus pa rnams //
translated: Because those that are able to help it

original: khyad par phyir ma dag la ni //
analyzed: khyad par phyir ma dag la ni //
translated: are not different, and in the impureüîΩthere is no ability to accomplish it,

original: bsgrub pa'i nus pa med phyir dang // rtag tu rten gnas ma yin phyir //
analyzed: bsgrub pa'i nus pa med phyir dang // rtag tu rten gnas ma yin phyir //
translated: and it is not always the support.

original: khyad par yin no cog ni bogs 'byung ba rnam par gnas pa la brten par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: khyad par yin no cog ni bogs 'byung ba rnam par gnas pa la brten par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: Every difference is not based on an increase.

original: mchongs pa dang chu bskol ba'i khyad par ni rang gi rgyud 'gyur ba tsam gyis de ltar 'gyur ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: mchongs pa dang chu bskol ba'i khyad par ni rang gi rgyud 'gyur ba tsam gyis de ltar 'gyur ba ma yin gyi /
translated: The difference of jumping and the heat of boiling water is not like that due to a mere change in its continuum.

original: 'on kyang byas zin pa'i mchongs pa yang /
analyzed: 'on kyang byas zin pa'i mchongs pa yang /
translated: But the jump that has been made

original: yang rtsol ba la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang rtsol ba la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: depends on a further effort.

original: mchongs pa ni sngar gyi rtsol ba dang / mchongs pa dag las gzhan pa'i rtsol ba la ltos pa med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mchongs pa ni sngar gyi rtsol ba dang / mchongs pa dag las gzhan pa'i rtsol ba la ltos pa med pa ma yin no //
translated: The jump does not occur without depending on an effort other than the previous effort and the jump.

original: 'on kyang sngar gyi yul nyid du yang rtsol ba la ltos pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang sngar gyi yul nyid du yang rtsol ba la ltos pa yin no //
translated: But it does depend on an effort in the previous place.

original: chu bskol ba'i rten brten pa ma yin pa dang / yang rtsol ba la ltos pa dang bcas pa yang yin te /
analyzed: chu bskol ba'i rten brten pa ma yin pa dang / yang rtsol ba la ltos pa dang bcas pa yang yin te /
translated: The boiling of water is not a matter of the support and the supported, and it also depends on a further effort.

original: me dang 'brel pa log kyang de yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: me dang 'brel pa log kyang de yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Even when the connection with fire is stopped, it is not that it does not exist.

original: de'i phyir 'phel pa mthar thug pa mi 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'phel pa mthar thug pa mi 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the increase does not reach an end.

original: gang gi phyir 'phel ba mthar thug pa ma yin pa nyid ni /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'phel ba mthar thug pa ma yin pa nyid ni /
translated: Because the increase does not reach an end,

original: yang rtsol ba la ltos ba dang / rten mi brten pa nyid kyi khyab pa yin no //
analyzed: yang rtsol ba la ltos ba dang / rten mi brten pa nyid kyi khyab pa yin no //
translated: it is pervaded by depending on a further effort and by being a matter of the support and the supported.

original: de med pa'i phyir dang / bzlog pa srid pa'i phyir snying rje la sogs pa yid kyi yon tan rnams ni bogs 'byung ba gnas pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir dang / bzlog pa srid pa'i phyir snying rje la sogs pa yid kyi yon tan rnams ni bogs 'byung ba gnas pa med pa nyid do //
translated: Because that is not so, and because the opposite is possible, mental qualities such as compassion are not enhanced and do not endure.

analyzed: yang rtsol ba la ltos pa gang yin pa de ni rang bzhin du 'gyur ba nyid ma yin pa nyid do //

original: gtan tshigs 'di ni khyad par dang bcas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs 'di ni khyad par dang bcas pa ma yin te /

analyzed: gang zhig rten brtan pa dang ngo bo nyid du 'gyur ba de ni bogs 'byung ba ba la gnas pa can nyid ma yin te /

analyzed: dper na bram ze dang thod pa can gyi yid log pa bzhin no //

original: yang rtsol ba la ltos pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: yang rtsol ba la ltos pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: That which depends on effort

original: gal te mngon par 'phel ba thob pa de ltar na yang de'i ngo bo nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te mngon par 'phel ba thob pa de ltar na yang de'i ngo bo nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: is not its intrinsic nature, even if it is attained through development.

original: rgyu nye ba la ltos pa ni ngo bo nyid yin par mi 'thad de /
analyzed: rgyu nye ba la ltos pa ni ngo bo nyid yin par mi 'thad de /
translated: It is not tenable that that which depends on the proximity of a cause is its intrinsic nature,

original: rang gi dang gis 'jug pa la de skad brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi dang gis 'jug pa la de skad brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is said to be engaged through its own power.

original: de na 'di 'phel yang shin tu 'phel bar 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de na 'di 'phel yang shin tu 'phel bar 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: Even if it is developed, it does not become very developed,

original: mchongs pa dang chu bskol ba bzhin no //
analyzed: mchongs pa dang chu bskol ba bzhin no //
translated: like jumping and boiling water.

original: brtse ba la sogs pa yid kyi yon tan rnams dang / rang gi dang gis 'jug pa'i phyi rol gyi yon tan 'ga' zhig ni de lta ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni /
analyzed: brtse ba la sogs pa yid kyi yon tan rnams dang / rang gi dang gis 'jug pa'i phyi rol gyi yon tan 'ga' zhig ni de lta ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni /
translated: It is not the case that mental qualities such as love and external qualities that are engaged through their own power are like that.

original: sems la brtse sems goms skyes pa /
analyzed: sems la brtse sems goms skyes pa /
translated: Love that arises from mental habituation

original: rang gi ngang gis 'jug 'gyur te //
analyzed: rang gi ngang gis 'jug 'gyur te //
translated: is engaged through its own power,üîΩlike fire and so on from wood,

original: me la sogs nas shing dag dang // dngul chu dang ni gser sogs bzhin //
analyzed: me la sogs nas shing dag dang // dngul chu dang ni gser sogs bzhin //
translated: mercury and so on from gold.

original: shing la mes byas pa khyad par bsregs pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid de ni yang rtsol ba la mi ltos pa'i phyir rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa ma yin no //
analyzed: shing la mes byas pa khyad par bsregs pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid de ni yang rtsol ba la mi ltos pa'i phyir rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa ma yin no //
translated: The characteristics of the burning, etc., of wood by fire do not occur spontaneously, because they do not occur without effort.

original: dngul chu la dul ba dang thim pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / gser ba rtsom la sogs par byas pa yang ngo //
analyzed: dngul chu la dul ba dang thim pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / gser ba rtsom la sogs par byas pa yang ngo //
translated: The characteristics of the melting, etc., of mercury, and the characteristics of the burning, etc., of gold, are also like that.

original: de bzhin du sems la brtse ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sems la brtse ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: Likewise, the characteristics of the mind are love, etc.

original: yang nas yang du de goms pas byas pa'i khyad par ni ldog pa la brten pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yang nas yang du de goms pas byas pa'i khyad par ni ldog pa la brten pa ma yin no //
translated: The differences produced by repeated practice of those are not dependent on effort.

original: de bzhin du gang gi tshe snying rje la sogs pa'i khyad par byas zin pa yang rtsol ba la ltos pa ma yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: de bzhin du gang gi tshe snying rje la sogs pa'i khyad par byas zin pa yang rtsol ba la ltos pa ma yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: Likewise, when the differences of love, etc., are produced, they are not dependent on effort.

original: snga ma la mi ltos pa'i nus pa can gyi rtsol ba gzhan ni khyad par phyi ma dang // phyi ma nyid byed pa'i phyir 'phel ba rab kyi mthar phyin par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: snga ma la mi ltos pa'i nus pa can gyi rtsol ba gzhan ni khyad par phyi ma dang // phyi ma nyid byed pa'i phyir 'phel ba rab kyi mthar phyin par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Then, because another effort, which is capable of producing the next difference without depending on the previous one, produces the next difference, there is progress to the ultimate limit.

original: gal te mchongs pa yang rtsol ba la ltos pa la brtse pa la brten ba la sogs pa yang ltos pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te mchongs pa yang rtsol ba la ltos pa la brtse pa la brten ba la sogs pa yang ltos pa ma yin nam /
translated: If jumping is dependent on effort, then why is it that loving kindness and so on are not dependent on it?

original: des na gcig ni rang gi ngang gis 'jug la /
analyzed: des na gcig ni rang gi ngang gis 'jug la /
translated: How do you know that one is engaged by its own power and the other is not?

original: gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ga las she na 'di la bshad zin te mchongs pa dang chu bskol ba la sogs pa la yang rtsol ba la ltos pas rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ga las she na 'di la bshad zin te mchongs pa dang chu bskol ba la sogs pa la yang rtsol ba la ltos pas rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa ma yin no //
translated: We have already explained this: jumping, boiling water, and so on are not engaged by their own power because they are dependent on effort.

original: brtse ba la sogs pa ni shing la mes byas pa'i khyad par bzhin du rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: brtse ba la sogs pa ni shing la mes byas pa'i khyad par bzhin du rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa yin no //
translated: Loving kindness and so on are engaged by their own power, like the special qualities produced by fire in wood.

original: de'i phyir de dag las skyes te //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag las skyes te //
translated: Therefore, they are produced from that.

original: ngo bo nyid skyes yon tan yin //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid skyes yon tan yin //
translated: The qualities produced from the essence

original: des na rtsol ba @99b phyi ma dang // phyi ma khyad par byed pa yin //üîΩgang phyir rigs mthun snga ma yi //
analyzed: des na rtsol ba @99b phyi ma dang // phyi ma khyad par byed pa yin // gang phyir rigs mthun snga ma yi //
translated: are produced by effort,üîΩbecause they are engaged in the seed

original: sa bon la ni 'jug 'gyur ba //
analyzed: sa bon la ni 'jug 'gyur ba //
translated: that is homogeneous and prior.üîΩHow can those minds such as loving kindness

original: brtse ba la sogs blo de dag / goms par 'gyur na ga la gnas //
analyzed: brtse ba la sogs blo de dag / goms par 'gyur na ga la gnas //
translated: that are cultivated remain?

original: brtse ba la sogs pa ni brtse ba la sogs pa'i blo rigs mthun pa snga ma las byung ba nyid de /
analyzed: brtse ba la sogs pa ni brtse ba la sogs pa'i blo rigs mthun pa snga ma las byung ba nyid de /
translated: Love and so on arise from previous instances of love and so on of a similar type.üîΩ

original: yul nye ba la sogs pa la ltos pa dang bcas pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yul nye ba la sogs pa la ltos pa dang bcas pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Love, etc., arise from a previous similar type of mind, and not from the proximity of an object, etc.üîΩThus,üîΩLove, etc., are engaged by recollection,

original: 'di ltar / brtse ba la sogs dran pa dang // thos sogs kyis kyang 'jug 'gyur te //üîΩbrtse sogs lan du phan 'dogs la //
analyzed: 'di ltar / brtse ba la sogs dran pa dang // thos sogs kyis kyang 'jug 'gyur te // brtse sogs lan du phan 'dogs la //
translated: By hearing, etc.,

original: sogs pa dag la ltos ma yin //
analyzed: sogs pa dag la ltos ma yin //
translated: And not by the return of benefit, etc.

original: rgyud de'i zhing du byas pa dag ni bdun na gtan du gnod par byed par gnas pa dag la yang brtse ba la sogs pa chung bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyud de'i zhing du byas pa dag ni bdun na gtan du gnod par byed par gnas pa dag la yang brtse ba la sogs pa chung bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: Even in regard to those who are always harmful to the field of that stream of consciousness, love, etc., do not diminish.

original: des na de dag goms pa dang 'brel ba'i dga' ston chen po'i dus na rgyas par mi 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: des na de dag goms pa dang 'brel ba'i dga' ston chen po'i dus na rgyas par mi 'gyur ba'am /
translated: Therefore, when the great festival of their cultivation is celebrated, how could they not increase?

original: gzhan par lta ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan par lta ga la 'gyur /
translated: How could they diminish?

original: ci ste mngon par 'phel ba mthar thug pa med pa'i rgyu goms pa de ni mchongs pa la yang yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: ci ste mngon par 'phel ba mthar thug pa med pa'i rgyu goms pa de ni mchongs pa la yang yod pa nyid do //
translated: If the cause of their increase is cultivation, then that is also present in the case of jumping.

original: des na de yang de'i chos 'thob par 'gyur na de lta na yang ma yin te /
analyzed: des na de yang de'i chos 'thob par 'gyur na de lta na yang ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, if it is thought that ‚Äúthe one who jumps is the one who falls, but it is not so,

original: des na bzlog pa yin no zhes bya bar sems na bshad pa /
analyzed: des na bzlog pa yin no zhes bya bar sems na bshad pa /
translated: therefore it is the opposite,‚Äù then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:

original: de ltar mchongs nyid las mchongs min //
analyzed: de ltar mchongs nyid las mchongs min //
translated: Jumping is not nonjumping.üîΩBecause the power and exertion

original: de rgyu stobs dang 'bad rtsol dag / nus pa nges pa nyid kyi phyir //
analyzed: de rgyu stobs dang 'bad rtsol dag / nus pa nges pa nyid kyi phyir //
translated: that are the cause of jumping are definitely capable,

original: mchongs pa nges pa'i bdag nyid yin //
analyzed: mchongs pa nges pa'i bdag nyid yin //
translated: jumping is the nature of certainty.

original: brtse ba la sogs pa rigs mthun pa nyid las brtse ba la sogs pa yin pa bzhin du mchongs pa ni mchongs pa nyid las ma yin te /
analyzed: brtse ba la sogs pa rigs mthun pa nyid las brtse ba la sogs pa yin pa bzhin du mchongs pa ni mchongs pa nyid las ma yin te /
translated: Jumping is not from nonjumping, but from jumping, just as love is from love, and so on, because they are of a homogeneous type.

original: 'on kyang stobs dang rtsol ba dag las yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang stobs dang rtsol ba dag las yin no //
translated: However, it is from power and exertion.

original: rang gi mchongs pa goms par byas pa la yang stobs dang rtsol ba dang bral ba na mchongs nus pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gi mchongs pa goms par byas pa la yang stobs dang rtsol ba dang bral ba na mchongs nus pa yin no //
translated: Even when one‚Äôs jumping is cultivated, if one is devoid of power and exertion, one is not able to jump.

original: stobs dang rtsol bar rnam par gnas pa'i bdag nyid nyid ni /
analyzed: stobs dang rtsol bar rnam par gnas pa'i bdag nyid nyid ni /
translated: The nature of abiding in power and exertion

original: rang gi rgyu'i nus pa las yin no //
analyzed: rang gi rgyu'i nus pa las yin no //
translated: is from the capacity of its cause.

original: des na mchongs pa yang gnas pa'i bdag nyid du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: des na mchongs pa yang gnas pa'i bdag nyid du 'gyur gyi /
translated: Therefore jumping would be the nature of abiding.

original: gzhan du ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du ma yin no //
translated: It is not otherwise.

original: ci ste yang mchongs pa la yul can gyi goms pa nyid las mchongs pa yin te /
analyzed: ci ste yang mchongs pa la yul can gyi goms pa nyid las mchongs pa yin te /
translated: If you think that the jump is due to the mere habit of the subject, the jumper,

original: de lta ma yin na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na /
translated: then it is not so.

original: stobs ni sngon yang yod pa'i phyir //
analyzed: stobs ni sngon yang yod pa'i phyir //
translated: Because the strength existed previously.

original: mchongs par thal lo //
analyzed: mchongs par thal lo //
translated: It follows that the jump would be impossible.

original: sngar ni stobs nyid yod pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: sngar ni stobs nyid yod pa nyid yin te /
translated: Because the strength itself existed previously.

original: de ni goms pa nyid las 'phel ba'i phyir ro snyam na /
analyzed: de ni goms pa nyid las 'phel ba'i phyir ro snyam na /
translated: It increases due to the mere habit.

original: de lta na mchongs pa /
analyzed: de lta na mchongs pa /
translated: If that is so,

original: rigs mthun pa'i mchongs pa las skyes pa yin yang mthar thug pa med pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rigs mthun pa'i mchongs pa las skyes pa yin yang mthar thug pa med pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: the jump would not be the final limit of the jump, because it is born from a jump of a similar type.

original: @100a * // brtse ba la sogs pa yang de nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: @100a * // brtse ba la sogs pa yang de nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Therefore, love and so on would also follow from that.

original: 'dir bshad pa /üîΩde ni dang po phyi bzhin du //
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa / de ni dang po phyi bzhin du //
translated: Here we say:

original: mchongs min lus mi mthun pa'i phyir //
analyzed: mchongs min lus mi mthun pa'i phyir //
translated: That is not so, because the body is not similar to the previous one.

original: rtsol ba rim gyis mi mthun pa //
analyzed: rtsol ba rim gyis mi mthun pa //
translated: The effort is not similar in stages.

original: gsal na rang stobs nyid du gnas //
analyzed: gsal na rang stobs nyid du gnas //
translated: If it is clear, it abides by its own strength.

original: goms pa las ni stobs ma yin te /
analyzed: goms pa las ni stobs ma yin te /
translated: Strength is not from habit.

original: 'on kyang stobs yod pa nyid bad kan la sogs pas mchongs par mi nus pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang stobs yod pa nyid bad kan la sogs pas mchongs par mi nus pa yin no //
translated: But the power of the garu·∏ça is not overcome by phlegm, etc.

original: des na mchongs pa goms pas mi mthun pa sel ba yin te /
analyzed: des na mchongs pa goms pas mi mthun pa sel ba yin te /
translated: Thus, the elimination of the incompatible is due to the practice of jumping.

original: de'i phyir zas dang gnas la sogs pas 'di'i sngar gyi stobs de rang nyid du gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir zas dang gnas la sogs pas 'di'i sngar gyi stobs de rang nyid du gnas pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the previous power of the garu·∏ça remains as it is due to food, place, etc.

original: des na phyis mthongs kyi snga ni ma yin no //
analyzed: des na phyis mthongs kyi snga ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the later jump is not like the earlier one.

original: ci ste bcud kyis len dang 'brel pa las stobs skye na /
analyzed: ci ste bcud kyis len dang 'brel pa las stobs skye na /
translated: But if power arises from the connection with the elixir,

original: de yang bcud kyis len gyi nus pa nges pa'i phyir gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang bcud kyis len gyi nus pa nges pa'i phyir gnas pa yin no //
translated: that also remains due to the definite potency of the elixir.

original: mi dang nam mkha' lding gi phru gu dag mchongs pa goms pa mtshungs pa yin yang mchongs pa ni mtshungs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mi dang nam mkha' lding gi phru gu dag mchongs pa goms pa mtshungs pa yin yang mchongs pa ni mtshungs pa ma yin no //
translated: Although the jumps of humans and garu·∏ça chicks are equal in practice, the jumps are not equal.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / bya khyud dang ni spre'u dag /üîΩmchongs pa goms pa dang 'brel par //
analyzed: 'di ltar / bya khyud dang ni spre'u dag / mchongs pa goms pa dang 'brel par //
translated: The jumps of birds and monkeysüîΩare equal in connection with the practice,

original: mtshungs pa yin yang mchongs pa nyid //
analyzed: mtshungs pa yin yang mchongs pa nyid //
translated: but the jumps themselves

original: mtshungs pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mtshungs pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: are not equal.

original: de'i phyir goms pa yod kyang skye gnas dang rigs dang stobs la ltos pa nyid kyis mchongs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir goms pa yod kyang skye gnas dang rigs dang stobs la ltos pa nyid kyis mchongs pa yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, even though there is cultivation, the power of the seed is dependent on the place of birth, species, and strength.

original: mchongs pa tsam la ltos pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mchongs pa tsam la ltos pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not dependent on the mere jump.

original: brtse ba la sogs ba dag ni gzhan la mi ltos pa nyid do //
analyzed: brtse ba la sogs ba dag ni gzhan la mi ltos pa nyid do //
translated: Love, etc. are not dependent on another.

original: gal te goms la las stobs yin la /
analyzed: gal te goms la las stobs yin la /
translated: If power is from cultivation of karma,

original: stobs las ni mchongs pa yin pa'i phyir brtse ba la sogs pa ltar goms pa sngon du song ba can de nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: stobs las ni mchongs pa yin pa'i phyir brtse ba la sogs pa ltar goms pa sngon du song ba can de nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: and if the jump is from power, then like love, etc., it would be preceded by cultivation.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, that is not so.

original: shin tu goms par byas pa las stobs nyams pa yang 'gyur ba'i phyir skyon med do //
analyzed: shin tu goms par byas pa las stobs nyams pa yang 'gyur ba'i phyir skyon med do //
translated: There is no fault, because power diminishes from excessive cultivation.

original: gal te brtse ba la sogs pa rigs mthun pa'i sa bon tsam la ltos pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te brtse ba la sogs pa rigs mthun pa'i sa bon tsam la ltos pa yin na /
translated: If love, etc. are dependent on the mere seed of a homogeneous species,

original: 'o na ni de'i tshe thog ma med pa can yin pa'i phyir shin tu de'i bdag nyid du 'gyur na yod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'o na ni de'i tshe thog ma med pa can yin pa'i phyir shin tu de'i bdag nyid du 'gyur na yod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: then since they are beginningless, they would be extremely of the nature of that, but they do not exist.

original: des na sa bon las byung ba ma yin no zhes rtogs so zhe na /
analyzed: des na sa bon las byung ba ma yin no zhes rtogs so zhe na /
translated: Therefore, it is understood that they do not arise from seeds.

original: 'di la bshad pa ;üîΩbrtse dang sa bon las byung ba //
analyzed: 'di la bshad pa ; brtse dang sa bon las byung ba //
translated: The explanation of this is as follows:üîΩCompassion arises from its own seed,

original: gal te sa bon rang byung can //
analyzed: gal te sa bon rang byung can //
translated: If it has a beginning,

original: mi mthun phyogs kyi gnod med na //
analyzed: mi mthun phyogs kyi gnod med na //
translated: It would not be harmed by the opposing side.

original: sems la de bdag nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: sems la de bdag nyid du 'gyur //
translated: It would be of the nature of the mind.

original: gal te yang brtse ba rang gi sa bon las byung ba dang thog ma med pa can yin pa de lta na yang de'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te yang brtse ba rang gi sa bon las byung ba dang thog ma med pa can yin pa de lta na yang de'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
translated: Even if compassion arises from its own seed and is beginningless, it would not be of the nature of the mind,

original: zhe @100b sdang la sogs pa nang gis bon las byung ba can dag gis gnod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhe @100b sdang la sogs pa nang gis bon las byung ba can dag gis gnod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is harmed by the opposing side, such as hatred, which arises from its own seed.

original: gal te rten brtan pa yang yin la /
analyzed: gal te rten brtan pa yang yin la /
translated: If it were stable and

original: 'di dag bar ma chad pa nyid du yang 'gyur na de'i tshe de'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag bar ma chad pa nyid du yang 'gyur na de'i tshe de'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: if it were uninterrupted, then it would be of that nature.

original: de la 'bad pa chen pos zhe sdang la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs bsal na brtse ba'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de la 'bad pa chen pos zhe sdang la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs bsal na brtse ba'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: If one removes the opposing side, such as hatred, with great effort, then it would be of the nature of compassion.

original: 'di gdon mi za bar khas blangs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di gdon mi za bar khas blangs pa yin te /
translated: This must be accepted without doubt.

original: 'di ltar goms pa snga ma dang // snga mas sems chos brtse ba dang // chags bral rtogs sogs phyi ma dag / gsal ba yi ni rtsa ba yin //
analyzed: 'di ltar goms pa snga ma dang // snga mas sems chos brtse ba dang // chags bral rtogs sogs phyi ma dag / gsal ba yi ni rtsa ba yin //
translated: Thus, the prior cultivation of love, etc. is the root of the clarity of the subsequent cultivation of love, etc.

original: brtse ba la sogs pa'i goms pa snga ma snga ma ni sems kyi chos phyi ma phyi ma gsal ba'i rgyu yin gyi /
analyzed: brtse ba la sogs pa'i goms pa snga ma snga ma ni sems kyi chos phyi ma phyi ma gsal ba'i rgyu yin gyi /
translated: The prior cultivation of love, etc. is the cause of the clarity of the subsequent cultivation of love, etc.

original: skye ba yin na ni ma yin no //üîΩskye ba sngar gyi rgyu las yin pas goms pas ni gsal ba 'ga' zhig bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: skye ba yin na ni ma yin no // skye ba sngar gyi rgyu las yin pas goms pas ni gsal ba 'ga' zhig bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
translated: but not of the arising of the latter from the former.üîΩThe arising of the latter is due to the prior cause.

original: skye ba ni yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba ni yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But the clarity of the latter is due to cultivation.üîΩTherefore,

original: des na / rang gi don la brtson med par //
analyzed: des na / rang gi don la brtson med par //
translated: one who is not devoted to his own aim

original: gzhan don la dga' bdag nyid can //
analyzed: gzhan don la dga' bdag nyid can //
translated: but delights in the aims of others

original: goms las brtse ba'i bdag nyid de //
analyzed: goms las brtse ba'i bdag nyid de //
translated: becomes, through cultivation, compassionate by nature,

original: chags bral chags dang yid log bzhin //
analyzed: chags bral chags dang yid log bzhin //
translated: like one who is averse to passion or one who is passionate.

original: las gzhan med par goms par byas pas ni brtse ba bdag nyid du sgrub par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: las gzhan med par goms par byas pas ni brtse ba bdag nyid du sgrub par byed pa yin te /
translated: One becomes compassionate by nature through cultivation, without any other effort,

original: dper na yid log pa dang chags pa dang chags pa med pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na yid log pa dang chags pa dang chags pa med pa bzhin no //
translated: like one who is averse to passion or one who is passionate.

original: ji ltar mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis gnod pa med pa'i yid byung ba ni /
analyzed: ji ltar mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis gnod pa med pa'i yid byung ba ni /
translated: How is it that the mind is not troubled by the harm of adverse elements?

original: gang yod pas 'ga' blang bar bya ba nyid ma yin par snang bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: gang yod pas 'ga' blang bar bya ba nyid ma yin par snang bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: It is because of the existence of compassion that one does not appear to be one who should be rejected.

original: de bzhin du chags pa dang chags pa dang bral pa nyid la yang blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du chags pa dang chags pa dang bral pa nyid la yang blta bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, one should understand attachment and nonattachment.

original: de lta na ni snying rje dang ldan pa /
analyzed: de lta na ni snying rje dang ldan pa /
translated: Thus, one who has compassion

original: gzhan gyi sdug bsngal bsal bar 'dod pas rang dang gzhan gyi sdug bsngal gzhom pa'i phyir thams la mngon par sbyor ba 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyi sdug bsngal bsal bar 'dod pas rang dang gzhan gyi sdug bsngal gzhom pa'i phyir thams la mngon par sbyor ba 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa ni /
translated: wishes to remove the suffering of others. Therefore, he applies himself to everything in order to destroy the suffering of self and others.

original: thugs rje phul byung grub 'gyur te //üîΩgzhan sdug mi bzod pas bskul ba'i //
analyzed: thugs rje phul byung grub 'gyur te // gzhan sdug mi bzod pas bskul ba'i //
translated: He accomplishes the highest compassion,

original: brtse ldan sdug bsngal gzhom pa'i phyir //
analyzed: brtse ldan sdug bsngal gzhom pa'i phyir //
translated: because he is urged by the intolerance of the suffering of others.

original: thabs rnams la ni mngon sbyor mdzad //
analyzed: thabs rnams la ni mngon sbyor mdzad //
translated: The compassionate one applies himself to the meansüîΩin order to destroy suffering.

original: brtse ba dang ldan pa ni rang dang gzhan gyi sdug bsngal gzhom pa'i phyir rtsol ba'i phyir skyed pa yin te /
analyzed: brtse ba dang ldan pa ni rang dang gzhan gyi sdug bsngal gzhom pa'i phyir rtsol ba'i phyir skyed pa yin te /
translated: The compassionate one is born in order to destroy the suffering of self and others, because he strives for that.

original: rang gi sdug bsngal ma bsal bar gzhan gyi sdug bsngal bsal mi nus pa'i phyir ro //üîΩdes na rang nyid sdug bsngal dang bral ba sngon du bya ba dang / dngos po mtha' @101a * //
analyzed: rang gi sdug bsngal ma bsal bar gzhan gyi sdug bsngal bsal mi nus pa'i phyir ro // des na rang nyid sdug bsngal dang bral ba sngon du bya ba dang / dngos po mtha' @101a * //
translated: Because one cannot remove the suffering of others without first removing one‚Äôs own suffering.

original: dag mngon du byed pa la mngon par sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: dag mngon du byed pa la mngon par sbyor ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, one should first remove one‚Äôs own suffering and then apply oneself to the realization of all things.

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because

original: thabs 'byung de rgyu lkog gyur pa //
analyzed: thabs 'byung de rgyu lkog gyur pa //
translated: The means of attaining it and its cause are hidden.

original: de 'chad pa ni dka' ba yin //
analyzed: de 'chad pa ni dka' ba yin //
translated: It is difficult to explain.

original: mtho ris dang byang grol gyi rgyu dang / 'bras bu mngon du byas pa med pa gang yin pa des ni gzhan dag la bstan par dka' ba yin te /
analyzed: mtho ris dang byang grol gyi rgyu dang / 'bras bu mngon du byas pa med pa gang yin pa des ni gzhan dag la bstan par dka' ba yin te /
translated: It is difficult for one who does not have the cause and the realization of the result, namely, heaven and liberation, to teach it to others.

original: de la ni des nus pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de la ni des nus pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: For he is not able to do so.

original: gal te bden pa rnams rjes su dpag pas /
analyzed: gal te bden pa rnams rjes su dpag pas /
translated: If the truths are ascertained by inference,

original: yongs su bcad pa na /
analyzed: yongs su bcad pa na /
translated: then

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi ston par srid pa de lta na yang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi ston par srid pa de lta na yang /
translated: it is possible to teach the four noble truths.

original: thams cad kyi tshe ni ma yin /
analyzed: thams cad kyi tshe ni ma yin /
translated: But not always.

original: rang gi don 'dod pa dang dmyal ba la sogs par skyes pa'i dus na med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi don 'dod pa dang dmyal ba la sogs par skyes pa'i dus na med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not exist at the time of the desire for one‚Äôs own aim and at the time of birth in the hells, etc.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams 'od zer can la sogs par spyod pa las dang 'bras bu so sor nges pa ston pa yang mi srid pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams 'od zer can la sogs par spyod pa las dang 'bras bu so sor nges pa ston pa yang mi srid pa nyid do //
translated: And it would be impossible to teach the individual certainty of action and result in the world systems of Marici, etc.

original: de bas na thams cad mngon du bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: de bas na thams cad mngon du bya ba nyid do //
translated: Therefore, all is to be realized.üîΩAnd when it is realized, it is the realization of the cause.

original: de la mngon du byed pa na rgyu rtogs pa yin pas de nyid bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de la mngon du byed pa na rgyu rtogs pa yin pas de nyid bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation of that is:

original: lung dang rigs pas rnam dpyod pa //
analyzed: lung dang rigs pas rnam dpyod pa //
translated: By scripture and reasoning,

original: sdug bsngal nyid kyi khyad par gyis //
analyzed: sdug bsngal nyid kyi khyad par gyis //
translated: one should analyze the special nature of suffering,

original: sdug bsngal rgyu dang de mi rtag / la sogs rang bzhin rtogs par mdzad //
analyzed: sdug bsngal rgyu dang de mi rtag / la sogs rang bzhin rtogs par mdzad //
translated: and realize the nature of suffering, its cause, impermanence, etc.

original: rigs pa ni rjes su dpag pa'o //
analyzed: rigs pa ni rjes su dpag pa'o //
translated: Reasoning is inference.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa la ni /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa la ni /
translated: And for that which is not the domain of inference,

original: dbang po las 'das pa'i don shes pa'i rgyu lung yin no //
analyzed: dbang po las 'das pa'i don shes pa'i rgyu lung yin no //
translated: scripture is the cause of the knowledge of the meaning beyond the senses.

original: yang na dang po ni lung rtogs par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: yang na dang po ni lung rtogs par byed pa yin la /
translated: Or, the first is the cause of the realization of scripture.

original: de nas ni don nges pa'i 'bras bu can rigs pa la 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: de nas ni don nges pa'i 'bras bu can rigs pa la 'jug pa yin no //
translated: Then, the result of ascertaining the meaning is the engagement in reasoning.

original: lung tsam las ni don nges pa ma yin te /
analyzed: lung tsam las ni don nges pa ma yin te /
translated: The meaning is not ascertained from mere scripture,

original: brjod par 'dod pa tsam gyis 'jug pa'i phyir dang / don dang 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa tsam gyis 'jug pa'i phyir dang / don dang 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it engages merely by the desire to express it and because it is not related to the meaning.

original: 'di thams cad kyang dpyod pa la mngon du phyogs pa yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di thams cad kyang dpyod pa la mngon du phyogs pa yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: All of this is directed toward analysis, not otherwise.

original: des na je dang po nyid ni dpyod pa yin la /
analyzed: des na je dang po nyid ni dpyod pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, first is analysis.

original: de'i 'og tu ni gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i rang bzhin can gyi lung du don de lta ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu ni gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i rang bzhin can gyi lung du don de lta ste /
translated: After that, the nature of inference for the sake of others is scripture.

original: bka' lung tsam la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bka' lung tsam la ni ma yin no //
translated: But not mere scripture.

original: rtogs pa dang ldan pa ma rmongs pa ni tshad ma dang ldan pa'i don la bka' lung tsam bsgoms pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rtogs pa dang ldan pa ma rmongs pa ni tshad ma dang ldan pa'i don la bka' lung tsam bsgoms pa ma yin no //
translated: One who is endowed with realization and is not confused does not meditate on mere scripture that is endowed with valid knowledge and meaning.

original: des na don de rigs pas brtan par byas nas sgom par byed pa mngon du byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rim pa'o //
analyzed: des na don de rigs pas brtan par byas nas sgom par byed pa mngon du byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rim pa'o //
translated: Therefore, having stabilized that meaning with reasoning, one meditates and realizes it. This is the sequence.

original: de la re zhig sdug bsngal gyi rgyu nyid dang por rtogs te /
analyzed: de la re zhig sdug bsngal gyi rgyu nyid dang por rtogs te /
translated: First, the cause of suffering is understood.

original: rgyu bzlog pa'i sgo nas 'bras bu bzlog par byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu bzlog pa'i sgo nas 'bras bu bzlog par byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The effect is eliminated by eliminating the cause.

original: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu brtag pa yang @101b de'i mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i rang bzhin rtogs te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu brtag pa yang @101b de'i mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i rang bzhin rtogs te /
translated: The cause of suffering is investigated in terms of its nature, impermanence, etc.

original: de brtags pas bzlog par rung ba nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de brtags pas bzlog par rung ba nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When it is investigated, it is understood that it can be eliminated.

original: bzlog par rung ba nyid du ma rtogs par ni bzlog pa'i phyir brtson pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bzlog par rung ba nyid du ma rtogs par ni bzlog pa'i phyir brtson pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not understood that it can be eliminated, one would not strive to eliminate it.

original: rgyu med pa nyid dam rgyu rtag pa nyid yin na ni bzlog par bya ba nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu med pa nyid dam rgyu rtag pa nyid yin na ni bzlog par bya ba nus pa ma yin no //
translated: If it were causeless or had a permanent cause, it could not be eliminated.

original: 'di / rgyu med rtag tu yod pa nyid //üîΩrtag pa'i rgyu can ga la ldog / rgyu dang 'bral ba med par ni //
analyzed: 'di / rgyu med rtag tu yod pa nyid // rtag pa'i rgyu can ga la ldog / rgyu dang 'bral ba med par ni //
translated: If it were causeless, it would always exist.üîΩHow could something that has a permanent cause be eliminated?

original: dngos po ldog par ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: dngos po ldog par ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: How could an entity be eliminated without being separated from its cause?

original: rgyu yis byas pa'i dngos gang yin //üîΩde ni de med na med 'gyur //
analyzed: rgyu yis byas pa'i dngos gang yin // de ni de med na med 'gyur //
translated: Whatever entity is produced by a causeüîΩwill not exist without that cause.

original: gal te de med kyang yod na //
analyzed: gal te de med kyang yod na //
translated: If it existed without that cause,

original: 'di ni gang las med par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'di ni gang las med par 'gyur //
translated: From what would this nonexistence arise?

original: mi rtag rgyu can dngos po ni //
analyzed: mi rtag rgyu can dngos po ni //
translated: A thing that is impermanent and has a cause

original: rgyu med pas ni ldog par 'gyur //
analyzed: rgyu med pas ni ldog par 'gyur //
translated: Would cease due to the absence of a cause.

original: rtag rgyu can la rgyu med par //
analyzed: rtag rgyu can la rgyu med par //
translated: But for a permanent thing that has a cause,

original: med pas ldog pa yod ma yin //
analyzed: med pas ldog pa yod ma yin //
translated: There is no cessation due to the absence of a cause.

original: de'i phyir mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i khyad par nyid kyi sdug bsngal dang de'i rgyu mi rtag pa nyid du rtag par mdzad de /
analyzed: de'i phyir mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i khyad par nyid kyi sdug bsngal dang de'i rgyu mi rtag pa nyid du rtag par mdzad de /
translated: Therefore, the Buddha has stated that suffering and its cause are impermanent, etc.,

original: gang phyir de ltar rgyu gnas na //
analyzed: gang phyir de ltar rgyu gnas na //
translated: Because, if the cause remains,

original: 'bras ldog gzigs pa med phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras ldog gzigs pa med phyir ro //
translated: The cessation of the effect is not seen.

original: de'i rgyu gzhom phyir de yi ni //
analyzed: de'i rgyu gzhom phyir de yi ni //
translated: In order to destroy its cause,

original: mi mthun phyogs la brtag pa mdzad //
analyzed: mi mthun phyogs la brtag pa mdzad //
translated: He has taught the antidotes to its conditions.

original: gal te dbang phyug la sogs pa rtag pa 'ga' zhig sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin na de'i phyir de med par mi 'gyur pas sdug bsngal bzlog par mi 'gyur ro snyam du dgongs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te dbang phyug la sogs pa rtag pa 'ga' zhig sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin na de'i phyir de med par mi 'gyur pas sdug bsngal bzlog par mi 'gyur ro snyam du dgongs par 'gyur te /
translated: If a permanent God, etc., were the cause of suffering, then suffering would not cease, because it would not be nonexistent.

original: des na 'bras bu ldog pa'i phyir 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na 'bras bu ldog pa'i phyir 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the Buddha would not engage in activity for the sake of the cessation of suffering.

original: nus pa med pa la ni su yang mi 'jug la /
analyzed: nus pa med pa la ni su yang mi 'jug la /
translated: No one engages in activity for the sake of a powerless thing.

original: zhugs na yang bslus par mi 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: zhugs na yang bslus par mi 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: But even if one does enter it, one is not deceived.

original: 'bras bu'i rgyu gang yin pa de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs la brtag pa mdzad de rgyu spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i rgyu gang yin pa de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs la brtag pa mdzad de rgyu spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The cause of the result is investigated in order to abandon its resistance.

original: byung ba ni gnyen po dang 'brel pa med par mi ldog ste /
analyzed: byung ba ni gnyen po dang 'brel pa med par mi ldog ste /
translated: What has arisen does not cease without being related to its antidote,

original: gnyen po med par ni rgyu med par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyen po med par ni rgyu med par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: for without an antidote, it would not cease.

original: gal te rgyu med pa nyid las ldog ste /
analyzed: gal te rgyu med pa nyid las ldog ste /
translated: If it ceases without a cause,

original: las zad pa nyid las ldog pa yin no zhes gzhan dag 'dod do zhe na /
analyzed: las zad pa nyid las ldog pa yin no zhes gzhan dag 'dod do zhe na /
translated: then it would cease by the mere exhaustion of the action, as others believe.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it does not,

original: ma rig pa las las gzhan dang gzhan 'gyur ba'i phyir zad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ma rig pa las las gzhan dang gzhan 'gyur ba'i phyir zad pa ma yin no //
translated: because it is not exhausted, since it is transformed into another action and another result.

original: las dang sdug bsngal gyi rgyu ni ma rig pa yin par ston par 'gyur te /
analyzed: las dang sdug bsngal gyi rgyu ni ma rig pa yin par ston par 'gyur te /
translated: It is taught that the cause of action and suffering is ignorance.

original: des na skyon med do //
analyzed: des na skyon med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no fault.

original: gal te sdug bsngal gyi rgyu'i rang bzhin nges pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te sdug bsngal gyi rgyu'i rang bzhin nges pa med pa yin te /
translated: If the nature of the cause of suffering is not ascertained,

original: sdug pa dang bral ba la sogs pa du ma pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug pa dang bral ba la sogs pa du ma pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has the nature of many things, such as separation from what is pleasant,

original: des na bzlog par mi nus so zhe na /
analyzed: des na bzlog par mi nus so zhe na /
translated: Therefore, it is not possible to reverse it.

original: 'di la brjod pa ni /üîΩbdag dang bdag gir @102a * //
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni / bdag dang bdag gir @102a * //
translated: The response to this is as follows:üîΩThe cause of suffering is attachment

original: 'dzin byas pa //üîΩ'dus byas spyod yul can chags ni //üîΩrgyu yin de yi gnod byed ni //
analyzed: 'dzin byas pa // 'dus byas spyod yul can chags ni // rgyu yin de yi gnod byed ni //
translated: That is produced by grasping at ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine.‚ÄùüîΩThe antidote to that is the perception of selflessness,

original: bdag med mthong ba 'gal ba yin //
analyzed: bdag med mthong ba 'gal ba yin //
translated: Which is incompatible with it.

original: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu ni bdag dang bdag gir mngon par zhen pas byas pa'i chags pa yin no //üîΩchags pa ldog na ni bdag gi ba nyams pa la yid sdug bsngal bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu ni bdag dang bdag gir mngon par zhen pas byas pa'i chags pa yin no // chags pa ldog na ni bdag gi ba nyams pa la yid sdug bsngal bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The cause of suffering is attachment produced by the manifest grasping at ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine.‚ÄùüîΩIf attachment is reversed, then the mind will not suffer when ‚Äúmine‚Äù is destroyed.

original: gal te chags pa dang bral na bdag gi ba nyams pa la yid sdug bsngal ba ma yin mod /
analyzed: gal te chags pa dang bral na bdag gi ba nyams pa la yid sdug bsngal ba ma yin mod /
translated: If one is free from attachment, then the mind will not suffer when ‚Äúmine‚Äù is destroyed.

original: bdag nyid la lus las byung ba'i sdug bsngal bar ji ltar mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: bdag nyid la lus las byung ba'i sdug bsngal bar ji ltar mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But how will the self not suffer when the body suffers?

original: 'di la bshad pa /
analyzed: 'di la bshad pa /
translated: The response to this is as follows:

original: gzhan sdug bsngal bas sdug bsngal gang //
analyzed: gzhan sdug bsngal bas sdug bsngal gang //
translated: What suffering is there from the suffering of others?

original: de la bdag bde sogs yod min //üîΩbdag gi ba la mngon zhen pas //
analyzed: de la bdag bde sogs yod min // bdag gi ba la mngon zhen pas //
translated: There is no ‚ÄúI‚Äù or ‚Äúmine‚Äù in that.üîΩBut attachment to ‚Äúmine‚Äù

original: bdag la chags pa ldog par 'gyur //
analyzed: bdag la chags pa ldog par 'gyur //
translated: Will cause attachment to ‚ÄúI‚Äù to arise.

original: bu la chags pas bdag la chags pa dang bral ba dag ni /
analyzed: bu la chags pas bdag la chags pa dang bral ba dag ni /
translated: Those who are free from attachment to self because of attachment to child

original: mtshon la sogs pa dang 'brel pa las skyes pa'i lus kyi sdug bsngal yang dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshon la sogs pa dang 'brel pa las skyes pa'i lus kyi sdug bsngal yang dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: do not experience the suffering of the body that arises from contact with weapons, etc.

original: bdag dang bdag gi ba la chags pa yang 'jig tshogs su lta ba las yin te /
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gi ba la chags pa yang 'jig tshogs su lta ba las yin te /
translated: Moreover, attachment to self and to what is mine arises from the view of the transitory aggregates.

original: des na sdug bsngal gyi rgyu ni 'jig tshogs su lta ba yin no //
analyzed: des na sdug bsngal gyi rgyu ni 'jig tshogs su lta ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the cause of suffering is the view of the transitory aggregates.

original: de'i phyir bdag med pa mthong ba gnod par byed pa yin te 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag med pa mthong ba gnod par byed pa yin te 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, the view of no-self is the destroyer because it is incompatible with the view of the transitory aggregates.

original: de dang rnam par 'gal ba'i chos ni de'i gnod par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de dang rnam par 'gal ba'i chos ni de'i gnod par byed pa yin te /
translated: A phenomenon that is incompatible with that is the destroyer of it,

original: rlung la dro ba dang snum pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rlung la dro ba dang snum pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: just as heat is of oil.

original: des na bdag med pa de'i bdag tu 'gyur na /
analyzed: des na bdag med pa de'i bdag tu 'gyur na /
translated: Therefore, if the view of no-self were to become the self,

original: de las bzlog pa'i rnam pa can 'jig tshogs pa lta ba mi rtag pa yin pas na ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa'i rnam pa can 'jig tshogs pa lta ba mi rtag pa yin pas na ldog pa yin no //
translated: then the view of the transitory aggregates, which has the opposite aspect, would be destroyed, because it is impermanent.

original: des na bdag gir 'dzin pa ldog pas lus dang yid kyi sdug bsngal mtha' dag ldog go //
analyzed: des na bdag gir 'dzin pa ldog pas lus dang yid kyi sdug bsngal mtha' dag ldog go //
translated: Thus, since attachment to what is mine is destroyed, all suffering of body and mind is destroyed.

original: gal te lus bcad pa dang bsregs pa la sogs pas 'chi ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal du ci ltar mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te lus bcad pa dang bsregs pa la sogs pas 'chi ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal du ci ltar mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: not occur when the body is cut, burned, etc.?

original: de ni med de /üîΩlus de dang ni bral ba las //
analyzed: de ni med de / lus de dang ni bral ba las //
translated: That is not so.üîΩBecause there is no death

original: 'chi ba gzhan yod ma yin la //
analyzed: 'chi ba gzhan yod ma yin la //
translated: apart from the loss of that body.

original: lus gzhan grub pa skye ba yin //
analyzed: lus gzhan grub pa skye ba yin //
translated: And the establishment of another body is birth.

original: de la sdug bsngal ci zhig yod //
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal ci zhig yod //
translated: What suffering is there in that?

original: gang gi tshe lus gcig dang bral zhing /
analyzed: gang gi tshe lus gcig dang bral zhing /
translated: When one is separated from one body and

original: lus gzhan dang ldan pa dang / snga ma phyi ma'i gnas skabs dag / goms pa las skyes pa'i dran pa gsal bas dran pa de'i tshe phyis pa dang rgan po'i gnas skabs 'dor zhing len pa ltar ram /
analyzed: lus gzhan dang ldan pa dang / snga ma phyi ma'i gnas skabs dag / goms pa las skyes pa'i dran pa gsal bas dran pa de'i tshe phyis pa dang rgan po'i gnas skabs 'dor zhing len pa ltar ram /
translated: connected with another, and when one remembers the former and later states through the clear memory born of habit, then just as one gives up and takes up the states of childhood and old age,

original: @102b gos len pa dang 'dor ba lta bu yin pas /
analyzed: @102b gos len pa dang 'dor ba lta bu yin pas /
translated: or just as one puts on and takes off clothes,

original: de la gnod pa ci zhig yod /
analyzed: de la gnod pa ci zhig yod /
translated: what harm is there in that?

original: mtshams sbyor ba 'dzin pa med par ni gdung bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: mtshams sbyor ba 'dzin pa med par ni gdung bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: Without the connection of grasping, there would be no grief.

original: gang la goms pa de nyid mngon par dga' ba'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: gang la goms pa de nyid mngon par dga' ba'i rgyu yin te /
translated: The cause of delight is just that with which one is familiar.

original: tha mal par goms par byas pas ni /
analyzed: tha mal par goms par byas pas ni /
translated: Through being accustomed to the ordinary,

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: He does not experience pleasure or pain.

original: shin tu btang snyoms goms pa la ni lus dang longs spyod la gnod pa byas kyang gdung bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: shin tu btang snyoms goms pa la ni lus dang longs spyod la gnod pa byas kyang gdung bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: When one is accustomed to equanimity, one is not tormented even if one‚Äôs body and possessions are harmed.

original: sems can du lta ba ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can du lta ba ldog pa yin no //
translated: The view of sentient beings is reversed.

original: de bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de bshad pa ni /
translated: This is explained in the following:

original: rnam pa du mar thabs mang po //
analyzed: rnam pa du mar thabs mang po //
translated: Through many aspects, with many methods,

original: yun ring dus su goms pa las //
analyzed: yun ring dus su goms pa las //
translated: for a long time, through practice,üîΩthe faults and virtues

original: de la skyon dang yon tan dag / rab tu gsal ba nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: de la skyon dang yon tan dag / rab tu gsal ba nyid du 'gyur //
translated: become very clear.

original: bdag med pa mthong bas 'dod chags la sogs pa yongs su 'khrug pa'i rgyu mtha' dag dang bral zhing rtogs pa rgyas te /
analyzed: bdag med pa mthong bas 'dod chags la sogs pa yongs su 'khrug pa'i rgyu mtha' dag dang bral zhing rtogs pa rgyas te /
translated: Through seeing selflessness, one is free from all the causes of the agitation of desire and so on, and one‚Äôs realization expands.

original: thabs rnam pa mang po gzhan dang gzhan goms pa na skyon dang yon tan rnams gsal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: thabs rnam pa mang po gzhan dang gzhan goms pa na skyon dang yon tan rnams gsal bar 'gyur te /
translated: When one is accustomed to many different methods, the faults and virtues become clear.

original: bstan bcos goms na bstan bcos kyi skyon yon rnam pa du ma gsal ba bzhin no //
analyzed: bstan bcos goms na bstan bcos kyi skyon yon rnam pa du ma gsal ba bzhin no //
translated: This is like the many faults and virtues of a treatise becoming clear when one is accustomed to the treatise.

original: yon tan dang skyon gsal ba ni blo gsal ba yin te /
analyzed: yon tan dang skyon gsal ba ni blo gsal ba yin te /
translated: When the faults and virtues are clear, the mind is clear.

original: des na thugs kyang gsal ba'i phyir //
analyzed: des na thugs kyang gsal ba'i phyir //
translated: Therefore, the mind is also clear.

original: rgyu yi bag chags spangs pa ni //
analyzed: rgyu yi bag chags spangs pa ni //
translated: The Great Sage, who has abandoned the latent impressions of the cause,

original: thub chen gzhan don 'jug can gyi //
analyzed: thub chen gzhan don 'jug can gyi //
translated: is engaged in the welfare of others.

original: bse ru la sogs khyad 'di yin /
analyzed: bse ru la sogs khyad 'di yin /
translated: This is the difference between the rhinoceros-like and the rest.

original: gang gi tshe skyon dang yon tan bye brag tu phye bas rtogs pa bsal bar gyur pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe skyon dang yon tan bye brag tu phye bas rtogs pa bsal bar gyur pa de'i tshe /
translated: When one has eliminated the afflictions by distinguishing faults and virtues,

original: nyes pa phra mo dang rags pa'i nang na gnas pa'i nyes pa'i rigs skad cig ma tsam yang thams cad shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyes pa phra mo dang rags pa'i nang na gnas pa'i nyes pa'i rigs skad cig ma tsam yang thams cad shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: then one will know all the types of faults that remain, even those that are subtle or gross.

original: des na ngag ma byang ba la sogs pa yang bzlog pa'i phyir 'bad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na ngag ma byang ba la sogs pa yang bzlog pa'i phyir 'bad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, one will strive to eliminate even the slightest faults, such as unrefined speech, and so on.

original: de'i phyir bag chags spong ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir bag chags spong ba yin no //
translated: Thus, one abandons the latent impressions.

original: 'di nyid ni 'phags pa nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang mu stegs pa yang dag las bcom ldan 'das bde bar gshegs pa'i khyad par yin no //
analyzed: 'di nyid ni 'phags pa nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang mu stegs pa yang dag las bcom ldan 'das bde bar gshegs pa'i khyad par yin no //
translated: This is the difference between the Blessed One, the Well-Gone One, and the noble hearers, solitary realizers, and tƒ´rthikas.

original: yang na gal te sdug bsngal ba spangs ba yin mod /
analyzed: yang na gal te sdug bsngal ba spangs ba yin mod /
translated: Or, if one has abandoned suffering,

original: de lta na yang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni srid pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta na yang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni srid pa ma yin te /
translated: then omniscience is still not possible.

original: de lta ma yin na 'dod chags dang bral ba mtha' dag thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na 'dod chags dang bral ba mtha' dag thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Otherwise, all those who are free from attachment would be omniscient.

original: 'di bshad pa ni /
analyzed: 'di bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation of this is:

original: rnam pa du mar thabs mang po //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa du mar thabs mang po // zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: With many aspects, with many methods.

original: thabs kyis dbye ba ni /
analyzed: thabs kyis dbye ba ni /
translated: The division by method is

original: rnam pa mang po yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa mang po yin te /
translated: with many aspects.

original: dus yun ring por goms pas ni 'khor ba'i skyon yon mtha' dag @103a * //
analyzed: dus yun ring por goms pas ni 'khor ba'i skyon yon mtha' dag @103a * //
translated: By being accustomed for a long time, all the faults and virtues of cyclic existence areüîΩeliminated.

original: bsal lo // gang tshe dran pa gsal 'gyur bas //
analyzed: bsal lo // gang tshe dran pa gsal 'gyur bas //
translated: When mindfulness becomes clear,

original: sngon gyi skye ba dran gyur pa //
analyzed: sngon gyi skye ba dran gyur pa //
translated: one recalls previous lives.

original: de la de yi rjes 'brangs pas //
analyzed: de la de yi rjes 'brangs pas //
translated: By following that,

original: de dag thams cad rtogs par 'gyur //
analyzed: de dag thams cad rtogs par 'gyur //
translated: one realizes all of them.

original: ji ltar grong gzhan nas 'ongs pa //
analyzed: ji ltar grong gzhan nas 'ongs pa //
translated: Just as one who has come from another village

original: de yi 'du byed rjes 'grel can //
analyzed: de yi 'du byed rjes 'grel can //
translated: is followed by the activities of that place,

original: de rig pa yis shes 'gyur ba ;
analyzed: de rig pa yis shes 'gyur ba ;
translated: and one knows them by knowing that,

original: / de bzhin skye gzhan nas 'ongs pa //
analyzed: / de bzhin skye gzhan nas 'ongs pa //
translated: so it is with one who has come from another birth.

original: dper na grong gzhan nas 'ongs pa la de dang brten pas skyes pa'i khyad par mthong ba na /
analyzed: dper na grong gzhan nas 'ongs pa la de dang brten pas skyes pa'i khyad par mthong ba na /
translated: For example, when one who has come from another village sees the particular activities of that place,

original: de rig pas de nas 'ongs par shes pa des na grong gzhan yang de'i khyad par nyid du shes pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: de rig pas de nas 'ongs par shes pa des na grong gzhan yang de'i khyad par nyid du shes pa de bzhin du /
translated: Since one knows that one has come from there, one knows that other villages are also like that.

original: skye ba gzhan yang nges pa skyed pa'i 'du byed kyi rgyu yin pa nyid kyis rjes su dpog pa yin no //
analyzed: skye ba gzhan yang nges pa skyed pa'i 'du byed kyi rgyu yin pa nyid kyis rjes su dpog pa yin no //
translated: In the same way, one infers the existence of other lives by the cause of the formative forces that produce certainty.üîΩWhy not infer the existence of other lives, which is a hidden object, by this aspect of generosity and so on?

original: lkog tu 'gyur ba'i don skye ba gzhan yod par sbyin pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa 'dis ci ste rjes su mi dpog / des na rgyu dang 'bras bu dag nges par rig pa yin te /
analyzed: lkog tu 'gyur ba'i don skye ba gzhan yod par sbyin pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa 'dis ci ste rjes su mi dpog / des na rgyu dang 'bras bu dag nges par rig pa yin te /
translated: Thus, one knows the certainty of cause and effect.

original: 'di ni sngon las 'di dang yul 'di dang 'brel par 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni sngon las 'di dang yul 'di dang 'brel par 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: This is the connection of this action with that object.

original: 'di lta bu'i ngo bo'i rnam pa dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i ngo bo'i rnam pa dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is connected with an aspect of such a nature.

original: so sor nges pa'i yul la sogs pa dang 'brel pa /
analyzed: so sor nges pa'i yul la sogs pa dang 'brel pa /
translated: It is connected with a specific object and so on.

original: de'i 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gyi bye brag gi rang bzhin nges par rtogs pa ni rgyu'i rang bzhin dang de'i 'bras bu'i rang bzhin gyi bye brag dang 'brel pa mtha' dag rig pa'i phyir so sor nges pa'i rang bzhin thams cad rig pas na /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gyi bye brag gi rang bzhin nges par rtogs pa ni rgyu'i rang bzhin dang de'i 'bras bu'i rang bzhin gyi bye brag dang 'brel pa mtha' dag rig pa'i phyir so sor nges pa'i rang bzhin thams cad rig pas na /
translated: The knowledge of the specific nature of the result and the specific nature of the cause is the knowledge of all the connections between the specific nature of the cause and the specific nature of its result.

original: las dang 'bras bu la sogs pa'i 'brel pa thams cad yongs su shes pa yin no //üîΩmtho ris dang ni byang grol lam //
analyzed: las dang 'bras bu la sogs pa'i 'brel pa thams cad yongs su shes pa yin no // mtho ris dang ni byang grol lam //
translated: Thus, it is the complete knowledge of all the connections between action and result, etc.üîΩThe knowledge of the path to heaven and liberation

original: ji bzhin du ni mkhyen pa na //
analyzed: ji bzhin du ni mkhyen pa na //
translated: is the knowledge of the path to the higher realms and to liberation.

original: skyes bu'i don mkhyen tsam gyis ni //
analyzed: skyes bu'i don mkhyen tsam gyis ni //
translated: The knowledge of the mere purpose of beings

original: ston pa yongs su rdzogs par 'dod //
analyzed: ston pa yongs su rdzogs par 'dod //
translated: is asserted to be the complete knowledge of the Teacher.

original: 'gro ba mtha' dag kyang phan tshun rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po las 'das par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'gro ba mtha' dag kyang phan tshun rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po las 'das par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: The entire world is not beyond being the object of mutual cause and result.
