original: des na rgyu 'bras kyi dngos po rnam pa du ma bsgoms pa dang rjes su 'brel pas 'gro ba mtha' dag rig par 'gyur ba ni kha na ma tho ba med pa yin pa des na thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: des na rgyu 'bras kyi dngos po rnam pa du ma bsgoms pa dang rjes su 'brel pas 'gro ba mtha' dag rig par 'gyur ba ni kha na ma tho ba med pa yin pa des na thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, since he is connected with the meditation on the many aspects of causal and resultant things, he is omniscient, without fault, since he knows all things.

original: 'on te rjes su dpag pas rig na 'di ji ltar dngos su gzigs pa can yin /
analyzed: 'on te rjes su dpag pas rig na 'di ji ltar dngos su gzigs pa can yin /
translated: If he knows by inference, how can he be one who sees directly?

original: bcom ldan 'das ni mngon du gzigs pa por 'dod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni mngon du gzigs pa por 'dod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: The Lord is accepted as one who sees directly.

original: de yang gyi na nyid de /üîΩrnam kun rjes dpog gang yin te //
analyzed: de yang gyi na nyid de / rnam kun rjes dpog gang yin te //
translated: That is not so.üîΩInference is not distinguished from perception

original: mngon sum las ni dbyer yod min //üîΩdbang po dang ni 'brel pas kyang //
analyzed: mngon sum las ni dbyer yod min // dbang po dang ni 'brel pas kyang //
translated: in every way.

original: de las khyad @103b par lhag byed min //
analyzed: de las khyad @103b par lhag byed min //
translated: Nor is it distinguished from itüîΩby being connected with the senses.

original: don gyi rang bzhin rnam pa thams cad du rig pa gang yin pa de nyid mngon sum yin te /
analyzed: don gyi rang bzhin rnam pa thams cad du rig pa gang yin pa de nyid mngon sum yin te /
translated: That which knows the nature of an object in every way is perception,

original: mngon sum gyi don ni mngon du byed pa'i don yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi don ni mngon du byed pa'i don yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the meaning of perception is the appearance of an object.

original: gal te dbang po la brten pa'i don mngon sum gyi don yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te dbang po la brten pa'i don mngon sum gyi don yin nam zhe na /
translated: If the meaning of perception is the appearance of an object connected with the senses,üîΩthen how can the mind be a perceiver?

original: 'di ni mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid ma yin te /
translated: This is not the definition of perception.

original: 'on kyang yang dag pa'i mngon sum rig pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang yang dag pa'i mngon sum rig pa'o //
translated: Rather, it is the direct awareness of reality.

original: dbang po nye bar mtshon pa tsam du zad do //
analyzed: dbang po nye bar mtshon pa tsam du zad do //
translated: The sense faculty is merely the instrumental cause.

original: gzhan yang gang zhig dbang po dang 'brel pa yin yang /
analyzed: gzhan yang gang zhig dbang po dang 'brel pa yin yang /
translated: Moreover, if something is related to a sense faculty,

original: mngon du mthong ba med pa de /
analyzed: mngon du mthong ba med pa de /
translated: but is not directly seen,

original: ci mngon sum yin nam /
analyzed: ci mngon sum yin nam /
translated: is it perception?

original: de ni dbang po nyid ma yin te nyams pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de ni dbang po nyid ma yin te nyams pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: It is not a sense faculty, because it is impaired.

original: brjod pa / mngon du byed rgyu min phyir te //
analyzed: brjod pa / mngon du byed rgyu min phyir te //
translated: We reply: It is not the cause of direct perception.

original: gal te mngon sum min 'dod na //
analyzed: gal te mngon sum min 'dod na //
translated: If you assert that it is not perception,üîΩthen it is accepted as a sense faculty

original: mngon du byed pa'i rgyu yin phyir //üîΩdbang po zhes ni nges par gzung //
analyzed: mngon du byed pa'i rgyu yin phyir // dbang po zhes ni nges par gzung //
translated: because it is the cause of direct perception.

original: dbyibs la sogs pa tsam gyis ni //
analyzed: dbyibs la sogs pa tsam gyis ni //
translated: It is not tenable that mere shape, etc.

original: dbang por 'thad pa ma yin te //
analyzed: dbang por 'thad pa ma yin te //
translated: are sense faculties,

original: nyams pa yang de nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyams pa yang de nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because impairment would follow from that.

original: mngon du byed pa'i rgyu nyid dbang po yin na ni /üîΩyid kyang de lta nyid du 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: mngon du byed pa'i rgyu nyid dbang po yin na ni / yid kyang de lta nyid du 'gal ba med do //
translated: If being the cause of direct perception is a sense faculty,üîΩthen the mind is also not excluded from that.

original: gzhan yang / yid ni gsal ba nyid las ni //
analyzed: gzhan yang / yid ni gsal ba nyid las ni //
translated: Moreover, the mind is not a sense facultyüîΩbecause it is not a basis.

original: rnam pa gsal por mthong ba yin //üîΩyid ni rnam par 'khrug pa la //
analyzed: rnam pa gsal por mthong ba yin // yid ni rnam par 'khrug pa la //
translated: and the form is clearly seen.üîΩHow can there be a clear sense perception

original: dbang shes gsal ba ga la yod //
analyzed: dbang shes gsal ba ga la yod //
translated: when the mind is disturbed?

original: mngon du phyogs pa dang 'brel pa'i yid las dbang po'i shes pa yang mngon du byed par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: mngon du phyogs pa dang 'brel pa'i yid las dbang po'i shes pa yang mngon du byed par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: The sense perception is produced from the mind that is associated with the mental faculty that is directed toward the object.

original: des na dbang pos bskyed pa nyid ni rgyu ma yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: des na dbang pos bskyed pa nyid ni rgyu ma yin pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, the production by the sense faculty is not the cause.

original: de'i rnam pa thams cad mngon du byed pas 'jug pa'i rjes su dpag pa yang mngon sum nyid yin no //
analyzed: de'i rnam pa thams cad mngon du byed pas 'jug pa'i rjes su dpag pa yang mngon sum nyid yin no //
translated: The inference that follows the engagement is also perception, because it makes all the aspects of the object manifest.

original: gal te 'das pa la sogs pa lkog tu gyur pa'i don la 'jug pa ji ltar mngon sum yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'das pa la sogs pa lkog tu gyur pa'i don la 'jug pa ji ltar mngon sum yin zhe na /
translated: If it is asked how perception engages objects that are hidden, such as the past,

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /üîΩmngon du byed pa yod pas na //üîΩ'di ni ji ltar lkog gyur nyid //
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin te / mngon du byed pa yod pas na // 'di ni ji ltar lkog gyur nyid //
translated: that is also unreasonable.üîΩHow can it be hiddenüîΩwhen it is made manifest?

original: mngon du byas pa lkog nyid na //
analyzed: mngon du byas pa lkog nyid na //
translated: If what is manifest is hidden,

original: lkog 'gyur ma yin med par 'gyur //
analyzed: lkog 'gyur ma yin med par 'gyur //
translated: what is not hidden will not exist.

original: 'on te dbang po'i byed pa las lkog tu gyur ba ma yin pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te dbang po'i byed pa las lkog tu gyur ba ma yin pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: If it is said that it is not hidden because it is produced from the activity of the sense faculty,

original: dbang po'i byed pa de nyid mngon du byed pa med par ji ltar rtogs par 'gyur ba yin /
analyzed: dbang po'i byed pa de nyid mngon du byed pa med par ji ltar rtogs par 'gyur ba yin /
translated: How can one understand the activity of the sense faculty without experiencing it?

original: mngon du byed pas rtogs na ni //
analyzed: mngon du byed pas rtogs na ni //
translated: If one understands it through experience,

original: rnam pa thams cad rjes su dpog pa la yang dbang po'i byed pa yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad rjes su dpog pa la yang dbang po'i byed pa yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: then the activity of the sense faculty would also exist in the inference of all aspects.

original: rjes su dpag pa 'jug pa ni thams cad la yod pa'i phyir //üîΩmig la sogs pa'i byed pa yang rjes su dpog pa @104a * //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa 'jug pa ni thams cad la yod pa'i phyir // mig la sogs pa'i byed pa yang rjes su dpog pa @104a * //
translated: Because the engagement of inference exists in all cases.

original: nyid las rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: nyid las rtogs pa yin no //
translated: The activity of the eye, etc. is also understood from inference alone.üîΩMoreover,

original: gzhan yang / gang tshe sngon gyi rnam pa ni //
analyzed: gzhan yang / gang tshe sngon gyi rnam pa ni //
translated: When all previous aspects

original: thams cad rjes su dpog 'gyur ba //
analyzed: thams cad rjes su dpog 'gyur ba //
translated: are inferred,

original: de tshe bdag gi mig sogs kyi //
analyzed: de tshe bdag gi mig sogs kyi //
translated: at that time the activity of one‚Äôs eye, etc.

original: byed pa yang ni rtogs par byed //üîΩ'gar byung 'gar ni byung 'gyur ba //
analyzed: byed pa yang ni rtogs par byed // 'gar byung 'gar ni byung 'gyur ba //
translated: is also understood.

original: dbang po'i byed de rjes dpag gis //
analyzed: dbang po'i byed de rjes dpag gis //
translated: The activity of the sense faculty, which occurs sometimes and sometimes does not occur,

original: rtogs 'gyur de phyir dbang po yi //
analyzed: rtogs 'gyur de phyir dbang po yi //
translated: is understood through inference.üîΩTherefore, why would the activity of the sense faculty

original: byed de de la ci phyir med //
analyzed: byed de de la ci phyir med //
translated: not exist in that?

original: gang gi tshe de nyid skyes ba 'am 'byung bar 'gyur ba rjes su dpog par byed pa de'i tshe de la 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i dbang po'i byed pa rjes su dpag pas rtogs so //
analyzed: gang gi tshe de nyid skyes ba 'am 'byung bar 'gyur ba rjes su dpog par byed pa de'i tshe de la 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i dbang po'i byed pa rjes su dpag pas rtogs so //
translated: When one infers the production or origination of that, then one understands it through the inference of the activity of the sense faculty that will originate.

original: gang gi tshe 'byung bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba nyid do//
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'byung bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba nyid do//
translated: When it will originate, then it is just origination.

original: de ni rnam pa thams cad du rjes su dpog pas rtogs pa la yod pa yin pa'i phyir ji ltar dbang po'i byed pa med pa yin /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa thams cad du rjes su dpog pas rtogs pa la yod pa yin pa'i phyir ji ltar dbang po'i byed pa med pa yin /
translated: Since it exists in the understanding through inference in every way, how can there be no activity of the sense faculty?

original: gal te byung ba dang 'byung bar 'gyur ba yang ji ltar yod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te byung ba dang 'byung bar 'gyur ba yang ji ltar yod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If origination and that which will originate also exist, how?

original: de ni ma yin te /üîΩmngon du bya nyid dngos po de'i //
analyzed: de ni ma yin te / mngon du bya nyid dngos po de'i //
translated: That is not so.

original: yod pa nyid du brjod ma yin //üîΩthams cad du ni dngos po yi //
analyzed: yod pa nyid du brjod ma yin // thams cad du ni dngos po yi //
translated: The actuality of that thing is not expressed as mere manifestation.üîΩThe existence of a thing is understood everywhere

original: yod nyid don byed pa la rtogs //
analyzed: yod nyid don byed pa la rtogs //
translated: in the performance of a function.

original: da ltar ba mngon par 'dod pa'i bya ba la sogs pa'i don gyi bdag nyid la yang mngon du byed pa nyid las de yod par rtogs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: da ltar ba mngon par 'dod pa'i bya ba la sogs pa'i don gyi bdag nyid la yang mngon du byed pa nyid las de yod par rtogs pa yin gyi /
translated: It is also known to exist through the direct perception of the present, which has the nature of the object, such as the action of desiring.

original: gzhan las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan las ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not known through anything else.

original: gal te me la sogs pa mngon du byas pa la yang rjes su dpag pas yod par rtogs pa ma yin na ma zhe na /
analyzed: gal te me la sogs pa mngon du byas pa la yang rjes su dpag pas yod par rtogs pa ma yin na ma zhe na /
translated: If it is argued that it is not known through inference that fire, etc. exist even though they are directly perceived,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: de yang de lta bu nyid rjes su dpog go //üîΩmngon sum byas pa'am /
analyzed: de yang de lta bu nyid rjes su dpog go // mngon sum byas pa'am /
translated: It is inferred that it is just like that.üîΩIt is inferred that it is directly perceived,

original: byed pa'am byed par 'gyur ba rjes su dpog pa yin te /
analyzed: byed pa'am byed par 'gyur ba rjes su dpog pa yin te /
translated: that it is being directly perceived, or that it will be directly perceived.

original: gzhan du na rjes su dpag pa mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na rjes su dpag pa mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, inference would not occur.

original: mthong ba'i rjes su 'brang ba na mthong bar bya ba nyid rjes su dpog par byed de /
analyzed: mthong ba'i rjes su 'brang ba na mthong bar bya ba nyid rjes su dpog par byed de /
translated: When following what is seen, one infers what is to be seen.

original: de lta bu ma yin na mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bu ma yin na mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it were not so, it would not be tenable.

original: gal te 'gas kyang ma mthong mi mthong mthong bar mi 'gyur ba ni /
analyzed: gal te 'gas kyang ma mthong mi mthong mthong bar mi 'gyur ba ni /
translated: If no one has seen, no one is seeing, and no one will see,

original: de'i tshe ri bong gi rva dang mtshungs par med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i tshe ri bong gi rva dang mtshungs par med pa nyid do //
translated: then it is just like the horn of a rabbit, which does not exist.

original: nus pa nye bar brjod pa thams cad dang bral ba ni nye bar brjod pa med pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: nus pa nye bar brjod pa thams cad dang bral ba ni nye bar brjod pa med pa nyid yin no //
translated: The past and future are not real because they are not directly perceived.üîΩIf they exist, they must be directly perceived, like the present.üîΩIf they do not exist, it is pointless to discuss whether they are directly perceived or not.

original: gal te da ltar ba'i dus dang 'brel pas yod pa nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te da ltar ba'i dus dang 'brel pas yod pa nyid yin gyi /
translated: If you say that the past and future exist because they are related to the present,

original: mngon du byed pa ma yin no //üîΩde lta yin dang rnal 'byor pa rnams 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa mngon sum du byed pa nyid du khyed 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: mngon du byed pa ma yin no // de lta yin dang rnal 'byor pa rnams 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa mngon sum du byed pa nyid du khyed 'dod pa yin te /
translated: then the past and future would not be past and future.üîΩIf you say that the past and future are directly perceived by yogins,üîΩthen all yogins would perceive all objects.üîΩIf you say that yogins perceive only some objects, then they would not perceive the past and future.üîΩIf you say that yogins perceive only the present, then they would not perceive the past and future.

original: da ltar byung ba tsam mthong ba yin na ni /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba tsam mthong ba yin na ni /
translated: If you say that yogins perceive the past and future as merely present, then they would not perceive the past and future.üîΩIf you say that yogins perceive the past and future as past and future, then the past and future would be directly perceived.

original: 'di 'das @104b pa la sogs pa mthong bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di 'das @104b pa la sogs pa mthong bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If you say that yogins perceive the past and future as neither present nor past and future, then they would not perceive the past and future.

original: des na skye bo thams cad dang mnyam pa nyid pas 'di lta bu mngon du byed pa nyid dam rnal 'byor pa nyid yin zhes gzhan dag 'dzer to //
analyzed: des na skye bo thams cad dang mnyam pa nyid pas 'di lta bu mngon du byed pa nyid dam rnal 'byor pa nyid yin zhes gzhan dag 'dzer to //
translated: Therefore, since yogins are the same as ordinary people, it is pointless to say that they perceive the past and future.

original: de la 'di skad brjod de /
analyzed: de la 'di skad brjod de /
translated: In response to this, we say:

original: dus ni tshad ma gang gis kyang //üîΩrtogs pa yod pa ma yin te //
analyzed: dus ni tshad ma gang gis kyang // rtogs pa yod pa ma yin te //
translated: Time is not cognized by any valid cognition.

original: mngon sum gyis ni gzugs sogs tsam //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis ni gzugs sogs tsam //
translated: Form and so on are cognized by direct perception.

original: rtogs 'gyur rjes su dpag pa yang //
analyzed: rtogs 'gyur rjes su dpag pa yang //
translated: Inference is not valid cognition.

original: mngon sum 'jug pa las 'das nas //
analyzed: mngon sum 'jug pa las 'das nas //
translated: Having transcended the domain of perception,

original: 'jug pa yang ni dmigs ma yin //
analyzed: 'jug pa yang ni dmigs ma yin //
translated: it is not perceived even by the mind.

original: mngon sum gyi ni gzugs sogs pa'i //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi ni gzugs sogs pa'i //
translated: The nature of form, etc.

original: rang bzhin nyid 'ba' zhig dmigs kyi /
analyzed: rang bzhin nyid 'ba' zhig dmigs kyi /
translated: is perceived only as it is in itself.

original: dus la sogs pa dang 'brel pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dus la sogs pa dang 'brel pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not perceived as related to time, etc.

original: mngon sum ni de'i rnam pa tsam dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum ni de'i rnam pa tsam dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because perception is related only to its aspect.

original: mdun na gnas pa'i rnam pa 'dzin pa las gzhan du ni mngon sum rtogs pa med do //
analyzed: mdun na gnas pa'i rnam pa 'dzin pa las gzhan du ni mngon sum rtogs pa med do //
translated: There is no perception of the object apart from the apprehension of its aspect in the present.

original: de lta ma yin na thams cad mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na thams cad mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, everything would be seen.

original: dus ni ka ba la sogs pa ltar mdun na gnas pa'i rnam pa nyid du dmigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dus ni ka ba la sogs pa ltar mdun na gnas pa'i rnam pa nyid du dmigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Time is not perceived as the present aspect of a pillar, etc.

original: rjes su dpag pa yang mngon sum med par mi 'gyur ro //üîΩ'on te 'byung ba dang yun ring ba la sogs par ni gzung bar bya ba'am /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa yang mngon sum med par mi 'gyur ro // 'on te 'byung ba dang yun ring ba la sogs par ni gzung bar bya ba'am /
translated: Inference does not occur without perception.

original: rjes su dpag par bya ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rjes su dpag par bya ba yin no zhe na /
translated: But if it is said that time is perceived or inferred as past, present, or future,

original: de yang yang dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang yang dag pa ma yin te /
translated: that is not correct.

original: dus ni yun ring mnyam sogs pa'i //
analyzed: dus ni yun ring mnyam sogs pa'i //
translated: Time is not perceived as long, short, etc.

original: blo yi mdun na gnas pa yin //
analyzed: blo yi mdun na gnas pa yin //
translated: It is present before the mind.

original: de lta'i rnam pa dang bral na //
analyzed: de lta'i rnam pa dang bral na //
translated: If it is devoid of such an aspect,

original: blo ni mngon sum yin mi 'dod //
analyzed: blo ni mngon sum yin mi 'dod //
translated: we do not maintain that the mind is perception.

original: yun ring por byas so zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bum pa la sogs pa nyid snang ba yin gyi /
analyzed: yun ring por byas so zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bum pa la sogs pa nyid snang ba yin gyi /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúIt is made for a long time‚Äù and so on means that the pot and so on appear,

original: des na dus gzhan ni snang ba med do //
analyzed: des na dus gzhan ni snang ba med do //
translated: but the time does not appear.

original: 'on te yang bum pa la sogs pa nyid kyi 'bras bu rten pa snang ba yin na /
analyzed: 'on te yang bum pa la sogs pa nyid kyi 'bras bu rten pa snang ba yin na /
translated: But if the effect of the pot and so on is the appearance of the support,

original: 'o na yun ring po la sogs pa'i don ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na yun ring po la sogs pa'i don ci yin zhe na /
translated: then what is the meaning of the term ‚Äúlong time‚Äù and so on?

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here they say:

original: rgyu rnams nye bar mi gnas phyir //
analyzed: rgyu rnams nye bar mi gnas phyir //
translated: Because the causes do not remain,

original: dus med na yang bum sogs kyi //üîΩcha sogs dal bus rim gyis ni //üîΩrdzogs pa yun ring don yin no //
analyzed: dus med na yang bum sogs kyi // cha sogs dal bus rim gyis ni // rdzogs pa yun ring don yin no //
translated: even though time does not exist,üîΩthe gradual completionüîΩof the parts of the pot and so on is the meaning of long time.

original: bum pa la sogs pa cha shas dal bus rim gyis yongs su rdzogs par grub pa gang yin pa de nyid yun ring po'i sgra'i don to //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa cha shas dal bus rim gyis yongs su rdzogs par grub pa gang yin pa de nyid yun ring po'i sgra'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the term ‚Äúlong time‚Äù is just the gradual and slow completion of the parts of the pot and so on.

original: gal te dus med na dal bus dang rim pa de nyid mi 'thad do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te dus med na dal bus dang rim pa de nyid mi 'thad do zhe na /
translated: If time does not exist, then slowness and that sequence are untenable.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not so.

original: sgrub par byed pa nye bar mi gnas pa tsam gyis de 'thad pa'i phyir ro //üîΩsgrub par byed pa nye bar mi gnas pa yang nye bar gnas pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa nye bar mi gnas pa tsam gyis de 'thad pa'i phyir ro // sgrub par byed pa nye bar mi gnas pa yang nye bar gnas pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro//
translated: because it is not tenable that it is due to the mere non-existence of the cause of the effect.üîΩThe non-existence of the cause is not tenable because there is no cause for its existence.

original: @105a * // nye ba'i rgyu med pa yang de'i rgyu med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: @105a * // nye ba'i rgyu med pa yang de'i rgyu med pa'i phyir te /
translated: And the non-existence of the cause is not tenable because there is no cause for its non-existence.

original: de ltar na rgyu'i rtsom pa 'di ni thog ma med pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rgyu'i rtsom pa 'di ni thog ma med pa yin no //
translated: Thus, this beginning of causality is without beginning.

original: de'i phyir dus zhes bya ba 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir dus zhes bya ba 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, time does not exist at all.üîΩIf the effect‚Äôs slowness or speed

original: 'on te 'bras bu'i bul ba dang // myur ba dus kyi stobs kyis ni //üîΩ'jug na de la rgyu yis ni //
analyzed: 'on te 'bras bu'i bul ba dang // myur ba dus kyi stobs kyis ni // 'jug na de la rgyu yis ni //
translated: is due to the power of time,

original: ci zhig byas par gyur pa soms //
analyzed: ci zhig byas par gyur pa soms //
translated: consider what the cause has done!

original: 'bras bu rnams kyis 'jug par byed pa dus yin na /
analyzed: 'bras bu rnams kyis 'jug par byed pa dus yin na /
translated: If time is the cause of the effect‚Äôs slowness or speed,

original: de la rgyu rnams kyi byed pa'i 'bras bu gang yin /
analyzed: de la rgyu rnams kyi byed pa'i 'bras bu gang yin /
translated: what is the effect of the cause?

original: rgyu med par dus kyis mi nus so zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu med par dus kyis mi nus so zhe na /
translated: If you say that time cannot do it without a cause,

original: 'o na ni rgyu yod pa dang med pa nyid las 'bras bu skyes pa yin gyi dus ni nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'o na ni rgyu yod pa dang med pa nyid las 'bras bu skyes pa yin gyi dus ni nus pa ma yin no //
translated: then the effect arises from the existence or non-existence of the cause, but time is not able to do it.

original: gal te dus med par rgyu rnams kyis mi nus pa yin na dus rgyu'i dngos por rigs pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te dus med par rgyu rnams kyis mi nus pa yin na dus rgyu'i dngos por rigs pa yin na /
translated: If causes are not able to produce effects without time, then time is reasonable as the entity that is the cause of things.

original: dus ni med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dus ni med pa ma yin te /
translated: But time does not exist,

original: khyab pa dang rtag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyab pa dang rtag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is pervasive and permanent.

original: 'on te dus gzhan dang gzhan nye bar gnas pa la ltos pa'i rgyu las skye ba yin na /
analyzed: 'on te dus gzhan dang gzhan nye bar gnas pa la ltos pa'i rgyu las skye ba yin na /
translated: But if it is produced from a cause that depends on the presence of another time,

original: dus gzhan dang gzhan nye bar gnas pa de nyid ga las /
analyzed: dus gzhan dang gzhan nye bar gnas pa de nyid ga las /
translated: then where does that other time come from?

original: rgyu gzhan las so zhe na /üîΩde nyid las 'bras bu'i rim pa yin la rag mod /
analyzed: rgyu gzhan las so zhe na / de nyid las 'bras bu'i rim pa yin la rag mod /
translated: From another cause.

original: dus kyis ci bya /
analyzed: dus kyis ci bya /
translated: But then the sequence of effects is just that, and what is the use of time?

original: rim pa nyid dus yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rim pa nyid dus yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the sequence itself is time,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: rim pa ni 'di lhan cig pa dang lhan cig pa ma yin pa'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: rim pa ni 'di lhan cig pa dang lhan cig pa ma yin pa'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir la /
translated: The sequence is the state of being simultaneous or not simultaneous,

original: de yang dngos po'i rang bzhin nyid yin pas dus gzhan med do //
analyzed: de yang dngos po'i rang bzhin nyid yin pas dus gzhan med do //
translated: and that is the nature of entities, so another time does not exist.

original: ji ste nyi ma la sogs pa'i rgyu ba nyid dus yin na /
analyzed: ji ste nyi ma la sogs pa'i rgyu ba nyid dus yin na /
translated: But if you say that the movement of the sun and so on is time,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: nyi ma la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo las tha dad pa'i rgyu ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyi ma la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo las tha dad pa'i rgyu ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no movement of the sun, etc., apart from its own nature.

original: de'i rang gi ngo bo yang mngon sum gyis rtogs par bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: de'i rang gi ngo bo yang mngon sum gyis rtogs par bya ba nyid do //
translated: And its own nature is to be realized by direct perception.

original: mthong 'gyur 'das pa'i dus nyid do //
analyzed: mthong 'gyur 'das pa'i dus nyid do //
translated: The past is that which has been seen.

original: mthong bzhin pa ni da ltar ba //
analyzed: mthong bzhin pa ni da ltar ba //
translated: The present is that which is being seen.

original: mthong 'gyur 'byung ba nyid do zhes //
analyzed: mthong 'gyur 'byung ba nyid do zhes //
translated: The future is that which will be seen.

original: de ltar dus ni rnam pa gnas //
analyzed: de ltar dus ni rnam pa gnas //
translated: Thus time is established as a kind of collection.

original: 'o na ci ltar dngos po 'di'i dus ni 'di yin no zhes tha dad par rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar dngos po 'di'i dus ni 'di yin no zhes tha dad par rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But how is it that one understands the time of a thing as distinct?üîΩJust as one understands the body of a lump of sugar

original: 'di ni mchi gu'i lus yin zhes //üîΩldog par rtogs pa ci lta ba //
analyzed: 'di ni mchi gu'i lus yin zhes // ldog par rtogs pa ci lta ba //
translated: as distinct from the body of a man,

original: de bzhin dus ni tha dad du //
analyzed: de bzhin dus ni tha dad du //
translated: in the same way one understands time

original: rtogs 'chad mas 'thad pa yin //
analyzed: rtogs 'chad mas 'thad pa yin //
translated: as distinct, and that is reasonable.

original: de bzhin du yang 'jig rten dag brjod de /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang 'jig rten dag brjod de /
translated: And so people say,

original: khyod kyi skyes pa'i dus gang yin //
analyzed: khyod kyi skyes pa'i dus gang yin //
translated: ‚ÄúWhat is your time of birth?

original: khyod ci bde sogs gnas sam zhes //üîΩde yi rang bzhin khyad par nyid //
analyzed: khyod ci bde sogs gnas sam zhes // de yi rang bzhin khyad par nyid //
translated: Are you well, and so on?‚ÄùüîΩWhen one asks about its nature,

original: 'dri na tshig 'di 'thad pa yin //
analyzed: 'dri na tshig 'di 'thad pa yin //
translated: this expression is reasonable.

original: des na da ltar mi mthong ba ni 'das @105b pa dang ma 'ongs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don gyi de kho na'o //
analyzed: des na da ltar mi mthong ba ni 'das @105b pa dang ma 'ongs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don gyi de kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the expression ‚Äúpast and future‚Äù is that which is not seen at present.

original: gal te de lta na rnal 'byor ba rnams la 'das pa la sogs pa mthong ngo zhes bya ba mi mthong ba yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te de lta na rnal 'byor ba rnams la 'das pa la sogs pa mthong ngo zhes bya ba mi mthong ba yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that is so, then it would follow that yogis do not see the past, etc.

original: de la gal te rang gis mi mthong ba mthong ba yin no zhes brjod na ni /
analyzed: de la gal te rang gis mi mthong ba mthong ba yin no zhes brjod na ni /
translated: If you say that they see what they do not see,

original: de'i tshe ma yin la mo gsham yang yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe ma yin la mo gsham yang yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then it would follow that they see a barren woman‚Äôs son.

original: de'i phyir 'das pa la sogs pa mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i don ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'das pa la sogs pa mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i don ci yin zhe na /
translated: Therefore, what is the meaning of the expression ‚Äúthey see the past, etc.‚Äù?

original: gzhan gyis mthong bar bya ba ma yin pa mthong ba ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyis mthong bar bya ba ma yin pa mthong ba ste /
translated: They see what is not seen by others.

original: des mthong ba nyid kyis na de tsam du ni de da ltar ba nyid yin pas skyon med do //
analyzed: des mthong ba nyid kyis na de tsam du ni de da ltar ba nyid yin pas skyon med do //
translated: Since they see it, it is present. Therefore, there is no error.

original: gzhan la ltos nas ni de 'das pa nyid la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan la ltos nas ni de 'das pa nyid la sogs pa yin no //
translated: But in relation to others, it is past, etc.

original: de'i phyir mngon du byas pa gang yin pa de nyid yod pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir mngon du byas pa gang yin pa de nyid yod pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because that which is manifested exists,

original: 'das pa la sogs pa la dbang po'i byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'das pa la sogs pa la dbang po'i byed pa ma yin te /
translated: the sense faculties do not function with respect to the past, etc.

original: mngon du byas pa de yod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon du byas pa de yod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the manifestation of that exists.

original: gzhan yang dus de dang 'brel par //
analyzed: gzhan yang dus de dang 'brel par //
translated: Moreover, with respect to that time,

original: gang tshe de mngon byas 'gyur ba //
analyzed: gang tshe de mngon byas 'gyur ba //
translated: when it is manifested,

original: de tshe da ltar yod min yang //
analyzed: de tshe da ltar yod min yang //
translated: even though it does not exist at present,

original: de yi yod nyid 'thad mi dka' //
analyzed: de yi yod nyid 'thad mi dka' //
translated: it is not difficult for its existence to be tenable.

original: gal te da ltar ba'i dus dang 'brel pa med kyang /
analyzed: gal te da ltar ba'i dus dang 'brel pa med kyang /
translated: Even though it is not related to the present time,

original: de'i tshe dus dang 'brel pa de ltar byung ba'i dngos po mngon du byas pa ni yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i tshe dus dang 'brel pa de ltar byung ba'i dngos po mngon du byas pa ni yod pa nyid do //
translated: at that time, the thing that occurred in relation to that time is manifested and exists.

original: des na da ltar byung ba'i don 'dzin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des na da ltar byung ba'i don 'dzin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because it apprehends the object that has occurred,

original: 'das pa la sogs pa'i shes pa la rnam pa thams cad yongs su gcod pa dang ldan pa'i mngon sum yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'das pa la sogs pa'i shes pa la rnam pa thams cad yongs su gcod pa dang ldan pa'i mngon sum yod pa nyid do //
translated: the consciousness of the past, etc. has direct perception that possesses the complete determination of all aspects.

original: 'o na de ji ltar 'das pa nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na de ji ltar 'das pa nyid yin zhe na /
translated: Well, how is it past?

original: lta ba po'i da ltar byung ba'i dus dang 'brel par mi 'dzin pa'i phyir dang / gzhan gyis ni de'i dus dang 'brel pa yang mi 'dzin pa'i phyir dang / rnal 'byor pas kyang mnyam par bzhag pa las langs nas /
analyzed: lta ba po'i da ltar byung ba'i dus dang 'brel par mi 'dzin pa'i phyir dang / gzhan gyis ni de'i dus dang 'brel pa yang mi 'dzin pa'i phyir dang / rnal 'byor pas kyang mnyam par bzhag pa las langs nas /
translated: because the present time of the seer is not grasped, because the other time is not grasped, and because the yogi, having arisen from meditative equipoise,

original: 'das pa nyid du tha snyad byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'das pa nyid du tha snyad byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: uses the expression ‚Äúit was.‚Äù

original: de nyid rnal 'byor pas da ltar mthong ba ji ltar 'das pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid rnal 'byor pas da ltar mthong ba ji ltar 'das pa yin zhe na /
translated: How can the yogi see the past as present?

original: de ni med de /
analyzed: de ni med de /
translated: That is not so.

original: 'di ltar da ltar ba'i dus nyid ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar da ltar ba'i dus nyid ni /
translated: Because the present time

original: lta po nyid kyis yin zhes rtogs //
analyzed: lta po nyid kyis yin zhes rtogs //
translated: is understood to be the seer‚Äôs own time.

original: gzhan gyi dus ni ji ltar gzhan //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dus ni ji ltar gzhan //
translated: How can the other time be different?

original: khyad par byed yin par 'gyur //
analyzed: khyad par byed yin par 'gyur //
translated: It would be the differentiator.

original: byed pa po'i dus gang yin pa de ji ltar gzhal par bya ba'i don gyi yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: byed pa po'i dus gang yin pa de ji ltar gzhal par bya ba'i don gyi yin par 'gyur /
translated: How could the time of the agent be the time of the object to be measured?

original: rta'i ngang pa nyid ni ba lang gi yin par mi rigs so //
analyzed: rta'i ngang pa nyid ni ba lang gi yin par mi rigs so //
translated: It is not tenable that the nature of a horse is that of an ox.

original: 'on te de'i tshe rtogs pa ji ltar gzhan dus yin zhe na gzhan gyi dus rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on te de'i tshe rtogs pa ji ltar gzhan dus yin zhe na gzhan gyi dus rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But if you ask, ‚ÄúHow can the present be understood as another time?‚Äù it is because the other time is understood.

original: 'di ltar / de ni de tshe 'am @106a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar / de ni de tshe 'am @106a * //
translated: Thus:üîΩIt is known at that time

original: gzhan gyi tshe //
analyzed: gzhan gyi tshe //
translated: or at another time.

original: gang zhig gang gi ngo bor rig / dngos po de yi ngo bo nyid //üîΩbyed po'i dus ni de yi min //
analyzed: gang zhig gang gi ngo bor rig / dngos po de yi ngo bo nyid // byed po'i dus ni de yi min //
translated: The entity is the nature of that which is known.üîΩThe time of the agent is not that of it.

original: dus ni byed pa po'i yin gyi don gyi ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dus ni byed pa po'i yin gyi don gyi ni ma yin no //
translated: Time is of the agent, not of the object.

original: dus gzhan gyi khyad par can nyid du rtogs pa ji ltar byed pa po'i dus gzhan gyi rjes su 'jug /
analyzed: dus gzhan gyi khyad par can nyid du rtogs pa ji ltar byed pa po'i dus gzhan gyi rjes su 'jug /
translated: How can the time of the agent, which is characterized by another time, be known?

original: byed pa po ni phyis dus gzhan nyid rtogs par byed de /
analyzed: byed pa po ni phyis dus gzhan nyid rtogs par byed de /
translated: The agent is known at another time, later.üîΩWhen the self is known, it is known as connected with another time. How can it be posited as different?

original: bdag nyid rtogs pa na dus gzhan dang 'brel par rtogs pas de ji ltar gzhan du rnam par 'jog / gzhan yang de'i tshe ni byed pa po yang de'i dus nyid du rtogs par byed do //
analyzed: bdag nyid rtogs pa na dus gzhan dang 'brel par rtogs pas de ji ltar gzhan du rnam par 'jog / gzhan yang de'i tshe ni byed pa po yang de'i dus nyid du rtogs par byed do //
translated: Moreover, at that time, the agent is known as that time.üîΩIt is known as another time by another or later.

original: gzhan gyis sam phyis ni byed pa po de dus gzhan nyid du rtogs pa yin no zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: gzhan gyis sam phyis ni byed pa po de dus gzhan nyid du rtogs pa yin no zhes bshad zin to //
translated: This has already been explained.

original: de'i phyir de ni de'i dus nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir de ltar yod pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni de'i dus nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir de ltar yod pa nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, because it is known at that time, it exists in that way.

original: de ngas der rtogs so zhes bya ba ni dran pa'i tha snyad tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: de ngas der rtogs so zhes bya ba ni dran pa'i tha snyad tsam du zad kyi /
translated: ‚ÄúI realized that there‚Äù is just a convention of memory.

original: don dam pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not ultimate,

original: de la mngon sum mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la mngon sum mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because direct perception does not engage it.

original: des na rnam pa thams cad du rtogs pa ni mngon sum du 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: des na rnam pa thams cad du rtogs pa ni mngon sum du 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: Therefore, realization in every way is just direct perception.

original: 'on te yang gal te mngon sum yin na ji ltar gzhan gyis mi rtogs /
analyzed: 'on te yang gal te mngon sum yin na ji ltar gzhan gyis mi rtogs /
translated: But if it is direct perception, how is it not realized by others?

original: gang la des nyams su myong ba nyid du mthong ba'i bu 'byung ba des ma rtogs pa ji ltar 'khrul pa ma yin /
analyzed: gang la des nyams su myong ba nyid du mthong ba'i bu 'byung ba des ma rtogs pa ji ltar 'khrul pa ma yin /
translated: How is it not a mistake that the mother does not realize the son, whom she sees as having experienced it?

original: rnal 'byor pas ni da ltar rtogs la /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pas ni da ltar rtogs la /
translated: The yogi realizes it in the present,

original: de dang ldan pas ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de dang ldan pas ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: but one who possesses it does not.

original: de yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang ma yin te /
translated: That is also not so.

original: ci ltar de ni ston sogs dus ldan par //
analyzed: ci ltar de ni ston sogs dus ldan par //
translated: Just as the mother sees the son as possessing the time of youth,

original: mthong ba de ltar de la gnod pa med //
analyzed: mthong ba de ltar de la gnod pa med //
translated: in the same way, there is no harm in that.

original: dus der ldan ni de yang mthong med pas //
analyzed: dus der ldan ni de yang mthong med pas //
translated: Since that which possesses the time is not seen,

original: de ltar ma rtogs na yang skyon yod min //
analyzed: de ltar ma rtogs na yang skyon yod min //
translated: there is no fault even if it is not realized.

original: des ni de'i bu de ston la rtogs par 'byung bar 'gyur ba dus dang 'brel par mthong bas de ni de ltar ma rtogs kyang gnod pa med do //
analyzed: des ni de'i bu de ston la rtogs par 'byung bar 'gyur ba dus dang 'brel par mthong bas de ni de ltar ma rtogs kyang gnod pa med do //
translated: Therefore, since the father sees that his son will come to understand that object in the future, there is no fault in his not understanding it at that time.

original: gal te de'i tshe yang ma rtogs na ni des na gnod par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: gal te de'i tshe yang ma rtogs na ni des na gnod par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: But if he did not understand it at that time, then there would be a fault.

original: 'on te ji ltar des de mthong ba bzhin du rnal 'byor pa las tha dad pa gzhan gyis kyang de'i phyir ma mthong ste /
analyzed: 'on te ji ltar des de mthong ba bzhin du rnal 'byor pa las tha dad pa gzhan gyis kyang de'i phyir ma mthong ste /
translated: But if, just as he sees it, no one else, different from the yogi, sees it,

original: de'i phyir de ma mthong bas gnod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ma mthong bas gnod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: then there is a fault in not seeing it.

original: de la yang snying po med de /
analyzed: de la yang snying po med de /
translated: But that is also pointless.

original: ji ltar gzhan gyis ring mthong ba //
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan gyis ring mthong ba //
translated: Just as one sees it from afar,

original: de bzhin gzhan yang mthong ngam ci //
analyzed: de bzhin gzhan yang mthong ngam ci //
translated: does another see it in the same way?

original: phra mo la sogs yod na yang //
analyzed: phra mo la sogs yod na yang //
translated: Even if there is something subtle,

original: thams cad kyis ni mthong ba yin //
analyzed: thams cad kyis ni mthong ba yin //
translated: it is seen by all.

original: gang la gcig gi nus yod pa //
analyzed: gang la gcig gi nus yod pa //
translated: Where one has the ability,

original: de la kun gyi de yod min //
analyzed: de la kun gyi de yod min //
translated: there all have that.

original: rnal 'byor min pas mi mthong phyir //
analyzed: rnal 'byor min pas mi mthong phyir //
translated: Because it is not seen by the non-yogi,

original: ma 'ongs @106b pa zhes bya bar ngas //
analyzed: ma 'ongs @106b pa zhes bya bar ngas //
translated: I say it is future.

original: 'on te yang /
analyzed: 'on te yang /
translated: But if

original: gal te gzhan gyis mi mthong ba de lta na yang /
analyzed: gal te gzhan gyis mi mthong ba de lta na yang /
translated: Even if it is not seen by others,

original: de'i tshe de rang gi ngo bos rtogs pa yin na ji ltar ma 'ongs pa nyid yin //
analyzed: de'i tshe de rang gi ngo bos rtogs pa yin na ji ltar ma 'ongs pa nyid yin //
translated: if it is known by its own nature at that time, how could it be future?

original: gang phyir dmigs pa yod pa nyid //
analyzed: gang phyir dmigs pa yod pa nyid //
translated: Because the existence of the object

original: med nyid mi dmigs pa las min //
analyzed: med nyid mi dmigs pa las min //
translated: is not nonexistence due to nonapprehension.

original: dmigs kyang yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: dmigs kyang yod pa ma yin na /
translated: If it is apprehended but does not exist,

original: 'ga' yang yod pa nyid mi 'gyur //
analyzed: 'ga' yang yod pa nyid mi 'gyur //
translated: then nothing would exist.

original: dmigs bzhin pa ni med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dmigs bzhin pa ni med pa ma yin te /
translated: What is being apprehended does not not exist,

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because that would lead to an absurd consequence.

original: ci ste de dus gang du dmigs pa de nyid kyi tshe na de yod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste de dus gang du dmigs pa de nyid kyi tshe na de yod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that when it is apprehended at a certain time, it exists at that time,

original: de yang mi rigs te /üîΩdngos po las ni tha dad pa'i //
analyzed: de yang mi rigs te / dngos po las ni tha dad pa'i //
translated: that also is not correct.

original: dus ni 'ga' yang mthong ba med /
analyzed: dus ni 'ga' yang mthong ba med /
translated: Because time is not seen

original: ston la sogs pa'i dngos po ni //üîΩyul du 'gyur ba 'ga' zhig nyid //
analyzed: ston la sogs pa'i dngos po ni // yul du 'gyur ba 'ga' zhig nyid //
translated: as separate from things.üîΩThe thing called autumnüîΩis just a particular place.

original: yul gyi khyad par las tha dad pa'i dus ni 'ga' yang dmigs pa med do //
analyzed: yul gyi khyad par las tha dad pa'i dus ni 'ga' yang dmigs pa med do //
translated: Time that is separate from a particular place is not apprehended at all.

original: grang ba la sogs pa dang / nyi ma rgyu ba la sogs pa'i khyad par rnams ni ston la sogs pa'i dus yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grang ba la sogs pa dang / nyi ma rgyu ba la sogs pa'i khyad par rnams ni ston la sogs pa'i dus yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The differences of cold and so on, and the movement of the sun and so on, are the times of autumn and so on.

original: de dag ni dmigs pa nyid yin na da ltar byung ba nyid yin pas ji ltar 'das pa dang 'byung ba yin /üîΩston sogs la ni 'das sogs kyi //
analyzed: de dag ni dmigs pa nyid yin na da ltar byung ba nyid yin pas ji ltar 'das pa dang 'byung ba yin / ston sogs la ni 'das sogs kyi //
translated: If they are the present, how can they be the past and future?üîΩHow can the distinctions of past,

original: rnam dbye ji ltar rtogs par 'gyur //
analyzed: rnam dbye ji ltar rtogs par 'gyur //
translated: present, and future be understood?

original: gal te gzhan gyis dmigs med na //
analyzed: gal te gzhan gyis dmigs med na //
translated: If they are not perceived by another,

original: gnyis po rnam dbye med par 'gyur //
analyzed: gnyis po rnam dbye med par 'gyur //
translated: the two would be undifferentiated.

original: gal te yang de'i tshe ma dmigs pa de'i tshe yang da ltar 'byung ba ma yin par 'gyur mod /üîΩda ltar byung ba ma yin pa de ci 'das pa yin nam /
analyzed: gal te yang de'i tshe ma dmigs pa de'i tshe yang da ltar 'byung ba ma yin par 'gyur mod / da ltar byung ba ma yin pa de ci 'das pa yin nam /
translated: If they are not perceived at that time, they would not be present.üîΩHow can that which is not present be past or future?

original: 'on te ma 'ongs pa yin zhes rnam par dbye ba go gang las yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te ma 'ongs pa yin zhes rnam par dbye ba go gang las yin zhe na /
translated: How can the distinction of past, present, and future be understood?

original: 'dir brjod pa /üîΩji ltar rjes su dpag pa ni //üîΩ'jug pa de bzhin du zhes zung //
analyzed: 'dir brjod pa / ji ltar rjes su dpag pa ni // 'jug pa de bzhin du zhes zung //
translated: Here we say:üîΩJust as inference is understood

original: mngon sum yang ni dngos po de //
analyzed: mngon sum yang ni dngos po de //
translated: to engage its object, so too perception.üîΩThe object of perception is not

original: de bzhin nyid du rtogs par byed //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid du rtogs par byed //
translated: One should understand reality in the same way.

original: ji ltar rjes su dpag pas de 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa la sogs pa nyid du rtogs pa de bzhin rjes su dpag pa des skyed pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i mngon sum yang yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar rjes su dpag pas de 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa la sogs pa nyid du rtogs pa de bzhin rjes su dpag pa des skyed pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i mngon sum yang yin no //
translated: Just as one understands the past and future, etc. through inference, so also the yogi‚Äôs direct perception, which is produced by that inference, understands the past and future, etc.

original: rjes su dpag pa des bskyed pa'i mngon sum nyid gzhan du ni rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa des bskyed pa'i mngon sum nyid gzhan du ni rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: But direct perception, which is produced by that inference, does not understand anything else.

original: des na gang ji ltar rtogs pa de ni de bzhin du yod do zhes rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: des na gang ji ltar rtogs pa de ni de bzhin du yod do zhes rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should understand that whatever is understood in a certain way exists in just that way.

original: gal te mngon sum rjes su dpag pa las bskyed pa nyid yin na rim gyis rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te mngon sum rjes su dpag pa las bskyed pa nyid yin na rim gyis rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If direct perception is produced by inference, then understanding occurs in stages.

original: de lta na yang thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i dngos po'i tshogs kyis rtogs pa yongs su rdzogs pa med pa'i phyir ji ltar thams cad mkhyen pa @107a * //üîΩyin no zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na yang thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i dngos po'i tshogs kyis rtogs pa yongs su rdzogs pa med pa'i phyir ji ltar thams cad mkhyen pa @107a * // yin no zhe na /
translated: But even so, since there is no complete understanding of the collection of things without a beginning or end, how can there be omniscience?

original: de ni med de /
analyzed: de ni med de /
translated: That is not so.

original: de ni shin tu goms pa las //
analyzed: de ni shin tu goms pa las //
translated: Because of complete familiarity,

original: don de yud la rig 'gyur te //
analyzed: don de yud la rig 'gyur te //
translated: one understands that object in an instant.

original: glo bur ba yi du ba las //
analyzed: glo bur ba yi du ba las //
translated: Like smoke from a momentary fire,

original: lus can me ni rtogs pa bzhin //
analyzed: lus can me ni rtogs pa bzhin //
translated: Just as fire is known to embodied beings.

original: rgyud goms pa dang 'brel pa rnams du ba las me rtogs pa ni rim pa la ltos pa dang ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyud goms pa dang 'brel pa rnams du ba las me rtogs pa ni rim pa la ltos pa dang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: Those who are familiar with the continuum and its connection do not rely on a sequence in knowing fire from smoke.

original: des na rim pa ma yin par rtogs pas skyon med do //
analyzed: des na rim pa ma yin par rtogs pas skyon med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no fault in knowing without a sequence.

original: gal te thog ma med pa'i dngos po'i rtogs pa yongs su rdzogs par ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: gal te thog ma med pa'i dngos po'i rtogs pa yongs su rdzogs par ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: How can the complete knowledge of things without beginning be?

original: yongs su rdzogs nas yang ji ltar thog ma med pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs nas yang ji ltar thog ma med pa yin zhe na /
translated: And how can it be without beginning if it is complete?

original: de ni med de /
analyzed: de ni med de /
translated: That is not so.

original: thog med gal te rig byed kyang //
analyzed: thog med gal te rig byed kyang //
translated: If the Vedas are without beginning,

original: yin na de las ci ltar rtogs //üîΩthog ma med par rtogs pa ni //
analyzed: yin na de las ci ltar rtogs // thog ma med par rtogs pa ni //
translated: how can they be known?üîΩThe complete knowledge of what is without beginning

original: yongs su rdzogs pa yod ma yin //
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs pa yod ma yin //
translated: does not exist.

original: gal te rig byed thog ma dang tha ma med pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te rig byed thog ma dang tha ma med pa yin na /
translated: If the Vedas are without beginning and end,

original: ci ltar de las rtogs pa yi //
analyzed: ci ltar de las rtogs pa yi //
translated: how can they be known?

original: thog ma dang tha ma med pa nyid du'o zhe na /
analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma med pa nyid du'o zhe na /
translated: As without beginning and end.

original: yongs su rdzogs pa med pa'i phyir ci yang byar med do //
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs pa med pa'i phyir ci yang byar med do //
translated: But because they are not complete, nothing can be done with them.

original: gal te rig byed las gzhan gyis rtogs par mi 'gyur ram /
analyzed: gal te rig byed las gzhan gyis rtogs par mi 'gyur ram /
translated: But won't they be known by something else?

original: mi 'gyur na ni rig byed tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: mi 'gyur na ni rig byed tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: If it is not, then the Veda is not a means of valid knowledge.

original: gal te da ltar ni re zhig rtogs pa yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: gal te da ltar ni re zhig rtogs pa yod pa nyid do //
translated: If you say that it is a means of valid knowledge in the present,

original: bdag ni rig byed 'dis nges par sbyar ro snyam du rtogs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgzhan gyi tshe ni yod dam med kyang bla ste /
analyzed: bdag ni rig byed 'dis nges par sbyar ro snyam du rtogs pa'i phyir ro // gzhan gyi tshe ni yod dam med kyang bla ste /
translated: because one understands that one is bound by this Veda.üîΩIf you say that it is a means of valid knowledge at another time, whether it exists or not,

original: de lta na yang 'di 'jug par byed pa'i phyir tshad ma nyid de //
analyzed: de lta na yang 'di 'jug par byed pa'i phyir tshad ma nyid de //
translated: because it is the instigator,

original: 'jug par byed pa brjod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'jug par byed pa brjod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because it expresses the instigator.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: This is not so.

original: gal te 'di gzhan gyi tshe 'di'i don ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'di gzhan gyi tshe 'di'i don ma yin na /
translated: If at another time it does not have this meaning,

original: da lta ga las yin /
analyzed: da lta ga las yin /
translated: how does it have it in the present?

original: gal te gzhan gyi tshe rig byed don 'di dang ldan pa mchog yin no zhes dogs na da lta na yang tshad mar mi 'gyur te sngon bzhin no //
analyzed: gal te gzhan gyi tshe rig byed don 'di dang ldan pa mchog yin no zhes dogs na da lta na yang tshad mar mi 'gyur te sngon bzhin no //
translated: If you fear that at another time the Veda would be the best for this meaning, it is not a means of valid knowledge in the present, just as before.

original: gal te sngon yang de lta bu yin no //
analyzed: gal te sngon yang de lta bu yin no //
translated: If you say that it was like that before,

original: de'i pha rol dang de'i yang pha rol zhes yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i pha rol dang de'i yang pha rol zhes yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then it would not be complete, with its further and further extensions.

original: des na gcig la the tshom za na gzhan la yang yid brtan du med pas tshad ma ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: des na gcig la the tshom za na gzhan la yang yid brtan du med pas tshad ma ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, if one doubts one, one cannot rely on the other, and so they are not valid cognitions.

original: ci ste snga ma spyir gcig nyid rtogs so zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste snga ma spyir gcig nyid rtogs so zhe na /
translated: If you say that the former cognizes the oneness in general,

original: de lta yin na 'di rjes su dpag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta yin na 'di rjes su dpag par 'gyur te /
translated: then it would be inference.

original: des na rnam pa thams cad rjes su dpog pa na mngon sum nyid kyis nyams pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: des na rnam pa thams cad rjes su dpog pa na mngon sum nyid kyis nyams pa med pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, when inferring all aspects, there is no loss of direct perception.

original: des na mngon sum gyis kyang thog ma dang tha ma med pa nyid mi rig pa ma yin na /
analyzed: des na mngon sum gyis kyang thog ma dang tha ma med pa nyid mi rig pa ma yin na /
translated: Therefore, direct perception is not unaware of the absence of beginning and end.üîΩTherefore,

original: de'i phyir / rang rgyud yongs su bcad pa na //
analyzed: de'i phyir / rang rgyud yongs su bcad pa na //
translated: Having fully ascertained one's own continuum,

original: de dang 'brel pa can rtogs 'gyur //
analyzed: de dang 'brel pa can rtogs 'gyur //
translated: One will understand what is related to it.

original: de dang 'brel par rtogs na ni //
analyzed: de dang 'brel par rtogs na ni //
translated: If one understands what is related to it,

original: @107b gzhan dag bas kyang rtogs pa nyid //
analyzed: @107b gzhan dag bas kyang rtogs pa nyid //
translated: One will understand other things as well.

original: de lta yin na mtha' med pa'i //
analyzed: de lta yin na mtha' med pa'i //
translated: If that is so,

original: dngos po rig pa 'thad mi dka' //
analyzed: dngos po rig pa 'thad mi dka' //
translated: It is not difficult to understand limitless things.

original: de'i phyir tshad las shin tu 'das pa'i rgyu 'bras kyi dngos po'i bye brag goms na /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshad las shin tu 'das pa'i rgyu 'bras kyi dngos po'i bye brag goms na /
translated: Therefore, if one becomes familiar with the specific cases of cause and effect that greatly exceed the limits of valid cognition,

original: 'bras bu'i bye brag thams cad snang ba yin la /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i bye brag thams cad snang ba yin la /
translated: All the various results appear.

original: de'i mthu las kyang rgyu'i dbye ba yang yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i mthu las kyang rgyu'i dbye ba yang yin pa'i phyir /
translated: And from their power, the various causes also appear.

original: thabs goms pa 'di ni /
analyzed: thabs goms pa 'di ni /
translated: This cultivation of the means

original: thabs yongs su gcod pa'i thabs yin no //
analyzed: thabs yongs su gcod pa'i thabs yin no //
translated: is the means of ascertaining the means.

original: de'i phyir brtse ba dang ldan pa'i gdon mi za bar thabs mngon par sbyor ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir brtse ba dang ldan pa'i gdon mi za bar thabs mngon par sbyor ro //
translated: Therefore, the compassionate one must apply the means.

original: rig byed ni yongs su shes zin kyang /
analyzed: rig byed ni yongs su shes zin kyang /
translated: The Vedas are already known,

original: mtho ris dang byang grol gyi lam rig pa'i thabs ma yin no zhes sngar bstan pa nyid do //
analyzed: mtho ris dang byang grol gyi lam rig pa'i thabs ma yin no zhes sngar bstan pa nyid do //
translated: but they are not the means of knowing the path to heaven and liberation.

original: gal te thabs goms pa las de 'dod pa thams cad rig pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur mod /
analyzed: gal te thabs goms pa las de 'dod pa thams cad rig pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur mod /
translated: If one knows all the desires from the cultivation of the means, and becomes free from attachment,

original: de lta na yang bag chags kyi gnas ngan len gyis mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i gnas skabs su gzhan du yang nye bar ston par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de lta na yang bag chags kyi gnas ngan len gyis mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i gnas skabs su gzhan du yang nye bar ston par 'gyur la /
translated: even so, due to the latent tendencies of negative propensities, it will be shown elsewhere in the non-equipoised state.

original: bkres pa la sogs pa dang ldan pas kyang gzhan gyi don nyams par byed pa'i phyir rig byed las 'di khyad par med do zhe na /
analyzed: bkres pa la sogs pa dang ldan pas kyang gzhan gyi don nyams par byed pa'i phyir rig byed las 'di khyad par med do zhe na /
translated: And even if one were hungry, etc., one would not be able to help others, so the Veda is no different.

original: de ni med de /
analyzed: de ni med de /
translated: This is not so,

original: rig byed la ni gzhi med phyir //
analyzed: rig byed la ni gzhi med phyir //
translated: because the Veda has no basis.

original: don dam du na tshad ma min //
analyzed: don dam du na tshad ma min //
translated: It is not a valid means of knowledge ultimately.

original: don dang 'brel pa med pas de'i //
analyzed: don dang 'brel pa med pas de'i //
translated: Because it is not related to an object,

original: tha snyad kyang ni gzhi med nyid //
analyzed: tha snyad kyang ni gzhi med nyid //
translated: its conventional usage also has no basis.

original: rig byed thog ma med pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: rig byed thog ma med pa nyid yin na /
translated: If the Veda has no beginning,

original: dang po don dang 'brel pa 'dzin pa med do //
analyzed: dang po don dang 'brel pa 'dzin pa med do //
translated: then it cannot be related to an object at the beginning.

original: mchong sbyin byed pa rnams kyi tha snyad kyang gzhi med pa nyid do //
analyzed: mchong sbyin byed pa rnams kyi tha snyad kyang gzhi med pa nyid do //
translated: The conventional usage of the Vedic sacrifices also has no basis.

original: des na dmus long ba brgyud pa kho nar zad do //
analyzed: des na dmus long ba brgyud pa kho nar zad do //
translated: Therefore, it is just a blind leading the blind.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i don brda'i stobs kyis snang ba yin yang /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i don brda'i stobs kyis snang ba yin yang /
translated: Even though the appearance of the meaning of the Veda is due to the power of the convention of conceptual thought,

original: de tsam gyis ni don thob pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de tsam gyis ni don thob pa ma yin te /
translated: that alone does not obtain the meaning,

original: gzhan la yang mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan zin to //
analyzed: gzhan la yang mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan zin to //
translated: because it is seen elsewhere. This has already been explained.

original: 'di la ni gzhi rjes su dpag pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'di la ni gzhi rjes su dpag pa nyid yin te /
translated: Here, the basis is just an inference.

original: des na bag chags yod kyang skyon med do //
analyzed: des na bag chags yod kyang skyon med do //
translated: Therefore, even though there are latent impressions, there is no fault.üîΩMoreover,

original: gzhan yang / des na thugs kyang gsal ba'i phyir //
analyzed: gzhan yang / des na thugs kyang gsal ba'i phyir //
translated: because of the clarity of the mind,

original: rgyu yi bag chags spangs pa ni //üîΩthub chen gzhan don 'jug can gyi //
analyzed: rgyu yi bag chags spangs pa ni // thub chen gzhan don 'jug can gyi //
translated: the abandonment of the latent impressions of the causeüîΩis the difference between the Solitary Realizers and so on

original: bse ru la sogs khyad 'di yin //
analyzed: bse ru la sogs khyad 'di yin //
translated: and the Great Sage who engages for the sake of others.

original: rtogs pa gsal ba la ni skyon yon gyi rigs phra mo mtha' dag kyang snang ba yin la /
analyzed: rtogs pa gsal ba la ni skyon yon gyi rigs phra mo mtha' dag kyang snang ba yin la /
translated: When realization is clear, all the subtle types of faults and virtues appear.

original: sems can gyi don la dga' ba la ni nyes pa cung zad tsam yang gnod pa byed pa yin pa de'i phyir de goms pas sel par byed do //
analyzed: sems can gyi don la dga' ba la ni nyes pa cung zad tsam yang gnod pa byed pa yin pa de'i phyir de goms pas sel par byed do //
translated: And when one delights in the welfare of sentient beings, even the slightest fault does not cause harm. Therefore, one eliminates them through cultivating the opposite.

original: zas la sogs pa yang phyin ci log goms par byed pa nyid la 'byung gi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: zas la sogs pa yang phyin ci log goms par byed pa nyid la 'byung gi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: Eating and so on also occur due to the cultivation of error and not otherwise.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / lan gsum za ba goms pa las //üîΩ@108a * // gnyis za de yi bdag tu 'gyur //
analyzed: 'di ltar / lan gsum za ba goms pa las // @108a * // gnyis za de yi bdag tu 'gyur //
translated: Through cultivating eating three times,üîΩone becomes accustomed to eating twice.

original: gnyis za lan cig nyid 'gyur ba //
analyzed: gnyis za lan cig nyid 'gyur ba //
translated: Through eating twice, one becomes accustomed to eating once.

original: des na bkres pa gtan med 'gyur //
analyzed: des na bkres pa gtan med 'gyur //
translated: Therefore, hunger is completely eliminated.

original: gal te 'di dngos po la yod pa yin pa na ni goms pas bsgrub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'di dngos po la yod pa yin pa na ni goms pas bsgrub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were to exist in a real entity, it would not be accomplished through practice.üîΩTherefore,

original: de'i phyir / lus can rnams kyi skyon yon ni //
analyzed: de'i phyir / lus can rnams kyi skyon yon ni //
translated: All faults and virtues of embodied beings

original: thams cad goms pa'i rtsa ba can //
analyzed: thams cad goms pa'i rtsa ba can //
translated: are rooted in practice.

original: goms te bdag la rag las pas //
analyzed: goms te bdag la rag las pas //
translated: Since practice depends on oneself,üîΩone should strive for virtue.

original: yon tan nyid la byas pa mchog / goms pa gsal ba dang 'brel pa de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das bde bar gshegs pa nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dag las khyad par du 'phags pa yin no //
analyzed: yon tan nyid la byas pa mchog / goms pa gsal ba dang 'brel pa de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das bde bar gshegs pa nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dag las khyad par du 'phags pa yin no //
translated: For this very reason, the Blessed One, the Well-Gone One, is superior to the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas, because practice is connected with clarity.

original: gzhan yang gang tshe skye ba dran pa yis //
analyzed: gzhan yang gang tshe skye ba dran pa yis //
translated: Moreover, when one remembers one's past lives

original: sngon gyi ston pa dang 'brel pa //
analyzed: sngon gyi ston pa dang 'brel pa //
translated: and is connected to the past teacher,

original: de tshe lha sogs ngo bo yi //
analyzed: de tshe lha sogs ngo bo yi //
translated: at that time, for gods and so forth,

original: bkres pa la sogs yod ma yin //
analyzed: bkres pa la sogs yod ma yin //
translated: hunger and so forth do not exist.

original: gal te slob dpon gyis ston pa sdug bsngal rab tu zhi ba'i thabs nyid du bstan pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te slob dpon gyis ston pa sdug bsngal rab tu zhi ba'i thabs nyid du bstan pa ma yin nam /
translated: If the teacher has not taught the means for completely pacifying suffering,üîΩand if one does not practice, how can one attain the state of a teacher?

original: de skad du yang sbyor ba ni 'gro ba la ston pa'i phyir ston pa nyid do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de skad du yang sbyor ba ni 'gro ba la ston pa'i phyir ston pa nyid do zhes gsungs so //
translated: As it is said, Practice is called 'teaching' because it shows the path to beings.

original: de ci ltar na thabs goms pa yin par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de ci ltar na thabs goms pa yin par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How can that be the cultivation of the means?

original: de ni bden te /
analyzed: de ni bden te /
translated: That is true,

original: 'on kyang thabs goms pa nyid ston pa yin gyi //
analyzed: 'on kyang thabs goms pa nyid ston pa yin gyi //
translated: but it is the cultivation of the means that is taught,üîΩnot anything else.

original: gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba bshad pa ni /üîΩde don phyir na thabs goms pa //
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba bshad pa ni / de don phyir na thabs goms pa //
translated: The explanation is:üîΩThe cultivation of the means is accepted

original: de nyid ston pa yin par 'dod //üîΩgrub las dang po 'byung ba'i phyir ;
analyzed: de nyid ston pa yin par 'dod // grub las dang po 'byung ba'i phyir ;
translated: as the teaching of that reality.üîΩThe two are explained as the cause

original: / gnyis po 'di ni rgyu ru bshad //
analyzed: / gnyis po 'di ni rgyu ru bshad //
translated: of the arising of the first of the two accomplishments.

original: der ston pa nyid dngos su 'dod pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: der ston pa nyid dngos su 'dod pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: The teaching itself is not accepted as the reality,

original: 'on kyang thabs goms pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang thabs goms pa nyid yin no //
translated: but rather the cultivation of the means.

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: de don phyir de'i don la ni de'i sgras 'gyur ba nyid de /
analyzed: de don phyir de'i don la ni de'i sgras 'gyur ba nyid de /
translated: The reality of that is the reality of its object, which is expressed by the word ‚Äúthat.‚Äù

original: dbang po'i don gyi mchod sdong la dbang po'i sgras brjod pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dbang po'i don gyi mchod sdong la dbang po'i sgras brjod pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the expression ‚ÄúIndra‚Äù for the sacrificial post, the object of Indra.

original: de'i don nyid ga las she na /
analyzed: de'i don nyid ga las she na /
translated: How is that the reality?

original: de las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it arises from that.

original: thabs goms pa dang / blo gsal ba dag las ston pa grub pa yin no //
analyzed: thabs goms pa dang / blo gsal ba dag las ston pa grub pa yin no //
translated: The accomplishment of the teaching arises from the cultivation of the means and from the clarity of the mind.

original: de ci mngon zhe na /
analyzed: de ci mngon zhe na /
translated: How is that known?

original: de bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation is:

original: gnyis po 'di yi rgyu ru bshad //
analyzed: gnyis po 'di yi rgyu ru bshad //
translated: These two are said to be the causes.

original: de la rgyu ni bsam pa dang // sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la rgyu ni bsam pa dang // sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: The cause is the perfection of the intention and of practice.

original: bsam pa ni 'gro ba la phan par bzhed pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa ni 'gro ba la phan par bzhed pa'o //
translated: The intention is the desire to benefit the world.

original: sbyor ba ni 'gro ba la ston pa nyid do zhes so //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni 'gro ba la ston pa nyid do zhes so //
translated: The practice is the teaching of the Dharma to the world.

original: 'di rgyur bshad do zhes bya ba yang ga las she na /
analyzed: 'di rgyur bshad do zhes bya ba yang ga las she na /
translated: Why is this said to be the cause?

original: dang po brjod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dang po brjod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it is mentioned first.

original: dngos kyi ston pa nyid ni bde bar gshegs pa nyid kyi rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos kyi ston pa nyid ni bde bar gshegs pa nyid kyi rgyu ma yin no //
translated: The actual teaching is not the cause of the state of a Sugata.

original: de'i phyir thabs goms pa nyid ston pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma @108b yin no zhes rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir thabs goms pa nyid ston pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma @108b yin no zhes rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that the cause of the state of a Sugata is the perfection of the practice of skillful means, not anything else.

original: de ltar na bcom ldan 'das ni thabs goms pa las bde bar gshegs pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na bcom ldan 'das ni thabs goms pa las bde bar gshegs pa nyid yin no //
translated: Thus, the Bhagavat is a Sugata through the perfection of skillful means.

original: bde bar gshegs pa nyid de gang yin zhe na /üîΩbshad pa / rgyu spangs yon tan gsum bde gshegs //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa nyid de gang yin zhe na / bshad pa / rgyu spangs yon tan gsum bde gshegs //
translated: What is the state of a Sugata?

original: nyid yin sdug bsngal rten min phyir //
analyzed: nyid yin sdug bsngal rten min phyir //
translated: It is said: The Sugata is the one who has abandoned the cause, who has the three virtues, who is happy, and who is not the basis of suffering.

original: legs yin de ni bdag med pa //
analyzed: legs yin de ni bdag med pa //
translated: The Sugata is the one who has the three virtues.üîΩThe Sugata is the one who is happy.üîΩThe Sugata is the one who is not the basis of suffering.

original: mthong ba'am sbyor ba las yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba'am sbyor ba las yin no //
translated: It is seen or inferred.

original: bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pas byas pa 'dus byas kyi spyod yul can gyi chags pa ni rgyu yin la /
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pas byas pa 'dus byas kyi spyod yul can gyi chags pa ni rgyu yin la /
translated: The cause is attachment to the object of the conditioned, which is produced by the view of self and of things pertaining to a self.

original: rgyu de spangs pa'i yon tan gsum ste /
analyzed: rgyu de spangs pa'i yon tan gsum ste /
translated: The three qualities of the abandonment of that cause are:

original: legs pa'i phyir dang / phyir mi ldog pa'i phyir dang / ma lus par spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: legs pa'i phyir dang / phyir mi ldog pa'i phyir dang / ma lus par spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of excellence, because of irreversibility, and because of complete abandonment.

original: spangs pa'i ni bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa la sogs pa med pa yin la /
analyzed: spangs pa'i ni bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa la sogs pa med pa yin la /
translated: The abandonment is the nonexistence of the view of self and of things pertaining to a self, etc.

original: de med pas ni sdug bsngal gyi rten med pa'i phyir legs pa nyid do //
analyzed: de med pas ni sdug bsngal gyi rten med pa'i phyir legs pa nyid do //
translated: Because of the nonexistence of that, there is excellence because there is no basis for suffering.

original: bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin na ni /
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin na ni /
translated: If one grasps a self and things pertaining to a self,

original: mu stegs pa rnams kyi sdug bsngal spangs pa rgyu las sdug bsngal dang 'brel par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mu stegs pa rnams kyi sdug bsngal spangs pa rgyu las sdug bsngal dang 'brel par 'gyur ro //
translated: the abandonment of suffering by the heterodox would be connected with suffering because of its cause.

original: bdag gi bar 'dzin pa la ni /
analyzed: bdag gi bar 'dzin pa la ni /
translated: If one grasps things pertaining to a self,

original: bral ba'i sdug bsngal ba yod do //
analyzed: bral ba'i sdug bsngal ba yod do //
translated: there is the suffering of separation.

original: spangs pa de nyid ga las she na /
analyzed: spangs pa de nyid ga las she na /
translated: From what is the abandonment of that?

original: bdag med pa mthong ba nyid las so //
analyzed: bdag med pa mthong ba nyid las so //
translated: From the very seeing of selflessness.

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa ni mthong ba nyid las spong ba yin no //
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa ni mthong ba nyid las spong ba yin no //
translated: The afflictions that are to be abandoned by the path of vision are abandoned by the path of vision alone.

original: sbyor ba las kyang yin no //
analyzed: sbyor ba las kyang yin no //
translated: They are also abandoned by the path of cultivation.

original: sbyor ba ni goms pa ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni goms pa ste /
translated: Cultivation is repeated practice.

original: bsgom pas spang par bya ba'i nyon mongs pa 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: bsgom pas spang par bya ba'i nyon mongs pa 'jig pa'o //
translated: The afflictions that are to be abandoned by the path of cultivation are destroyed by the path of cultivation.

original: yang na sbyor ba ni ldan pa ste /
analyzed: yang na sbyor ba ni ldan pa ste /
translated: Or, cultivation is association.

original: phan tshun 'brel pa nyid do //
analyzed: phan tshun 'brel pa nyid do //
translated: It is mutual connection.

original: gnyis su med pa nyid dam /
analyzed: gnyis su med pa nyid dam /
translated: It is non-duality.

original: gnyis su med pa mthong ba'o //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa mthong ba'o //
translated: It is the vision of non-duality.

original: gang gi tshe gang zag bdag med pa las sam /
analyzed: gang gi tshe gang zag bdag med pa las sam /
translated: When one sees the selflessness of persons or

original: 'on te chos bdag med pa las kyang rung ste /üîΩrnam pa thams cad bdag med pa /
analyzed: 'on te chos bdag med pa las kyang rung ste / rnam pa thams cad bdag med pa /
translated: the selflessness of phenomena,üîΩone sees the selflessness of all things.

original: mthong ba las sdug bsngal gyi rten ma yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba las sdug bsngal gyi rten ma yin no //
translated: Then suffering has no basis.

original: de ltar re zhig legs pa nyid kyi yon tan gcig yin no //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig legs pa nyid kyi yon tan gcig yin no //
translated: Thus, in this way, non-return is a good quality.

original: yon tan gnyis pa ni phyir mi ldog pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: yon tan gnyis pa ni phyir mi ldog pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the second good quality?üîΩIt is said:üîΩThe arising of the faults and the origination

original: bshad pa / skye dang skyon ni kun 'byung dag / slar yang ldog ces bshad pa yin //
analyzed: bshad pa / skye dang skyon ni kun 'byung dag / slar yang ldog ces bshad pa yin //
translated: are explained as returning again.

original: bdag lta'i sa bon spangs pa'i phyir //
analyzed: bdag lta'i sa bon spangs pa'i phyir //
translated: Because the seed of the view of a self is abandoned,üîΩone does not return to this world.

original: slar mi gshegs pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: slar mi gshegs pa nyid yin no //
translated: and they do not return.

original: skye ba dang skyon kun tu 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: skye ba dang skyon kun tu 'byung ba ni /
translated: The occurrence of faults and birth

original: phyir ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: phyir ldog pa yin no //
translated: is the return.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa med pa'i phyir skyon med pa'i gnas skabs dang / yang skye ba med pa'i phyir skye ba med pa ni thar pa'i grong khyer du son pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa med pa'i phyir skyon med pa'i gnas skabs dang / yang skye ba med pa'i phyir skye ba med pa ni thar pa'i grong khyer du son pa yin no //
translated: Because of the absence of desire, etc., the state of faultlessness and the absence of birth are the arrival at the city of liberation.

original: nyes pa dang skye ba yod pa ni phyir ldog pa @109a * //
analyzed: nyes pa dang skye ba yod pa ni phyir ldog pa @109a * //
translated: The occurrence of faults and birth is the return.

original: zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: This is what is said.

original: des na bdag tu lta ba med pa'i phyir na nyes pa slar skye ba ma yin te /
