analyzed: des na bdag tu lta ba med pa'i phyir na nyes pa slar skye ba ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, because of the absence of the view of self, faults do not occur again,

original: bdag tu lta ba'i sa bon drungs phyung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba'i sa bon drungs phyung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the seed of the view of self has been uprooted.

original: nyon mongs pa med pa'i phyir na skye ba yang srid pa ma yin te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa'i phyir na skye ba yang srid pa ma yin te /
translated: And because of the absence of afflictions, birth does not occur again.

original: des na slar mi gshegs pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: des na slar mi gshegs pa nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, they do not return.

original: skye ba las dang nyon mongs pa las byung ba yin no zhes ni phyis bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: skye ba las dang nyon mongs pa las byung ba yin no zhes ni phyis bstan par bya'o //
translated: It will be shown later that birth occurs from action and affliction.

original: bdag tu lta ba med pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa yod pa ga la 'gyur zhes brjod de /üîΩbdag la phan 'dogs dran pa las //üîΩphan 'dogs pa la chags pa nyid //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba med pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa yod pa ga la 'gyur zhes brjod de / bdag la phan 'dogs dran pa las // phan 'dogs pa la chags pa nyid //
translated: How can there be afflictions when there is no view of self?üîΩAttachment arises from remembering benefits

original: gnod byed dran na zhe sdang ste //
analyzed: gnod byed dran na zhe sdang ste //
translated: to oneself, and anger from remembering harm.

original: bdag sogs lta ba gti mug yin //
analyzed: bdag sogs lta ba gti mug yin //
translated: The view of self and so on is delusion.

original: bdag la phan 'dogs pa dang gnod pa byed pa la chags pa dang sdang ba yin na de dag ni bdag med pa'i phyir med pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag la phan 'dogs pa dang gnod pa byed pa la chags pa dang sdang ba yin na de dag ni bdag med pa'i phyir med pa yin no //
translated: Attachment arises from remembering benefits to oneself and anger arises from remembering harm to oneself. But they do not exist because the self does not exist.

original: bdag tu lta ba ni gti mug yin la /
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba ni gti mug yin la /
translated: The view of self is delusion.

original: de ni bdag med pa'i ngo bos gtan du bzlog pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ni bdag med pa'i ngo bos gtan du bzlog pa nyid do //
translated: It is completely stopped by the reality of selflessness.

original: gnyes su med pa mthong na ni 'dod chags la sogs pa shin tu gsal ba nyid ldog pa yin te /
analyzed: gnyes su med pa mthong na ni 'dod chags la sogs pa shin tu gsal ba nyid ldog pa yin te /
translated: When one sees the absence of self, attachment and so on are completely stopped because they are very clear.

original: yul med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the object does not exist.

original: gal te bdag med pa mthong ba ji ltar bdag tu lta ba'i zlog par byed pa yin /
analyzed: gal te bdag med pa mthong ba ji ltar bdag tu lta ba'i zlog par byed pa yin /
translated: If one sees selflessness, how can it stop the view of self?

original: phyin ci log tu 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: phyin ci log tu 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Because it would be a mistake.

original: phyin ci log nyid ni phan tshun du mtshungs pa nyid do //
analyzed: phyin ci log nyid ni phan tshun du mtshungs pa nyid do //
translated: The error is the mutual similarity.

original: des na bdag med pa mthong ba'i bzlog pa'i bdag tu lta ba zlog par byed par yang 'gyur bas na phyir mi ldog pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na bdag med pa mthong ba'i bzlog pa'i bdag tu lta ba zlog par byed par yang 'gyur bas na phyir mi ldog pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the view of self is reversed by the vision of selflessness, it is not irreversible.

original: des na ma lus par ldog pa yang med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: des na ma lus par ldog pa yang med pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that it is completely reversed.

original: slar ldog pa las lus pa gzhan ni yod pa yang ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: slar ldog pa las lus pa gzhan ni yod pa yang ma yin no zhe na /
translated: And there is no other remainder of the reversal.

original: 'dir 'di skad brjod de /
analyzed: 'dir 'di skad brjod de /
translated: Here, this is said:

original: de bden tha dad bdag nyid kyis //üîΩlus ngag sems kyis gnas ngan len //
analyzed: de bden tha dad bdag nyid kyis // lus ngag sems kyis gnas ngan len //
translated: That is true, but by a different nature.üîΩThe negative reflex is in body, speech, and mind.

original: nyon mongs med dang nad med dang // lam bshad mi gsal nyid lus yin //
analyzed: nyon mongs med dang nad med dang // lam bshad mi gsal nyid lus yin //
translated: The explanation of the path is unclear.

original: bdag med pa mthong ba de ni bden pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / phyin ci log tu 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: bdag med pa mthong ba de ni bden pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / phyin ci log tu 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir la /
translated: That vision of selflessness is true, and it is an error,

original: bdag tu lta ba ni de las zlog pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba ni de las zlog pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and the view of self is its opposite.

original: phyin ci log par 'gyur ba yin yang /
analyzed: phyin ci log par 'gyur ba yin yang /
translated: Even though it is an error,

original: phyin ci log tu gyur pa tsam gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: phyin ci log tu gyur pa tsam gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: it is not merely an error.

original: tha dad pa'i bdag nyid kyang yin no //
analyzed: tha dad pa'i bdag nyid kyang yin no //
translated: But they are also different.

original: bdag tu lta ba ni tha dad pa'i bdag nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba ni tha dad pa'i bdag nyid ma yin te /
translated: The view of self is not different,

original: don dam par bdag med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: don dam par bdag med pa'i phyir te /
translated: because ultimately there is no self,

original: bdag ni bden pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag ni bden pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the self is not real.

original: 'o na phyin ci log las @109b gzhan pa'i lus pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na phyin ci log las @109b gzhan pa'i lus pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the remainder that is not a mistake?

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here it is said:

original: lus ngag sems kyi gnas ngan len //
analyzed: lus ngag sems kyi gnas ngan len //
translated: The negative reflex actions of body, speech, and mind.

original: gal te nyon mongs pa med pas nyon mongs pas byas pa ga las srid ce na /
analyzed: gal te nyon mongs pa med pas nyon mongs pas byas pa ga las srid ce na /
translated: If there is no passion, how can there be that which is produced by passion?

original: ma yin te /üîΩnyon mongs pa med pa dang nad med pa yin yang /
analyzed: ma yin te / nyon mongs pa med pa dang nad med pa yin yang /
translated: It is not so,

original: bag chags tsam dang 'brel pa las te /
analyzed: bag chags tsam dang 'brel pa las te /
translated: because even though there is no passion, there is a mere connection with the residual impression of passion,

original: dmangs so zhes brjod pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dmangs so zhes brjod pa bzhin no //
translated: just as one is called a layman even though he is not a householder.

original: lam gyi rnam pa du ma brjod pa la mi gsal ba yang yin no //
analyzed: lam gyi rnam pa du ma brjod pa la mi gsal ba yang yin no //
translated: And there is also the lack of clarity in the many descriptions of the aspects of the path.

original: 'o na lhag ma de gang las spong ba yin /
analyzed: 'o na lhag ma de gang las spong ba yin /
translated: What is the remainder from which it is abandoned?

original: bdag med pas ma spangs pa ni spong ba'i rgyu gzhan yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag med pas ma spangs pa ni spong ba'i rgyu gzhan yod pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not abandoned by the absence of self, because there is no other cause for its abandonment.

original: ji srid smra ba de srid du ni nyes pa dang bral ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: ji srid smra ba de srid du ni nyes pa dang bral ba yang ma yin te /
translated: As long as there is speech, there is no freedom from faults.üîΩSince speech is preceded by conceptualization, the Omniscient One would be mistaken.üîΩIn response, Aryadeva says: Because of habituation, it is completely abandoned.üîΩSome say, ‚ÄúBecause of speech, etc., it is not abandoned.‚ÄùüîΩThis is refuted.

original: smra ba ni rtog dpyod sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa ni 'khrul pa nyid yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: smra ba ni rtog dpyod sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa ni 'khrul pa nyid yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Because of doubt, there is a mistake.

original: bshad pa / goms phyir ma lus spangs pa nyid //
analyzed: bshad pa / goms phyir ma lus spangs pa nyid //
translated: We have already explained that because of habituation, the mind becomes clear and, therefore, the latent dispositions are abandoned.üîΩNor does one become guilty of a fault merely by speaking.

original: kha cig smra sogs phyir na skyon //
analyzed: kha cig smra sogs phyir na skyon //
translated: Some say, ‚ÄúBecause of speech, etc., the fault is not abandoned.‚ÄùüîΩThe reason is not established.üîΩThe reason is contradictory.üîΩThe reason is doubtful.üîΩThe reason is not stated.

original: zad min zhes zer 'di ldog la //
analyzed: zad min zhes zer 'di ldog la //
translated: The reason is inconclusive.üîΩThe reason is not accepted.üîΩThe reason is not ascertained.üîΩThe reason is not established.üîΩThe reason is contradictory.

original: the tshom za ba de phyir 'khrul //
analyzed: the tshom za ba de phyir 'khrul //
translated: The reason is doubtful.üîΩThe reason is inconclusive.üîΩThe reason is not accepted.üîΩThe reason is not ascertained.üîΩThe reason is not established.üîΩThe reason is contradictory.

original: gang gi phyir goms pas blo gsal bar byas pa de'i phyir bag chags spangs pa yin no zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: gang gi phyir goms pas blo gsal bar byas pa de'i phyir bag chags spangs pa yin no zhes bshad zin to //
translated: The reason is doubtful.üîΩThe reason is inconclusive.

original: smra ba tsam gyis ni nyes pa dang ldan par 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: smra ba tsam gyis ni nyes pa dang ldan par 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
translated: The reason is not accepted.üîΩThe reason is not ascertained.üîΩThe reason is not established.üîΩThe reason is contradictory.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa /
translated: The reason is doubtful.üîΩThe reason is inconclusive.üîΩThe reason is not accepted.üîΩThe reason is not ascertained.üîΩThe reason is not established.üîΩThe reason is contradictory.üîΩThe reason is doubtful.üîΩThe reason is inconclusive.üîΩThe reason is not accepted.üîΩThe reason is not ascertained.üîΩThe reason is not established.üîΩThe reason is contradictory.üîΩThe reason is doubtful.üîΩThe reason is inconclusive.üîΩThe reason is not accepted.üîΩThe reason is not ascertained.üîΩThe reason is not established.üîΩThe reason is contradictory.üîΩThe reason is doubtful.üîΩThe reason is inconclusive.üîΩThe reason is not accepted.üîΩThe reason is not ascertained.üîΩThe reason is not established.üîΩThe reason is contradictory.üîΩThe reason is doubtful.üîΩThe reason is inconclusive.üîΩThe reason is not accepted.üîΩThe reason is not ascertained.üîΩThe reason is not established.üîΩThe reason is contradictory.üîΩThe reason is doubtful.üîΩThe reason is inconclusive.üîΩThe reason is not accepted.

original: bsgrub pa la smra ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa'i mtshan nyid ldog pa la the tshom za ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgrub pa la smra ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa'i mtshan nyid ldog pa la the tshom za ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The reason is not ascertained.üîΩThe reason is not established.üîΩThe reason is contradictory.üîΩThe reason is

original: des na 'di ldog pa la the tshom za ba yin pa'i phyir go bar byed pa ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: des na 'di ldog pa la the tshom za ba yin pa'i phyir go bar byed pa ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, since there is doubt about the reversal of this, it is not a means of understanding.

original: tshig ni rnam par rtog pa bsgrub pa la yang 'khrul pa can yin te shin tu goms pa las rnam par rtog pa med kyang tshig 'jug pa'i phyir /
analyzed: tshig ni rnam par rtog pa bsgrub pa la yang 'khrul pa can yin te shin tu goms pa las rnam par rtog pa med kyang tshig 'jug pa'i phyir /
translated: Words are also mistaken in establishing concepts, because even without concepts, words are used due to extreme familiarity.

original: 'phen pa'i shugs kyis tshig 'jug pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'phen pa'i shugs kyis tshig 'jug pa kho na'o //
translated: Words are used only by the momentum of projection.

original: bshad zin pa'i rnam pa thams cad rnam rtog ni //
analyzed: bshad zin pa'i rnam pa thams cad rnam rtog ni //
translated: All aspects explained are concepts.

original: mngon sum las dbyer yod ma yin //üîΩgsal bar mi snang ba nyid las //
analyzed: mngon sum las dbyer yod ma yin // gsal bar mi snang ba nyid las //
translated: They cannot be distinguished from perception.

original: sgra 'jug pa yang ma yin te //
analyzed: sgra 'jug pa yang ma yin te //
translated: It is not that words are used due to the mere non-appearance of clarity.

original: mngon sum gyis mthong ka sogs las //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis mthong ka sogs las //
translated: Words are used due to the appearance of clarity.üîΩThis is because words are used in relation to what is seen by perception,

original: 'di ni ka ba yin no zhes //
analyzed: 'di ni ka ba yin no zhes //
translated: saying This is a pillar.

original: sgra 'jug phyir ro gzhan du na //
analyzed: sgra 'jug phyir ro gzhan du na //
translated: Otherwise,

original: 'di 'jug pa ni med par 'gyur//üîΩ'dir ni shes pa mi gsal bar //
analyzed: 'di 'jug pa ni med par 'gyur// 'dir ni shes pa mi gsal bar //
translated: their use would be nonexistent.üîΩHere, there is no realization of the appearance

original: snang ba rtogs pa yod ma yin //
analyzed: snang ba rtogs pa yod ma yin //
translated: in unclear cognition.

original: de bzhin du ni gzhan la yang //
analyzed: de bzhin du ni gzhan la yang //
translated: In the same way,

original: sgra 'jug pa bzlog pa med pa'i de'i phyir smra yang nyes pa yod pa ma yin no zhes 'grub bo //
analyzed: sgra 'jug pa bzlog pa med pa'i de'i phyir smra yang nyes pa yod pa ma yin no zhes 'grub bo //
translated: Therefore, even though one speaks, there is no fault.

original: gal te gzhan las nyes pa rnams zad pa yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ji ltar nyes pa med par 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te gzhan las nyes pa rnams zad pa yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ji ltar nyes pa med par 'gyur /
translated: If there is no exhaustion of faults from another, how can there be the absence of faults?

original: @110a * // nyes pa zad pa med pa'i rgyu mthong ba nyid las so //üîΩnyes pa zad pa med pa'i rgyu ma mthong ba tsam gyis ni /
analyzed: @110a * // nyes pa zad pa med pa'i rgyu mthong ba nyid las so // nyes pa zad pa med pa'i rgyu ma mthong ba tsam gyis ni /
translated: The cause of the non-exhaustion of faults is the very non-seeing.

original: nyes zad pa med pa nyid ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: nyes zad pa med pa nyid ma yin no zhe na /
translated: The mere non-seeing of the cause of the exhaustion of faults is not the non-exhaustion of faults.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: mthong bar ji ltar rtogs par byed de //
analyzed: mthong bar ji ltar rtogs par byed de //
translated: How can one understand the non-seeing?

original: rtag nyid phyir ram thabs med phyir //
analyzed: rtag nyid phyir ram thabs med phyir //
translated: Because of permanence, or because of the absence of means,

original: yang na thabs ni mi shes phyir //
analyzed: yang na thabs ni mi shes phyir //
translated: or because of the non-understanding of the means,

original: skyon rnams mi zad pa nyid ces //üîΩbya bar yongs su rtogs grang na //
analyzed: skyon rnams mi zad pa nyid ces // bya bar yongs su rtogs grang na //
translated: it is said that the faults are not exhausted.üîΩIf one understands in this way,

original: ji ltar yang rung ba rtogs par 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar yang rung ba rtogs par 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni ma yin te /
translated: then it is not the case that one engages in understanding in any way whatsoever.

original: 'on kyang rgyu mthong ba'i them skas kyi lam yod pa las yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang rgyu mthong ba'i them skas kyi lam yod pa las yin no //
translated: However, it is because the path of the staircase of seeing the cause exists.

original: gal te nyes pa 'di dag rtag pa yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te nyes pa 'di dag rtag pa yin na ni /
translated: If these faults were permanent,

original: 'bad kyang zad par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'bad kyang zad par mi 'gyur te /
translated: they would not be exhausted even with effort.

original: rtag pa ni 'bad pa byas kyang zad par bya nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rtag pa ni 'bad pa byas kyang zad par bya nus pa ma yin no //
translated: For a permanent thing cannot be exhausted even with effort.

original: yang zad pa la thabs med dam //
analyzed: yang zad pa la thabs med dam //
translated: But is there no means of exhausting them?

original: mi dmigs pa yin na de lta na yang mi zad par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa yin na de lta na yang mi zad par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If they are not perceived, they would not be exhausted even then.

original: 'di gsum ka yang yod pa ma yin te //
analyzed: 'di gsum ka yang yod pa ma yin te //
translated: But none of these three is the case.

original: rgyu yod phyir dang rgyu yis ni //
analyzed: rgyu yod phyir dang rgyu yis ni //
translated: Because there is a cause, and becauseüîΩthey are exhausted by the cultivation of the antidote, and because

original: gnyen po goms pas zad phyir dang // rgyu yi rang bzhin shes pa yis //
analyzed: gnyen po goms pas zad phyir dang // rgyu yi rang bzhin shes pa yis //
translated: the nature of the cause is known,

original: de shes pa yang grub pa yin //
analyzed: de shes pa yang grub pa yin //
translated: the knowledge of that is established.

original: rgyu dang ldan pa ni snga na med pa yin pa'i phyir rtag pa ma yin no //üîΩgang gi tshe rgyu'i gnyen po goms par byes pa de'i tshe zad par 'gyur bas na thabs med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu dang ldan pa ni snga na med pa yin pa'i phyir rtag pa ma yin no // gang gi tshe rgyu'i gnyen po goms par byes pa de'i tshe zad par 'gyur bas na thabs med pa ma yin te /
translated: That which has a cause is not permanent, because it is not existent before.üîΩAnd they are not inexhaustible because they are exhausted by the cultivation of the antidote to the cause.

original: rgyu'i gnyen po goms pa ni nyes pa zad pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu'i gnyen po goms pa ni nyes pa zad pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The cultivation of the antidote to the cause is the cause of the exhaustion of the faults.üîΩAnd they are not completely unknown,

original: de yongs su mi shes pa'ang ma yin te /
analyzed: de yongs su mi shes pa'ang ma yin te /
translated: because

original: rgyu'i rang bzhin bdag dang bdag gir lta ba'i rnam pa nyid shes pas de las bzlog pa'i gnyen po shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu'i rang bzhin bdag dang bdag gir lta ba'i rnam pa nyid shes pas de las bzlog pa'i gnyen po shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the nature of the cause is the view of self and ‚Äúmine,‚Äù and the antidote is the knowledge that is the opposite of that.

original: gang zhig gang las phyin ci log tu gyur pa de ni de'i gnyen po yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang las phyin ci log tu gyur pa de ni de'i gnyen po yin te /
translated: Whatever is erroneous with regard to something is the antidote to that.

original: grang ba dang rtsub pa'i rang bzhin gyi rlung la dro ba dang snum pa nyid kyis til mar bzhin no //
analyzed: grang ba dang rtsub pa'i rang bzhin gyi rlung la dro ba dang snum pa nyid kyis til mar bzhin no //
translated: For example, oil is the antidote to the wind that has the nature of cold and roughness.

original: mthu la sogs pa'i khyad par med pas phyi rol gyi gnyen po ma yin yang /
analyzed: mthu la sogs pa'i khyad par med pas phyi rol gyi gnyen po ma yin yang /
translated: Although external antidotes do not have the distinction of power, etc.,

original: bdag med pa ni bdag tu lta ba dang 'gal ba yin zhes bya ba la log rtogs med pa nyid do //
analyzed: bdag med pa ni bdag tu lta ba dang 'gal ba yin zhes bya ba la log rtogs med pa nyid do //
translated: it is said that selflessness is the antidote to the view of self, but there is no error in that.

original: gal te yang bcom ldan 'das bde bar gshegs pa nyid yin pa de lta na yang 'di rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa nyid yin pas ji ltar gzhan dag la tshad ma yin /
analyzed: gal te yang bcom ldan 'das bde bar gshegs pa nyid yin pa de lta na yang 'di rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa nyid yin pas ji ltar gzhan dag la tshad ma yin /
translated: Even if the Blessed One is the Well-Gone One, since this is the perfection of his own purpose, how can he be a valid cognition for others?

original: tshad ma ni phyin ci ma log pa'i don ston pas yin te /
analyzed: tshad ma ni phyin ci ma log pa'i don ston pas yin te /
translated: A valid cognition is one that teaches an object that is nonerroneous.

original: phyin ci log ston pa'am /
analyzed: phyin ci log ston pa'am /
translated: It is not one that teaches an erroneous object.

original: mi ston pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: mi ston pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But it is not that he does not teach.

original: de ni med de /
analyzed: de ni med de /
translated: This is not so.

original: bcom ldan 'das thugs rje'i dbang gis dang / thabs @110b goms pa las skyob pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das thugs rje'i dbang gis dang / thabs @110b goms pa las skyob pa nyid yin na /
translated: If the Blessed One is a protector due to the power of his compassion and his mastery of skillful means,

original: skyob pa nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: skyob pa nyid gang zhe na /
translated: what is his protection?

original: bshad pa / skyob pa nyid gzigs lam gsung ba //üîΩ'bras med phyir na brdzun mi gsung //
analyzed: bshad pa / skyob pa nyid gzigs lam gsung ba // 'bras med phyir na brdzun mi gsung //
translated: We reply: He is a protector because he sees the path to peace,

original: thugs brtser ldan phyir rtsom kun yang //
analyzed: thugs brtser ldan phyir rtsom kun yang //
translated: because he does not speak falsely, because he is compassionate,

original: gzhan gyi don du sbyor phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don du sbyor phyir ro //
translated: and because he is engaged in the welfare of others.

original: gang gis skyob pa nyid srid pa rig byed la 'gas kyang mthong ba yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gis skyob pa nyid srid pa rig byed la 'gas kyang mthong ba yod pa ma yin te /
translated: No one has ever seen a protector in the Vedas,

original: rtsa ba med pa'i rtogs pa tsam yin no //
analyzed: rtsa ba med pa'i rtogs pa tsam yin no //
translated: because they are mere fabrications without a basis.

original: gang bde bar gshegs pa nyid yin pa de la ni mngon par 'dod pa 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang bde bar gshegs pa nyid yin pa de la ni mngon par 'dod pa 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: One who is a Sugata has no desire at all,

original: des na 'bras bu med pa'i phyir brdzun mi gsung ngo //
analyzed: des na 'bras bu med pa'i phyir brdzun mi gsung ngo //
translated: so he does not speak falsely because he has no result.

original: brtse ba dang ldan pa'i phyir gzhan gyi don du thabs goms par mdzad pa yin te /
analyzed: brtse ba dang ldan pa'i phyir gzhan gyi don du thabs goms par mdzad pa yin te /
translated: He is compassionate, and he is engaged in the welfare of others because he is skilled in means.

original: de'i phyir phyin ci log tu gsung ba'i rgyu med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir phyin ci log tu gsung ba'i rgyu med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no reason for the Buddha to speak falsely.

original: des na thugs rje mnga' ba'i phyir dang / dgos pa med pa'i phyir de kho na nyid ma yin pa mi gsung ngo //
analyzed: des na thugs rje mnga' ba'i phyir dang / dgos pa med pa'i phyir de kho na nyid ma yin pa mi gsung ngo //
translated: Thus, because he is compassionate and because there is no need, he does not speak what is not reality.

original: thugs rje dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / 'phen pa'i shugs las mi gsung ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: thugs rje dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / 'phen pa'i shugs las mi gsung ba yang ma yin no //
translated: Because he is compassionate, he does not speak from the momentum of his former vow.

original: des na bde bar gshegs pa yin pas tshad ma nyid yin te /
analyzed: des na bde bar gshegs pa yin pas tshad ma nyid yin te /
translated: Therefore, because he is the Sugata, he is a valid cognizer,

original: nyid kyis gzigs pa thar pa'i lam ston pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyid kyis gzigs pa thar pa'i lam ston pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he teaches the path of liberation that he himself has seen.

original: gal te rang gis mthong ba ston pa zhes bya ba de tsam gyis ni skyob pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te rang gis mthong ba ston pa zhes bya ba de tsam gyis ni skyob pa ma yin te /
translated: If it is argued that he is not a protector merely by teaching what he himself has seen,

original: de lta yin na mu stegs byed mtha' dag tshad mar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta yin na mu stegs byed mtha' dag tshad mar 'gyur te /
translated: then all the tƒ´rthikas would be valid because

original: rang gis mthong ba'i lam ston pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'on te de dag gis de ni lam brjod pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gis mthong ba'i lam ston pa'i phyir ro // 'on te de dag gis de ni lam brjod pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: they teach the path that they themselves have seen.

original: de lam ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de lam ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If it is argued that they are not valid because they do not teach the path,

original: 'o na 'di la yang ci ltar yid ces zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na 'di la yang ci ltar yid ces zhe na /
translated: then why is this one valid?

original: 'di la bshad zin te /
analyzed: 'di la bshad zin te /
translated: This has already been explained.

original: de ni bdag med pa mthong ba'am sbyor ba las yin no //
analyzed: de ni bdag med pa mthong ba'am sbyor ba las yin no //
translated: This is because they see selflessness or they are based on the path of seeing.

original: lam 'di ni rigs pas mthong ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lam 'di ni rigs pas mthong ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This path is seen by reasoning.

original: de dag gis ni bdag med pa mthong ba ma yin la /
analyzed: de dag gis ni bdag med pa mthong ba ma yin la /
translated: They do not see selflessness,

original: rigs pa yang ma yin pa'i phyir de dag ni tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: rigs pa yang ma yin pa'i phyir de dag ni tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: and because they are not based on reasoning, they are not valid cognitions.

original: de dag ni rang gis mthong ba nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni rang gis mthong ba nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: They do not even see by themselves,

original: nye bar bstan pa phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye bar bstan pa phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because their teachings contradict each other.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni /
translated: The Bhagavat

original: de phyir tshad yin yang na skyob //
analyzed: de phyir tshad yin yang na skyob //
translated: is the valid cognition, or the protector,

original: bden pa bzhi ni ston pa'o //
analyzed: bden pa bzhi ni ston pa'o //
translated: because he teaches the four noble truths.

original: yang na bden pa bzhi ston par mdzad pa /
analyzed: yang na bden pa bzhi ston par mdzad pa /
translated: Or, he is the protector because he teaches the four noble truths.

original: skyob pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: skyob pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: He is not the other.

original: gal te yang rig byed kyi mtha' dag la stong pa nyid ston par byed pa yod na de lta na yang bdag yod pa'i phyir de ni lam ma yin pas /
analyzed: gal te yang rig byed kyi mtha' dag la stong pa nyid ston par byed pa yod na de lta na yang bdag yod pa'i phyir de ni lam ma yin pas /
translated: If the entire Veda teaches emptiness, then, because it teaches the existence of the self, it is not the path.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi ston pa nyid skyob pa @111a * //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi ston pa nyid skyob pa @111a * //
translated: Therefore, the one who teaches the four noble truths is the protector.

original: yin no // de na bcom ldan 'das nyag gcig thun mong ma yin pa'i don gsungs pa yin pa des na bden pa nyid yin pas /
analyzed: yin no // de na bcom ldan 'das nyag gcig thun mong ma yin pa'i don gsungs pa yin pa des na bden pa nyid yin pas /
translated: The Blessed One alone, in fact, has spoken the truth, since he has spoken the unique and uncommon meaning.

original: 'di nyid skyob pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di nyid skyob pa yin no //
translated: This is why he is the Protector.

original: lam 'di ni rigs pa dang bral yang ma'i 'du shes bzhin du nye bar zhi ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir na gzhan gyis bstan pa ni lam ma yin no //
analyzed: lam 'di ni rigs pa dang bral yang ma'i 'du shes bzhin du nye bar zhi ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir na gzhan gyis bstan pa ni lam ma yin no //
translated: This path, even though it is devoid of reasoning, is the cause of the appeasement of suffering, like the idea of a mother. The path taught by others is not the path.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa de dag kyang gang zhe na /üîΩsdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung dang / 'gog pa dang / lam mo //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa de dag kyang gang zhe na / sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung dang / 'gog pa dang / lam mo //
translated: What are the noble truths?üîΩSuffering, origin, cessation, path.

original: 'di dag ni ming gis kyang skyo ba 'gyur ba yin te dper na gci ba'i lam zhes bya bas yin gyi yan lag mchog ces bya ba ni ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di dag ni ming gis kyang skyo ba 'gyur ba yin te dper na gci ba'i lam zhes bya bas yin gyi yan lag mchog ces bya ba ni ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: These truths are also called the four noble truths, because they are the object of the noble ones‚Äô direct realization. They are also called the four truths of the noble ones, because they are the object of the noble ones‚Äô direct realization. They are also called the four truths of suffering, etc., because they are the truth of suffering, etc.

original: de la / sdug bsngal 'khor ba can phung po //
analyzed: de la / sdug bsngal 'khor ba can phung po //
translated: Suffering is the aggregates in the process of being produced.

original: goms las 'dod chags sogs gsal ba //
analyzed: goms las 'dod chags sogs gsal ba //
translated: Desire, etc., are the origin, because they are the cause of the production of suffering.üîΩThe cessation of suffering is the truth of cessation, because it is the cessation of suffering.

original: mthong phyir 'dod rgyal nyid min te //
analyzed: mthong phyir 'dod rgyal nyid min te //
translated: The path is the truth of the path, because it is the means of attaining cessation.üîΩThe truth of suffering is the five aggregates as objects of clinging.üîΩDesire, hatred, and delusion are the origin, because they are the cause of the production of suffering.

original: rgyu med skye ba 'gal phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu med skye ba 'gal phyir ro //
translated: The truth of cessation is not accidental, because it is the cessation of suffering.üîΩThe truth of the path is not accidental, because it is the means of attaining cessation.

original: gal te 'dod chags mngon par 'dod pa'i bud med mchog la 'khyud pa'i yan lag nyid kyis bde ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir bde ba nyid yin zhing /
analyzed: gal te 'dod chags mngon par 'dod pa'i bud med mchog la 'khyud pa'i yan lag nyid kyis bde ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir bde ba nyid yin zhing /
translated: If the embrace of a woman who is the object of one‚Äôs desire is the cause of pleasure because it is the cause of pleasure,

original: zhe sdang yang dgra bo sel bar byed pas bde ba'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: zhe sdang yang dgra bo sel bar byed pas bde ba'i rgyu yin no //
translated: then hatred is the cause of pleasure because it is the cause of eliminating enemies.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i mtshan nyid dang 'dzin pa'i gti mug ni /üîΩnga rgyal dang rgyags pa /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i mtshan nyid dang 'dzin pa'i gti mug ni / nga rgyal dang rgyags pa /
translated: The delusion of the view of the transitory collection and its graspingüîΩare the cause of pride, arrogance, and conceit,

original: dregs pa'i rgyu yin pas bde ba nyid do //
analyzed: dregs pa'i rgyu yin pas bde ba nyid do //
translated: so they are pleasure.

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa'i rten du gyur pa lus la sogs pa yang de lta bu nyid yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal zhes bya ba med do //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa'i rten du gyur pa lus la sogs pa yang de lta bu nyid yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal zhes bya ba med do //
translated: The body and so on, which are the basis of attachment, hatred, and so on, are also like that, so they are not called suffering.

original: bkres pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gang yin pa de yang 'grangs pa ni bde ba'i rgyu chen po yin no //
analyzed: bkres pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gang yin pa de yang 'grangs pa ni bde ba'i rgyu chen po yin no //
translated: The suffering of hunger and so on is also the great cause of pleasure when one is satiated.

original: des na sdug bsngal gyi bde ba zhes bya ba med pas bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa 'bras bu med pa skyob pa nyid ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: des na sdug bsngal gyi bde ba zhes bya ba med pas bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa 'bras bu med pa skyob pa nyid ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, since there is no so-called pleasure of suffering, the teaching of the Bhagavat is fruitless and not a refuge.‚Äù

original: 'di ni yang dag pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni yang dag pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: This is not correct.

original: 'di ltar 'khor ba'i lam du zhugs 'gyur te /üîΩyongs su ngal bas bde ba nyams pa yi //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'khor ba'i lam du zhugs 'gyur te / yongs su ngal bas bde ba nyams pa yi //
translated: Because one would enter the path of cyclic existence in this way.üîΩThe aggregates are the great suffering,

original: phung nyid sdug bsngal chen po ste //
analyzed: phung nyid sdug bsngal chen po ste //
translated: due to the exhaustion of pleasure from complete fatigue.

original: ma rig pas ni gzhan du mthong //
analyzed: ma rig pas ni gzhan du mthong //
translated: One sees otherwise due to ignorance.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i bde ba rgyu yin no zhes gang smras pa de las brjod pa ni /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i bde ba rgyu yin no zhes gang smras pa de las brjod pa ni /
translated: As for what was said, ‚ÄúDesire, etc. are the cause of pleasure,‚Äù the response to that is:

original: 'dod chags goms pa'i rgyu can te //
analyzed: 'dod chags goms pa'i rgyu can te //
translated: The cause of the habit of desire

original: bde ba'ang de med mi 'byung min //
analyzed: bde ba'ang de med mi 'byung min //
translated: is not pleasure, which does not occur without it.

original: goms pa yod med rjes 'jug phyir //
analyzed: goms pa yod med rjes 'jug phyir //
translated: Because of the conformity of habit, whether it exists or not,

original: ngo bo nyid du grub pa min //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid du grub pa min //
translated: it is not established by its intrinsic reality.

original: gal te 'dod chags la sogs pa dang / bde ba la sogs pa 'dod rgyal du skyes pa'am @111b rtag pa yin na de'i tshe 'thad pa zhig na /
analyzed: gal te 'dod chags la sogs pa dang / bde ba la sogs pa 'dod rgyal du skyes pa'am @111b rtag pa yin na de'i tshe 'thad pa zhig na /
translated: If desire, etc. and pleasure, etc. were to arise by chance or were permanent, then that would be reasonable.

original: gang gi tshe de nyid las gsal ba la sogs par mthong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de nyid las gsal ba la sogs par mthong ba'i phyir /
translated: But because they are seen to change,

original: goms pa nyid las 'gyur ba yin pa de'i phyir yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun du rtog pa tsam yin no //
analyzed: goms pa nyid las 'gyur ba yin pa de'i phyir yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun du rtog pa tsam yin no //
translated: they are due to habit alone. Therefore they are mere false imagination.

original: des na goms pa dor ba nyid dge ste /
analyzed: des na goms pa dor ba nyid dge ste /
translated: Therefore, it is good to give up practice.

original: byis rtseng goms pa bzhin no //
analyzed: byis rtseng goms pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the practice of children‚Äôs play.

original: des na don dam par bde ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na don dam par bde ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, there is no happiness in the ultimate sense.

original: bde ba ni sems mngon par dag pa'i mtshan nyid goms pa las 'byung ba yin pas /
analyzed: bde ba ni sems mngon par dag pa'i mtshan nyid goms pa las 'byung ba yin pas /
translated: Happiness arises from the practice of the characteristics of a pure mind.

original: 'khor ba'i chos ldog par byed pa yin pas de kho na goms par byas pa nyid mchog yin no //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i chos ldog par byed pa yin pas de kho na goms par byas pa nyid mchog yin no //
translated: Therefore, the practice of reality itself is supreme, since it turns away from the phenomena of cyclic existence.

original: sdug bsngal yang goms pa las 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang goms pa las 'dod pa yin te /
translated: Suffering is also desired from practice.

original: btang snyoms nyid mchog yin no //
analyzed: btang snyoms nyid mchog yin no //
translated: Equanimity is supreme.

original: de lta yin dang sdug bsngal gyis gdungs pa'i mtha' dag de ltar snang ba can yin no //
analyzed: de lta yin dang sdug bsngal gyis gdungs pa'i mtha' dag de ltar snang ba can yin no //
translated: If that is so, then all those tormented by suffering have that appearance.

original: de nas 'dod chags la sogs pa'i gdung ba bsal ba nyid mchog yin gyi /
analyzed: de nas 'dod chags la sogs pa'i gdung ba bsal ba nyid mchog yin gyi /
translated: Then, the removal of the torment of passion, etc. is supreme.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa yod par 'gyur ba na /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa yod par 'gyur ba na /
translated: When passion, etc. exist,

original: bud med la 'khyud pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bud med la 'khyud pa ni ma yin no //
translated: it is not the case that one embraces a woman.

original: blo bzang 'ga' yang rma btod de //
analyzed: blo bzang 'ga' yang rma btod de //
translated: Some good people have been deceived

original: de yi gdung ba zhi ba las //
analyzed: de yi gdung ba zhi ba las //
translated: by the removal of the torment of that.

original: phyis nas bde ba 'dod pa med //
analyzed: phyis nas bde ba 'dod pa med //
translated: Later, there is no desire for happiness.

original: de lta na ni blo med nyid //
analyzed: de lta na ni blo med nyid //
translated: If it is so, then there is no mind.

original: gal te de ni 'gyur med na //
analyzed: gal te de ni 'gyur med na //
translated: If it is not changed,

original: blo ni de nyid la dga' gyis //
analyzed: blo ni de nyid la dga' gyis //
translated: the mind is pleased with it.

original: de las nyon mongs med pa yi //
analyzed: de las nyon mongs med pa yi //
translated: From it, there is no affliction,

original: bde ba rtag tu 'jug par 'gyur //
analyzed: bde ba rtag tu 'jug par 'gyur //
translated: and happiness always occurs.

original: gal te de nyid min dga' na //
analyzed: gal te de nyid min dga' na //
translated: If it is not pleased with it,

original: log na de bde ga la yod //
analyzed: log na de bde ga la yod //
translated: when it is lost, how can there be happiness?

original: de nyid log pa med pas na //
analyzed: de nyid log pa med pas na //
translated: Since it is not lost,

original: bde ba yang ni log mi byed //
analyzed: bde ba yang ni log mi byed //
translated: happiness also is not lost.

original: de'i phyir 'khor ba'i bde ba gang ci snyed de /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'khor ba'i bde ba gang ci snyed de /
translated: Therefore, whatever happiness there is in cyclic existence,

original: de mtha' dag ni don dam par sdug bsngal ba nyid do //üîΩ'di ltar / ji ltar 'dod chags la sogs pa'i //
analyzed: de mtha' dag ni don dam par sdug bsngal ba nyid do // 'di ltar / ji ltar 'dod chags la sogs pa'i //
translated: all of it is ultimately suffering.üîΩThus:üîΩJust as you see that suffering

original: sdug bsngal bde ba'i rgyur mthong ba //üîΩde bzhin bde ba'ang sdug bsngal gyi //
analyzed: sdug bsngal bde ba'i rgyur mthong ba // de bzhin bde ba'ang sdug bsngal gyi //
translated: from desire, etc. is the cause of happiness,üîΩso you should understand that happiness

original: rgyu nyid du ni rtogs par gyis //üîΩdper na bkres pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal dag /'grangs pa ni bde ba'i rgyu yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: rgyu nyid du ni rtogs par gyis // dper na bkres pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal dag /'grangs pa ni bde ba'i rgyu yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: is also the cause of suffering.üîΩFor example, the suffering of hunger, etc. is the cause of happiness when you are satiated.

original: bde ba yang bral ba na shin tu sdug bsngal ba'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: bde ba yang bral ba na shin tu sdug bsngal ba'i rgyu yin no //
translated: In the same way, when you are separated from happiness, it is the cause of great suffering.

original: des na bde ba ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir de ni bde ba nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: des na bde ba ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir de ni bde ba nyid ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since pleasure is the cause of pain, it is not pleasure.

original: de lta yin dang / sdug bsngal 'khor ba can phung po zhes bya ba de grub pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta yin dang / sdug bsngal 'khor ba can phung po zhes bya ba de grub pa yin te /
translated: If that is so, then the so-called samsaric aggregates that are painful are established.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa ni goms pa las gsal ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa ni goms pa las gsal ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because attachment and so on are clear due to habituation.

original: gang gi phyir goms pa las yin pa de'i phyir /üîΩrigs @112a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir goms pa las yin pa de'i phyir / rigs @112a * //
translated: Since that is so,

original: mthun pa snga ma snga ma de lta bu rgyu'i rgyu can yin pa'i phyir 'khor ba pa yang grub bo //
analyzed: mthun pa snga ma snga ma de lta bu rgyu'i rgyu can yin pa'i phyir 'khor ba pa yang grub bo //
translated: the samsaric aggregates are established because the prior homogeneous cause is the cause of the subsequent homogeneous cause.

original: gal te 'dod chags la sogs pa goms pa las ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te 'dod chags la sogs pa goms pa las ni ma yin gyi /
translated: If attachment and so on do not arise from habituation,

original: 'on kyang rnam pa 'ga' zhig ltar /
analyzed: 'on kyang rnam pa 'ga' zhig ltar /
translated: but rather

original: gzhan las sam rgyu med par 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: gzhan las sam rgyu med par 'byung ba yin no //
translated: arise from another or without a cause,

original: des na bde ba la sogs pa 'di dag ni don dam pa nyid do //
analyzed: des na bde ba la sogs pa 'di dag ni don dam pa nyid do //
translated: then these such as pleasure are ultimate.

original: de'i phyir 'khor ba pa'i phung po ni sdug bsngal ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'khor ba pa'i phung po ni sdug bsngal ma yin no //
translated: Therefore the samsaric aggregates are not painful.

original: yang na ji ltar bde ba la sogs pa goms pa las yin pa de bzhin du sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa yang yin pas don dam par ma yin pa'i phyir 'khor ba'i phung po ni bde ba nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: yang na ji ltar bde ba la sogs pa goms pa las yin pa de bzhin du sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa yang yin pas don dam par ma yin pa'i phyir 'khor ba'i phung po ni bde ba nyid do zhe na /
translated: Or, just as pleasure, etc. are due to habituation, so also is pain, etc. Therefore, the aggregates of cyclic existence are pleasure itself, not ultimately.

original: 'di yang legs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di yang legs pa ma yin te /
translated: This is also not good.

original: 'dod rgyal ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dod rgyal ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not random,

original: gang gi phyir nam mkha' la sogs pa bzhin du rgyu med par skye ba ni mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir nam mkha' la sogs pa bzhin du rgyu med par skye ba ni mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not tenable that it arises without a cause, like space, etc.

original: bde ba la sogs pa rgyu gzhan dang ldan pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa rgyu gzhan dang ldan pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor does pleasure, etc. have another cause,

original: goms pa las gsal bar ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: goms pa las gsal bar ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is clear that it is due to habituation.

original: gang gis sdug bsngal goms pa las skyes par 'gyur ba sdug bsngal ni 'ga' yang goms par mi byed de /
analyzed: gang gis sdug bsngal goms pa las skyes par 'gyur ba sdug bsngal ni 'ga' yang goms par mi byed de /
translated: No one habituates himself in pain, because pain arises from habituation.

original: 'on kyang bde sogs 'phel ba'i bdag nyid can //üîΩgoms pa las 'jug gang yin pa //
analyzed: 'on kyang bde sogs 'phel ba'i bdag nyid can // goms pa las 'jug gang yin pa //
translated: But pleasure, etc. is due to the increase of the self.

original: de med sdug bsngal nyid 'gyur gyi //
analyzed: de med sdug bsngal nyid 'gyur gyi //
translated: That which is due to habituation is not pain,üîΩbecause it is pleasure that is due to habituation.

original: gang na sdug bsngal goms byed med //
analyzed: gang na sdug bsngal goms byed med //
translated: That which is due to habituation is not pain,üîΩbecause it is pleasure that is due to habituation.

original: nga la sdug bsngal yod par gyur cig ces sdug bsngal goms par byed pa ni su yang med de /
analyzed: nga la sdug bsngal yod par gyur cig ces sdug bsngal goms par byed pa ni su yang med de /
translated: No one cultivates the idea of suffering, thinking, ‚ÄúMay I have suffering!‚Äù

original: bde ba don du gnyer ba nyid kyis thams cad thams cad la 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba don du gnyer ba nyid kyis thams cad thams cad la 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because everyone is engaged in the pursuit of pleasure.

original: des na bde ba ni 'bad pas bsgrub par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: des na bde ba ni 'bad pas bsgrub par bya ba yin la /
translated: Therefore, pleasure is to be sought through effort.

original: sdug bsngal ni de med pa las rang bzhin du 'gyur ba yin gyi /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni de med pa las rang bzhin du 'gyur ba yin gyi /
translated: Suffering is natural, when pleasure is absent.

original: bzlog pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bzlog pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not the opposite of pleasure.

original: des na sdug bsngal yang bde ba goms par byas pa nyid kyis byas pa yin no //
analyzed: des na sdug bsngal yang bde ba goms par byas pa nyid kyis byas pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, suffering is produced by the cultivation of pleasure.

original: des na bde ba nyid bzlog par byas pa yin no //
analyzed: des na bde ba nyid bzlog par byas pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, pleasure is what is to be rejected.

original: don dam par ni sdug bsngal yang med pa nyid de /
analyzed: don dam par ni sdug bsngal yang med pa nyid de /
translated: But ultimately, there is no suffering.

original: de yang de la skrag pa goms pa nyid las sdug bsngal ba yin no //üîΩdes na de med pa'i phyir sdug bsngal de nyid dam /
analyzed: de yang de la skrag pa goms pa nyid las sdug bsngal ba yin no // des na de med pa'i phyir sdug bsngal de nyid dam /
translated: And that is suffering, because of the cultivation of fear of it.üîΩTherefore, because of the absence of that, there is the idea of pleasure in that very suffering,

original: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa la bde ba'i blor 'gyur ba yin la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa la bde ba'i blor 'gyur ba yin la /
translated: or in the absence of suffering and pleasure.

original: de med pa'i phyir yang bde ba 'am bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa la sdug bsngal gyi blor 'gyur ba yin gyi don dam par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir yang bde ba 'am bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa la sdug bsngal gyi blor 'gyur ba yin gyi don dam par ni ma yin no //
translated: Since that is not so, the idea of suffering with regard to pleasure or to that which is neither pleasure nor suffering is a mistake, not ultimate.

original: de'i phyir goms par byas @112b pa'i bde ba ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu nyid do /
analyzed: de'i phyir goms par byas @112b pa'i bde ba ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu nyid do /
translated: Therefore, the pleasure of the one who is accustomed to pleasure is the cause of suffering.

original: gal te de med na ni sdug bsngal yang med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te de med na ni sdug bsngal yang med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that is not so, then suffering would not exist.üîΩWhen a son dies, the one who is attached to the son suffers.

original: bu la chags pa la bu shi na sdug bsngal 'byung na /
analyzed: bu la chags pa la bu shi na sdug bsngal 'byung na /
translated: When the son is born, he is happy.üîΩBut that is not ultimate.üîΩThere is no one who is not separatedüîΩfrom the desired objects.üîΩAll the pleasure produced by the transmigratorüîΩbecomes suffering in the end.
